38892732.review:
This is a preliminary review, I will update review once I finished the whole game.

This is my second VN games I have played. My first VN game was Stein;Gate and it was impressive for extensive stories. So I decided to try Clannad, VN that I was familiar with because I watched the anime. I understand the game was pretty old and I know was little late for it. But I will make a review just for those who want to explore old visual novel games that was anime.

Overall games are nice, there an option of choices you can make throughout your games. However, I have landed in really bad ending one...

It brings me back to the main menu, Just because I reach an end where I don't pick any girls I encountered and by rejecting someone for the first time...

There aren't even ending credit for the bad one, it was really disappointing ending. It was like telling me "No, you must pick Nagisa route. Or go back then pick this other girl you left with, Ryou. based on how terrible my decision were." And I feel like the game was always forcing me all on Nagisa, which is ridiculous. I don't like it, I expected the VN to have a choice of our decision. 

Some of the problem such as:
[spoiler]- Not to live with Nagisa when she offers. [/spoiler]
Reason: I thought there could be another chance, or it's too early yet, wanted to see how the story will proceed if I did that. That decision was pretty much dead route instead... 

Toward my end, I was left with Ryou with the decision by following Kyou setup. I saved between. Then I decide to go along, she [spoiler] confess her feeling. My first choice was the rejection[/spoiler], The reason for that is, I feel like it was too early and barely have any bonding with her at all. I would blame the game, in the beginning, keeps forcing me with Nagisa. Barely any moments for Ryou or other people that the choice they left me. 

And even before I reach that bad ending, [spoiler] having to see her cries. [/spoiler]I went back to my save before everything happen to avoid Kyou setup, then it leads me to this bad ending instantly. I was confused. 

So I went back to continune where I left off before I reach that same bad ending, [spoiler]Ryou, I reject her then it lead me to eh same bad ending where Tomoya explaining that he went depress and stuff and then there a scene of cold winter lonely life... [/spoiler] Then it brings me back to menu screen. I'm like, really? It was really disappointing.

Like, come on!?! I haven't finish side stories of Fuko. Or even meet Kotomi!

I thought [spoiler] rejecting her [/spoiler] would lead:
- Next girl options
- More stories of others
- Back to Nagisa 
- Move on to next stories
But for some reason, it ends me just like that. I don't know if I was really unlucky or my decisions were really terrible that it end whole game like that. Not only that, it shows how pathetic Tomoya was, but that bad ending was just "bad" [spoiler]So what? He kill himself or something by avoiding Kyou setup + rejecting your first girl? So vague and ridiculous![/spoiler]

So because of that, I have to start over where I left my saves of important decisions. 


Overall the game is good, 
The thing I wish they would have is Tomoya voice narrating for what he said.
I would set preliminary review as not recommending for now. Because wow, the bad ending is bad, if you end up like my ending. But if you have patience in starting over, then no problem.

My suggestion is to be really careful with the decisions. This VN is more of Tomoya more than YOU, the player. Pick what is best for Tomoya, not yourself. Hopefully once I explore more of the game, then I will see what I think of it.

38726007.review:
Where do I even start.

I mean, the art sucks. It's obviously pretty bad, but you get used to it. Other than that, though?

CLANNAD is probably the best VN ever made. The writing is so on-point that Jun Maeda (the mastermind behind both this and the other KEY classics) admitted that he reached his peak with this game.

CLANNAD is infamous for being a gauntlet of emotional sucker-punches. This is the daddy of all nakige, so expect a typical nakige experience except turned up to 11. Key's flagship game was built from the ground up to make you cry, and the game accomplishes this with copious character development, trope inversions, big themes and an amazing score. So to showcase how incredible this game is, I'll explain why all these things are EXCEPTIONAL in CLANNAD.

CHARACTER DEVELOPMENT:
KEY faced harsh criticism in their previous big project, "Air", because the game was hyper-focused on the main route and had noticable dips in quality in other areas. So, Jun Maeda took personal control of every damn thing in their next project CLANNAD, including the mini-routes and joke routes. So, what you get is a very consistant level of quality and an extensive amount of content. The side route with the longest running time, Tomoyo, takes longer to complete than the entirety Katawa Shoujo, has a fucking LEG-EN-DARY ending that brings men to tears years later AND has a spinoff VN, "Tomoyo After" (which is also on steam, and you should get it). In addition to THAT, every character is expanded in the second half of the main route. And in addition to THAT theres CLANNAD side stories, also on steam, which gives extra scenes for every character. So, what you're looking at is a good couple hundred hours or so of mostly just characters talking to one another with no gameplay. All of it micromanaged by the god of visual novels himself, to assure this doesn't get old or lose consistency.

TROPE INVERSION:
Not every route does this, but enough do that I'm willing to say that CLANNAD admirably avoids cliches and manipulates your expectations. Some characters (i.e. Kyou) are famous for being clear-cut examples of the different anime archetypes ("tsundere," "yandere," you get it). This is due to the anime not having time to flesh everything out. (almost) Every character feels like a real person, with values and motivations that make a great deal of sense. The end result is that (almost) nobody feels like a statue, or a walking cliche. Even the fucking comedic relief characters have suprising moments of genuine depth that'll make you look twice at who they really are.

BIG THEMES:
It's hard to talk about this without spoilers. But generally, this VN has multiple messages to give you. The delivery is mature, unique and often subtle.

AMAZING SCORE:
You be the judge. This is almost the first track you hear after starting a new game, so no spoilers. Beware some of the thumbnails on related youtube videos, though, as they have some fucking egregious ones.
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Kzx6bsUH0ik

Anyway... That's why I like this game. The only multiple-route VNs that offer something that CLANNAD doesn't have are in a totally different setting (i.e. actiony VNs like Fate stay/night). And even then the romance is often weaker. Other VNs have routes I'd put on relative parity with CLANNAD, but I don't think you can go wrong with this old gem. 


P.S. If you're looking to get started in VNs, begin here AFTER playing Katawa Shoujo. The two are very similar and both kick major ass, but KS is shorter, free and written by westerners.

38447098.review:
Clannad is an awesome visual novel. Set aside at least 50 hours and get ready to cry.

The story is excellent. There are quite a few routes, and all of them are required to be completed in order to unlock the (long) epilogue chapter. Most are fantastic, and a couple are mediocre. I wouldn’t recommend playing the game if you aren’t going to see it through to completion.

The writing is quite sharp, and the translation is great. I lost track of how many time I laughed out loud after twenty-something. I rarely find writing that is this funny, so it was a real treat.

The characters are quite enjoyable for the most part. None of them fall too deeply into stereotypes or tropes, and the routes are long enough to tell interesting stories with the characters. The characters’ visual designs are also pretty good.

Lackluster art is probably the biggest weakness the game has. The characters are well designed, but the art that you see in-game for them is not very good looking, which is a shame since you’ll be looking at them for 50+ hours. The CGs look fine though.

The music and voice acting are top notch. The score does a really good job setting the mood appropriately. It’s the type of soundtrack I want to download and listen to afterwards. The voice actors are a huge reason why the game is so funny and emotional. No complaints whatsoever in this department. All characters besides the protagonist are fully voiced.

Some of the routes (especially some of the more joke endings) have somewhat arbitrary choices required to enter them. There are some order-specific dependencies (some routes can’t [i]really[/i] be fully completed unless other routes are done first). This is kind of annoying and might lead to have to replay some routes if you don’t consult a walkthrough.

This game is super sad. Pretty much every route has some serious tragedy or heartbreak involved. For the most part they have happy endings, but be warned that you will cry like a baby many times unless you have a heart of stone.

Overall, I highly recommend it if you have the patience and desire for 50+ hours of reading.

38425692.review:
[h1] 前天是小兔子，昨天是小鹿，今天是你～
おとといは兎を见たの、昨日は鹿、今日はあなた	[/h1]

我看过许多动漫，热血的，青春的，但有一种看了会在心中留下一些东西，CLANNAD就属于这种类型吧。偶然被同学安利了CLANNAD，称之为神作，抱着试一试的态度去看的。看完后，百感交集。
喜欢冈崎朋也帮助古河渚创建演剧部的故事，喜欢后来的表白，喜欢他们之间懵懂的爱情，喜欢高中的坡道，以及路两旁美美的樱花，喜欢秋生和早苗般的情侣，每天都是快快乐乐的，生活的每一天都有小惊喜。秋生，固然时常有些神经大条，闹出笑话，惹家人欢笑，以及各种搞怪，像一个长不大的孩子，但却又是一个很有责任的父亲，一个合格的丈夫，早苗，为我们很好的诠释了母亲，妻子的身份，漂亮，贤惠，温柔，能干，当然除了烤蛋糕。
第二季，讲的也是一些小故事，但很温馨，春园的故事，猫的故事等等无不让人感动。十集后，着重讲朋也和渚的故事，朋也开始工作，而渚时常去为朋也照顾他，因为父亲的缘故，朋也失去了获得更好的工作的机会，愤怒，悲伤，无助，古河渚抱住了他，安慰他，让人很感动，后来他们结婚了，开始幸福的二人生活，接下来的古河渚分娩时死去让人难以接受，朋也内心的悲哀不言而喻，这时，小汐在故事中出现了，后面的故事也是一次次的挑战着我的泪腺，古河汐是一个非常可爱的一个小女孩，记得有一个情节，古河汐在花丛中苦苦寻找玩具，被问到时，说了一句“那是独一无二的，是为我选，为我买的东西，是爸爸第一次......”瞬间眼泪便止不住的留下来，许久没有流泪，麻木的我竟会因为一部动漫而流泪。那一刻，父女间的隔阂打破了，他们相拥哭泣，古河汐再也不用在厕所里哭泣，因为以后，会有爸爸......后面的父女生活的小故事，也让人几经落泪，对于他们的感情，唯有感动，21集，让人绝望，还好有光玉的设定，结局圆满。在百感交集中看完了这部剧。看完之后更多的，是感到孤独，忧郁，可能是现实并不令人满意吧。
看完之后我也开始思考，有些二次元动漫的治愈，归结于故事的美好，就像之前看过的《秒速五厘米》，《言叶之庭》一般，CLANNAD也是如此，美好的校园环境，唯美的街景，樱花树，融洽的小镇人际关系，幸福美满的秋生和早苗，近乎完美，让人愿意用心去呵护，去保护的，爱哭的古河渚等等，很美好的氛围，造就美好的故事。令人向往的小镇，令人向往的二次元世界。就像片尾曲的团子大家族一样，喜欢。
在游戏中，我也尝试了智代篇和杏篇。个人也挺喜欢这两个角色的，但是总是不忍心看下去，因为我不知道没有朋也的渚怎么坚强的活着。
朋也在生活中很堕落，没有努力的理由和目标，不辍学也是因为有好基友能说说话，在没遇见渚之前世界是灰色的。
渚很胆小，虽然她心地善良，但是总是因为怯懦难以交到朋友，是朋也给他鼓励，为她找到了“一下个令人快乐，开心的事”，不断的为她的梦想――成立演剧部努力，为她做出了各种感动的事。
他们相互扶持，相互鼓励才有“负责任”的朋也，坚强的渚。
所以我不敢想象没有朋也的渚和没有渚的朋也。
[b] 一聚眉弯月色明暗
之言呢喃相离恒久
濑漫隽永拂远嗟叹 
琴拟春荷铺青岚暖
美幻滟滟翩跹款款 [/b]

38047753.review:
There are tears in your eyes as you manage to make a girl very happy, and the beautiful narrative that made it happen make them pour. "This is definitely the best ending in the game," you tell yourself. There's no topping that. 

The next day, you go through another journey in this fictitious world and yet another beautiful ending greets you. "I never knew it could get better," you tell yourself. This game is truly something; it just made you cry even more than yesterday. 

Just as you thought, for real, you've seen the best this game has to offer: you slave away until the 7 in the morning chasing yet another ending, and you find yourself bawling like a baby at the most perfect love story you've ever read. Tears keep streaming with every healtfelt moment long after you thought you had ran out. The emotions the characters make you feel, how everything came together to create such a flawless resolution, how that idiot friend of yours actually helped you out for once, the expressions on everyone's faces during the final scenes...it's too much. Even thinking about it while lying in bed makes you shed a few tears.

Welcome to CLANNAD.

38008772.review:
这部番是一个间接认识的姑娘推送给我的，先听了主题曲后补看剧，觉得姑娘本人就是这样一个明朗又绝代感伤的人。她来自温婉的江南，却热爱北国普照的阳光和凛冽的风，当然，还有一个男生L。L是我小学同学，也是多年的邻居，姑娘总是同我讲L的一举一动，默默对他好，她说《Clannad》是他们两个都很喜欢的番，他们一起看，一起讨论。姑娘渐渐依赖L，也许喜欢会让人变得自卑，姑娘一直羞于开口。L感觉得到，却无法勉强自己喜欢她，L对她好，却无关情爱，这样的失之毫厘让我唏嘘很久…
多年之后，我们都渐行渐远，他们各自有了家庭，偶然聊起，姑娘依旧心念念那个陪她看《Clannd》的L，都还记得当初混杂着友情、悸动、温暖、依赖的感情，那是她在北国漫长求学时代最珍藏的回忆。

37766509.review:
--2017.12.08--
已经完成两条线了，网上的攻略遍地都是，但是还是尽量不去看为好，毕竟要自己玩才能沉浸在游戏的内容中嘛！这是一款剧情向的游戏，和一般的galgame不一样的。攻略也可能不是完全正确的，（以下内容可能涉及剧透）[spoiler]比如第一天是否给春园录音在很多（至少我玩过的风子线和琼线中）不是决定性的选项。相反有趣的是，风子线中如果某个选项选择错误甚至会导致没有结束就直接跳回标题界面！（这个虽然攻略里可能有说，但是自己发现的话总能增加一些乐趣的，所以不推荐大家一直跟着攻略走。）[/spoiler]最后说一下，玩了大概三十个小时之后，我觉得46元购入简直是太值了！游戏真的非常优秀，而且也改变了我对galgame的认识，从TV动画一路过来的绝对不会失望！
--2017.11.27--
黑五特价以46价格购入，CL终于不仅仅是在我的心愿单里了。入坑来源是“潮鸣”，继而在B站三天看完两季。总想着一定要来玩一玩游戏，于是就来了。虽然没有简体中文，但是差评是不可能的，这辈子都不可能给差评的，CL这样的生活又过不上，就是靠玩游戏和增加看番的周目，才维持的了生活这样子，打开CL就像回家一样，里面的人都是好人，说话又好听，我超喜欢里面的！
才玩了十几个小时，所以评测以后应该会继续更新，我的目标是300小时拿下主线，1000小时拿下游戏的所有内容…争取吧…可是…总不能在眼睛里进沙子没法继续玩的时候就暂时先关上吧…
话说为什么没有拿到去年眼睛里进沙子的那个奖…/心塞

37605669.review: Starts out VERY slow and seems a bit dated (because it is), but if you stick with it the story is amazing and the characters really grow on you. The protagonist was a real jerk in the beginning and I didn't think I could deal with him... but he matures as the story goes on too. I've cried during several of the routes I've played. The storylines are touching and well thought out, and they're all connected so you really have to play through the whole game if you want to see the bigger picture. On the same token, it is a time investment. If you want a short, cutesy VN with b00bz and fanservice, look elsewhere. This is on a totally different level. I loved it, 9/10 would cry again.

37332556.review:
小镇的人们爱着小镇，而被爱着的小镇爱着每一个人，所谓家族就是这样的吧，这是clannad要告诉我们的。希望每一个真心喜欢clannad的人都像小镇上的人们互相爱护帮助，如同家人一般。希望更多的人加入这个家族，感受这个不温暖的世界角落的一丝温柔。
clannad被称为人生，是有原因的。人在少年时总会不懂事，总会不珍惜，总会不懂得情感是什么。但若我们能早一点明白是不是会少一些遗憾呢？是clanaad让我注意到了父母亲两鬓的白发，渐渐粗糙的手，觉察到了自己的任性使父母苍老了多少。那一刻我哭的一塌糊涂，不知情况的父母安慰着我，那一刻我才发现自认为长大的自己不过还是是个孩子。
他们终有一天会离我们而去留下的只有自己，但至少在那之前明白才不会留下遗憾。
有相同经历的人，曾经孤单着的人，现在浮躁的人们，请尝试一下这个游戏你会发现有些游戏不单是游戏这么简单。
请大家投票“世界以冷酷至极，让我们携手同行”奖

37232752.review:
I waite4d for this game to come on sale and I wish I hadn't. Having seen the anime I know how the story goes and the first time Nagisa came into scene, it hit my like a box of rocks. the second half of the story was so relatable it brought me physical pain. growing up in high school, I had it fairly rough. My step dad was a drunk and although Tomoya's dad wasn't abusive, mine was. it resulted in me leaving home and living with my best friend. his little sister, 1 year younger, was there andwe cared deeply for each other. This isn't so far from Tomoya and Nagisa's story and it just reminds me of some of what I had to endure as well. the feeling of being an outsider hit especially hard and this VN portrayed that so well. 

Beyond the story's relatability to my own upbringing, the quality of this visual novel is well worth the full price IMO. While I haven't completed it yet after 10.5 hours, the translation so far has been amazing. I haven't seen a single typo or poorly translated line yet. The voice acting is also amazing with every line other than you're own being voiced out and sounding authentic. the music is spectacular, and of course, the dango song is here and just like in the anime, is played at the perfect times to emphasize both joy and sorrow, truly artful. the art is also incredible, though there are some expressions that characters portray that look drawn on. this mostly an issua with Yohei (spelling?), the other character's expressions all looked natural. Saving the best for last is the story. in typical Key fashion, this story is AMAZING. Key has always made incredible stories that really know how to tug on your heart strings and Clannad is no exception.

I picked this game up on sale for $17.50 but I think it's absolutely worth the $49.99 price tag, especially if you don't know the story. Once I've finished this, I'm going to re-watch the anime and probably cry myself to sleep.

37199162.review:
J'ai trop de choses à dire sur Clannad, donc voici la marche à suivre :
1)jouer au jeu ou regarder l'animé.
2)pleurer
3)pleurer encore
4)pleurer encore un peu 
5)partir en dépression
6)se dire qu'on adore et retourner finir le jeu (ou l'anime).
7)aller regarder l'animé si on a fait le jeu ou faire le jeu si on à regarder l'animé

Para empezar, es una novela visual enorme.
Es realmente larguísimo, de hecho aparece como 11°juego con más lineas del mundo, y el tercer juego con más palabras del mundo.
Imáginense de lo largo que es... con 1.300.000 palabras y 101.000 líneas, aproximadamente.

Esta novela empieza en base de comedia, pero a medida que vas avanzando descubrirás que es muy díficil decidir lo que quieres exactamente, y también el desbloquear todos los escenarios porque hay muchísimos y díficiles de seguir.
A ver... Por lo que me acuerdo, hay como catorce rutas (sin contar que cada una tiene varios finales, y que unas desbloquean otras).
Este juego habla muchísimo sobre la vida y el amor familiar, es una obra maestra.
Me vi el anime cuando tenía como 11 años, que fue hace siete años más o menos, y debo decir que a día de hoy todavía me impacta mucho. Pero leyendo la novela (que me habia leído casi todas antes en español parcheado hace algunos años) y... Debo admitir que me encanta cada vez más.
Me encanta el arte también, que a pesar de no ser muy querible y muy antiguo, me encanta el poder de las emociones que tienen esos simples trazos, que lo convierten en imágenes hermosas. ¡Gracias, Hinoue Itaru!
Para mí valió muchísima pena conocer esta hermosa historia.
Qué recuerdos me trae cuando veía el anime y me encantaba, a pesar de ser muy chico todavía...
Es muy triste la historia, pero también es muy divertida.
Muchas gracias, Key Studio, por haber creado una obra maestra como esta.
Siempre sentiré emoción cada vez que escuche su nombre, sin importar si es del anime o de la VN: "CLANNAD".

36673691.review:
One of the best visual novels I've read. Well written, with a good mix of humor and pathos. It follows the trials of a high school boy in his final year, who has no long term goals and spends more of his time skipping classes and annoying his teachers than attending to his studies. It's quickly made apparent that his home life is a sad affair, with a mother who died in his infancy, and a distant, slovenly drunkard of a father who makes genuine but ineffective attempts to repair the seemingly long broken relationship with his son. A chance encounter with a girl on the way to school sets the game's events into motion. 

This is equal parts a coming of age story for the protagonist, a story of reconcilation, and a story about taking responsibility and learning the meaning of family. It's very much in the romance and slice of life genre, with a lot of detail given to mundane, yet character building moments. 

The game is split into two distinct parts, the first of which follows his life through that final year of school. Though still good, this part is the weaker of the two and firmly adheres a little too rigidly to the standard conventions of visual novels. In this part you will make choices which affect the ending, which for the most part are distinct in that each one will end you up in a relationship of some description with one of the female cast. 

The problem with this part is that not all of the arcs are as interesting as the others, with some characters being a little too one dimensional. The other problem is that for the most part, particular choices arbitrarily lead you to specific endings and you will need to do a lot of trial and error, save scumming, or consulting online guides to help you reach them. Lastly, the other issue with this part is that there are a lot of shared events between the different arcs, and you will be skipping a lot of text on subsequent playthroughs. There is no feature to skip already viewed events quickly other than a 'fast' text option, which for a game as text heavy as this is not fast enough. 

The second part is where the game really shines. It follows the time after the protagonist leaves school and begins adult life. It is much more focused than the first part, with more developed characterisation and a better structure overall, with a much tighter, cohesive narrative arc. Partly this I think is owing to how it treats one of the possible routes in the first part as canon, so it doesn't have to spread itself so thin and concern itself with tying together various plot threads. Choices, though still infrequent are much more clear in their consequence down the line. 

The ending of this visual novel is excellent and will stick with you. My only issue with the ending is that some parts of the major plot development as it's written are underdeveloped. For me this slightly blunted the impact of aspects of the ending overall. 

This is a very long visual novel and it took me about 120 hours to complete it, with the multiple routes of the first part taking me about 90 hours to complete and the second about 30 hours thereafter. It has good production, with the entirety of all dialogue other than the protagonist being voiced, with attractive art - though I know some people are turned off by the some of the character designs, I personally liked them. If i had any problem with their designs it would be that a lot of characters look a bit too young, especially in the second part when the characters are getting into their twenties but some still appear to be children (Fuko stands out especially). This is not something that I typically play, as mostly I have played VNs with more focus on action or intrigue such as Steins;Gate or Type Moon games, but as someone less familiar with this genre I thought this was excellent.

36492974.review:
When I saw CLANNAD I was sceptical at first. The style was not my taste at all. The price tag was hefty. And so I waited for a sale.
Some months later...

I can proudly say that CLANNAD is my favorite Visual Novel of all time.

Once I started playing I immediately fell in love with it. The humor, the characters, even the style.
It was magical. I didn't understand why, but I wanted it to keep going on.
Every single route feels complete and every character has a beautiful background story.
At no point did I have the feeling that it was stretched or boring.
And when you think you're done with the game HOLD ON there's even more!

'' But soon everything changes, well at least it does eventually. ''

Of course, even CLANNAD has an end to it, but I can promise you, countless hours will pass before you will reach the true Ending.
I don't complain, this game is filled with tons of content, secrets, endings, JET SAITO and more.
If you're a slow reader or enjoy re-reading lines there'll be even more hours on the count.
But I think it's best experienced when playing the first walkthrough blind followed by using a spoiler-free guide for the 
other routes. Reason is, CLANNAD has LOTS of choices and paths, and while it surely can be enjoyed by finding things out by yourself, some things are just hard to find out on your own in my opinion.

To be honest, it's hard to describe what the fascination with this game is about. I didn't now s*** about this game 
- except that it would make me cry - 
until I played it myself and I enjoyed every single moment of it.
I think I can put my hand in the fire for saying that CLANNAD will touch you.
It will make you laugh about Sunohara's foolishness, and at times, it will make you cry. 
(for obvious reasons I don't want to spoil you about these)

Too bad it's only in English, while it's a good localization, I would've liked to see a German version for example too.

I give everybody my recommendation to try CLANNAD out as it was a once in a lifetime experience for me about friendship, love, family and life itself.

Don't like Visual Novels? Watch the Anime. Don't like Anime? Read the comic.

I also want to give a HUGE credit to the music. One of the most beautiful soundtracks I've heard.

Thank you <3

36389928.review:
身为一个高中狗，前些日子在拜读二周目后颇有感想写一篇长评来安利心中的宇宙神作CL，鄙人一介理科生文笔青涩并无多华丽辞藻，仅仅抒发CL在我走向成熟路上时带给我的影响
CL一二季共46集，带领我们随朋也从一个射惠青年一步一步跌跌碰碰成长为一个懂得负责懂得担当的父亲。这也是其被广大CL厨称为人生的原因，着实，我在不同的时间看也能有不同的理解
初次接触是在临近中考看到新番Charlotte后感觉这个故事很有意思昂 然后知道了麻枝大魔王寻迹遇到了CL
初三，一周目，我在朋也送他父亲回家时在凌晨两点的被窝中抑制不住盈眶的泪水懂得了孝顺
高二，二周目，我在朋也在花田拥着小汐时与刚安利入坑一口气两季的朋友抱头痛哭懂得了承担
大学 入社会甚至总有一天我也成为了父亲 我都要再重温下CL
CL的故事，只不过是一个普通夹杂些许奇迹的故事，他仅仅是全心全意的为你讲述一个少年的成长，把尖角磨平，把稚气消除。这也是它能骗去我们眼泪的原因，真实不做作，麻枝大魔王用自己的方式来为我们讲述一个不起眼的小镇的一个普通的故事，它宛如一个歌颂成长的伟大赞歌
然这平凡的故事却是如此的吸引人，我在17年夏促剁了CL的游戏后万万没想到它能吸引我如此至极以至于让刚买的*猫3吃了半年的灰(ಡωಡ) ～
希望看到这篇长评的诸位能认真体会这部作品，让它伴随自己的成长历程，希望看完后的每一次拭泪都是一次蜕变
至于看过的CL厨，让我们一起高呼：宇宙神作，写作CL，读作人生，此生无悔入CL！

36339980.review:
To preface this, I am a longtime fan of the Clannad anime series. Ive seen it several times, fallen in love with the characters, the mood, the art, and everything about this series and can proudly say it has been an important, positive, and powerful influence in my life.  So as you can imagine, I was very excited upon hearing about the kickstarter for the English HD version of the Clannad Visual Novel. I had heard a lot about just how amazing the original visual novel was, so I finally decided to purchase the full collection of CLANNAD on steam, both to repay Key studios for the amazing anime creation that had had such an amazing impact on my life and also because the VN really intrigued me.

My expectations weren't super high, I did not expect the visual novel to rival the animes Clannad or Clannad: After Story, but honestly only partway through the Misae character arc I was quite blown away by the quality of the voice acting, wide variety of character stories & pathways, touching soundtrack, and overall mood/design of the game. It was beautifully intimate being able to experience a more in-depth look at the Clannad characters, their back stories and relationships... I felt more connected to this world and the people in it than ever before. 

In the end I would have to rank this on the same level as the original series, and highly recommend this VN to anyone who is a fan of the anime. I would say it's absolutely necessary and mandatory in fact, to really get a complete sense of the full characters' stories and their motivations. The CLANNAD visual novel is touching, heartbreaking, inspiring, beautiful, intimate and truly special. I can't say any interactive experience has had an emotional impact on me like the CLANNAD visual novel has. 

The only downside to this VN I would say is the annoying sexist attitudes of many of the characters and how those views aren't really questioned at any point. such as "a yell uncharacteristic of a girl", "girls and boys cant be platonic friends", only girls can sew or when almost all of Tomoya's love interests come to visit him when he is suspended from school ,each one brings a dish trying to get him to choose her cooking over another girl's. It's backwards, gross, and disappointing that a story with so many beautiful, meaningful moments also has some unimaginative sexist tropes. 


However, overall it's a great VN, and If you love Clannad you MUST purchase this. 9/10.

35436362.review:
[h1]少年，你听过KEY社三部曲吗？[/h1]
首先，推荐之前说明一点这游戏目前没有中文版。
以下个人看法，仅供参考。
不喜欢这种类型的游戏的话，我说什么都没用对吧？

“写作CL，读做人生”
如果你不知道什么叫感动，那你可以来尝试玩一下CL。
亲情、友情、爱情；对生活、学校、工作乃至理想，CL可谓是相当有深度的游戏了。
2010左右（个人接触的时间啦，暴露年龄了ORZ）的游戏画风可能有点跟不上目前的审美
，（也就是某些人吐槽的蟑螂头233）。
音乐和脚本由麻枝准，折户伸治等KEY社大佬负责
游戏剧情相当的丰富，可谓三年磨一剑，也是这游戏的最大卖点。
在面对突发事件的时候你会有选择的机会，或者是想要攻略对象的分支。
[i] 强调一下，作为玩这类游戏的基本素养，这里是一定要存档的[/i]
在选择后会对将来的剧情有所影响，也就是传统的BE,NE,HE的区别啦~

（下面涉及一部分剧透，请选择性观看）
[spoiler]每个角色都有不同的剧情线，完成相应的HE后会收集一枚光玉
然后全部收集完呢，再走一遍渚线会进入TE。
推荐先按照自己的喜好去攻略，再逐个补全。
有个神奇的佟圣平（藤林琼的未来男友）线，不看攻略我还真不知道。
顺带一提，叙事结构是双线的，梦境也是有寓意的。
春原君可谓是游戏的一个笑点, 他对主角帮助最多，
在关键时候是最明智的，如果没有他游戏气氛会沉重很多吧。
我最喜欢的是一之濑小琴美吧 ：“欺负人！”[/spoiler]

可以等打折再买，或者你懂的。
CL也有动画和剧场版可以先去补一下，当然没有游戏那么精彩啦~
PS: cl有中文译名叫做克兰娜德
HE=happy ending B=bad N=normal T=true

目前个人觉得存在的不足：
1.内置STEAM截图系统必须要全屏
2.没有进度完成统计器
3.不能选择日文模式，对于其他语言支持不足
4.存档界面，少一些东西。例如玩到一定程度后，XXX线的提示
5.新加的词条说明，没有太大意义

相关的其他游戏：
[olist]
[*]CL枕边小故事，最早是PSP上的，用来补充游戏中的剧情和人设
[ur]http://store.steampowered.com/app/420100/CLANNAD_Side_Stories/	[/url] 
    [*]CL中智代线的后续。因为当年智代可是人气第一的角色，就顺水推舟出了这个。悄悄说一下这个原版可是有R18的
[ur]http://store.steampowered.com/app/462990/Tomoyo_After_Its_a_Wonderful_Life_English_Edition/[/url]
    [*]星之梦，KEY以前的短片科幻类的adv[ur] http://store.steampowered.com/app/623080[/url]
    [*]小小克星（译名大概）[ur]http://store.steampowered.com/app/635940[/url]
    [*]Key社三部曲，也有说是四部曲：及春（CL）夏(AIR)秋(ONE)冬(KANNON)。最重要的也就是CL了吧。后续key社的游戏还有LITTE BUSTER(库特wafter)、REWRITTE（Rewrite Harvest festa！）、Angel Beats!等，希望以后也能看到呢~
[/olist]

想考慮買CLANNAD的，可以去看過它的動畫版，然後問自己對個作品有没有愛後才去決定吧。
CLANNAD是一個在2004年出的Galgame，所以裏面的畫風不是所有人也能接受，所以如果你只是來追求視覺上的滿足的話，就別玩這個遊戲吧。而且CLANNAD是一個很長的Galgame，整個遊戲有5.2 G大，即使我在玩時常常按快進鍵也要30小時才能玩到True End。
從CLANNAD中，有那個被主角常常玩弄，但無論怎樣也會幫主角的好朋友春原，也有兩個互相扶持，互相成長主角岡崎朋也和古河渚。也有為了渚而犧牲自己夢想的父母秋生和早苖，還有主角的父親。
CLANNAD裏面有對友情，愛情和親情的描述，而這些部份也描述得很好，而且CLANNAD的音樂也很帶感，尤其是最後True End 的ED小小的手心。
玩完CLANNAD之後，會有一陣又喜又悲的感覺。
但說真的，對CLANNAD没有愛的，看動畫就好了。

34927279.review:
CLANNAD is the story if Tomoya Okazaki, and the lonely delinquent life he leads as his Senior year in high school begins. Lonely that is, until he meets Nagisa...

In short, CLANNAD is a fantastic game. The story, all the characters, my GOD, the music! The art is a little moe but it's not by any means a deal breaker. The player is immersed in the role of Tomoya, as he lives out his days in high school in the School Life arc, before graduating and getting a job later in the After Story arc, which becomes available after a number of playthroughs of School Life. However, I do want to point out, what I really liked, was that in the Misae and Kotomi route paths, the player, for a time, is immersed in the game as Katsuki Shima and Kotomi respectively. It's so interesting and unique how the player gets to play as more than just the MC and it really drived home just how heart breaking their stories are. 

Each story route in CLANNAD has its own unique qualities to them, and they're all worth experiencing. I do't have the time nor patience to go through ALL the routes and what each of them does well and not so well so I'll just give some important hilights. Baseball route is funny and pure comedy with no drama, it's a nice, relaxing route, but doesn't really pack the Key punch. Misae and Kotomi routes are two favorites especially with the immersion as different characters, as I mentioned above. Tomoyo's route in the first half is a bit annoying at times because they made Tomoya a really perverted MC, much more so than he is in other routes, but the second half of the route is nothing short of a masterpiece, and makes it all worth it. You see the effects and pain the passage of time can create between people. There is a character called Kappei who never made it into the anime and he is male which really intrigued me, but his route isn't all that amazing. Kyou's route is really nice and the character interations make it, but the pacing is a little too slow. It really drags for a while. Komura's route is nice, but too short. It's more of a scene than a route. Yukine's route hardly has drama and much of what they included in the anime is not included hereAnd of course, there's Fuko and Nagisa, who are just treasures who need to be protected. After Story is a whole other thing and in the essence of spoilers, I'll stop with hilights here.

Kazamatsuri made a really helpful guide you can use to get through the game. I highly recommend using it. Though if I had to point out one thing that disappointed me about the game is there are a good number of uneccesary choices. They carry no significance to the plot at all and really offer a 10 second snippet difference in story. It leaves the player (or me, at least) somewhat frustrated trying to figure out what choices to make when I shouldn't need to make one. Another little issue I had was not with the actual game, but with the translations. Not in the sense they are inaccurate, but they just read kinda clunky sometimes and sound unnatural. There are also a few typos here and there as well.

Overall, I would highly recommend this game. It's classic Key. Hilarious, dramatic and sad, has beautiful music, and the voice acting is great. There's also an option on the menu to listen to the songs as you unlock them in the game, which is a nice touch, and the Dangopedia is interesting too. There's plenty of material in here that did not make it to the anime so even if you've seen the anime, I still recommend you play this. I watched the anime first but still fell in love with this visual novel. Given it's running time, I'd say it's worth $50, but if you grab it on sale, you can get a prett sweet deal out of it.

34895450.review:
Clannad was a very special experience when I watched the anime, and I am so happy to say that it was as a visual novel as well. (And for people who don't want to spend 80 hours on a VN, the anime is a perfect substitute in this case!) 

I had always assumed that most romantic visual novels starred blank slate protagonists and cliched filled women, and served simple as wish fulfillment. I still hold that assumption for the majority of the genre still, but Clannad is different. Tomoya has a very defined personality, and is nowhere near a perfect character. And despite the fact that most of the routes end in romance, Clannad doesn't consider getting the girl to be the good end. The game puts the happiness of the characters first and foremost. In some cases, that means accepting that being apart is the better choice for both characters, In others, it has nothing to do with romance at all. Even though I feel like the female characters have some writing issues, the fact that acquiring their affection is not the overall point, makes them feel more real.

Despite some issues I have with the writing, I think it hits at every single point where it counts, Not just the sad moments, but the joyful moments too. The amount of visual/audio gags that are pulled off through the simple presentation astonished me. I was rolling on the ground at points.

Speaking of the visuals, the artstyle takes a bit to get used to. I do not think its bad per se, but it is definitely not something that I love about the game. However, it looks crisp in 1080p. Only the 4:3 ratio keeps it from looking more "modern" although I am not someone who absolutley needs my TV screen to be filled up. 

And the music, oh man the music. It is so dang catchy, I was always humming along to most of the songs. And the ones that I was not humming along with, were causing me to cry instead. It all fits perfectly wherever it needs to be.

The VN did actually change my opinion of the ending. Its something I now think the anime did not nail as well. I want to get into that, so for anyone who isn't familar with the material, leave and play/watch this.

SPOILERS BEGIN



[spoiler] It never sat with me that Nagisa was saved at the end. I felt like it would have been better to end with Tomoya living with Ushio and leave it with that. I never felt like her revival was a deus ex machina, since it is built up since the beginning, but I did feel like it was too "neat". And that feeling started to develop even more when the VN started to confront the theme of change, much more than in the anime. Until I hit this dialogue: 

                      "Is our reaction supposed to be to say 'Ah, everything is always changing...?' But we're human beings 
                        Living creatures with emotions. Who fight with everything they have to keep from being sad, and 
                        from losing what's important to them."

That's when it hit me: Clannad is not saying change is inevitable and we should just always accept it and move on, it's saying that change is inevitable but some of it deserves to be fought. In fact, this theme is also prevelant in Tomoyo's route. Her whole goal is to prevent the sakura trees from being cut down, because she believes its a change for the worse. Once that realization hit me, the ending made much more sense. Tomoya and Ushio refused to accept Nagisa's death as a change that was acceptable and did everything they could to stop it. It made the whole end feel much more thematically relevant than I had thought before. [/spoiler]


SPOILERS END

I love Clannad. Whether as an anime or VN (but not the movie) I will always cherish it as a special experience that constantly blew my expectations out of the water.

34667440.review:
Знаете... Я моральный мудак. Я, в ответ, жесток ко всем, не проявляю к ним чувства, практически не реагирую на ситуации, не жалею их, порой даже не помогаю. Но посмотрев одноименное аниме и запустив игру... Я понял настолько я черств ко всему. Жело в том, что в каждом аниме есть изюминка, но мало кто отличает себя сюжетом. И это пример того, насколько сюжет вас тронет до глубины души. Жизнь Оказаки Томоя тому пример. Уже в начале мы понимаем эту боль, это чувство, конфликты, жестокость. Но удивительно наблюдать за тем, что каким человек не был злым... У него есть частичка добра, ему просто не дают этого показать или ему не дают этого развивать. И в голове не укладывается как окружающие люди его реально сделали таким, каким он есть на самом деле. Хулиган, которого мы знали стал тем, кем ему не давали ставать. И каждый момент дает понимать как это меняется. Как люди осуществляют мечту и просто изчезают. Чего стоит моменты с Фуко. Разработчики воистину молодцы, так как редко найдешь не фан сервис, а поистину великолепную историю, которая заставляет рыдать. Я не скрываю этого. Я никогда не испытывал этого чувства на людям, мне было плевать на них, но в душе все было наоборот. А тут оно просто выплеснулось наружу.  Так что как минимум советую глянуть это аниме, как максимум- купить и поиграть, ибо оно того стоит так как можно делать выбор, который отличается от сюжета в аниме. 
Жалко что они сюда не опубликовали Angel Beats!, так как это еще один пример подобного случая, где новелла и аниме-идеальны в плане сюжета, где никто не умирал, а обретал покой и это реально трогало. Мы забыли о морали... И этого уже не изменить...

34635263.review:
CLANNAD里面有着这么一段，古河渚的父母早苗和秋生他们那么喜欢自己的事业，尤其是秋生喜欢自己的事业喜欢的不得了。却毅然放弃了自己的事业，开一家面包店。当时我的疑惑也和渚的泪水一样认为秋生和早苗为了她牺牲了自己的事业，牺牲了自己的幸福。那种为了别人放弃自己一生幸福的感觉特别强烈。然而，在我的女儿出生的这些天里，与女儿的相处。那份感觉恐怕真的只有身为父母才能感觉的到。
                                 *************没有什么比看着自己的女儿健康成长更让人觉得幸福的了***************
         那份亲情感，那份甜蜜，那种幸福，比什么都来的重要。我也突然发现，早苗和秋生并不是牺牲了自己的事业，而是找到了新的事业目标。而这份目标比任何都要让人幸福。这是CLANNAD至始至终的核心理念，也是CLANNAD最让人喜欢，最让人感觉温馨的地方。亲情。永远都是最幸福的感情。秋生放弃了自己的演艺生涯，却赢得了与渚的朝夕相处，那份欢笑，那份快乐，让他重选一万次也不会改变。秋生抱着渚在雪地里痛哭的祈祷着的时刻，绝对是那种撕心裂肺的。而在渚重新醒来的那一刻，秋生也获得了重生。所以说，并不是秋生为了渚牺牲了自己。而是
[spoiler]！渚让秋生获得了幸福！[/spoiler]
         于是。这样想来。在我们生活中，为了让自己混得更好，我们努力着赚更多的钱，我们没日没夜的辛苦工作着。却不知道幸福就在我们身边。CLANNAD用它无限的温暖提醒着我们。那段秋生雪地里抱着渚痛哭的片段，也是在警示着我们。
不要等幸福从我们身边失去了才知道珍惜。人生不会重来。幸福就在我们身边。

34626328.review:
[h1][b]『CLANNAD』（クラナド）正式版レビュー（スポイラー少しがあります）[/b][/h1]

[b]『CLANNAD』（クラナド）は、Keyが制作した3作目の恋愛アドベンチャーゲーム。このページではこのゲームを原作として、メディアミックス的展開がなされたアニメやコミックなどの作品群についても解説する。しかしこのレビューでは、私はテレビコミックに焦点を当てます。このゲームについて、原作品のHD版「1920x1080 (HD) 以上の解像度）」ですけど、インターフェイスと字幕はただ英語をサポートします。けれども、それはまだ完璧なゲームです。[/b]

[h1][b]クラナドは、どんな人生の意味を表現しますか。この究極の問題の答えについて、次の段落でそれについて議論する。[/b][/h1]

[b]クラナドは一般人たちのストーリーですけど、よかったら、この物語を真面目に読みください。人は三回に成長する：
一回・自分はこの世界の中心ではないさとき。
二回・どんな努力しても、やっぱりすることができないものがあります。
三回・たとえできないことがあります、ても全力であたる。

学園編に、不良となっていた主人公の岡崎朋也は、ある日学園前の坂道で女子生徒の古河渚と出会う。この一般人のストーリーはここから始まります。「俺たちは、登り始める。長い長い、坂道を。」このストーリーを終えたら、この「長い坂道」は意味があると思います。明らかに、この道は私たち人生の進む道です。私たちの前にどのような人生があるのかは全く分かりません。でも、努力は常に実り多いものになるでしょう。

[h1][b]その他ヒロインらが演劇部の再建に協力します[/b][/h1]
https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1142366332
アフターストーリーに、朋也は卒業後、芳野祐介の所属している電気工事会社に就職する。渚は病気がちで留年を繰り返しながらも朋也に遅れて1年後に学園卒業を成す。父・直幸の問題により、朋也の会社での出世は果たせなくなるものの、それが朋也と渚が結婚するきっかけとなる。結婚後、渚は岡崎 汐を出産するものの、母親である渚が出産後に死亡する。その後、あまりの虚無感から朋也は育児できず、母方の祖父・祖母である古河 秋生、古河早苗が5年ほど汐の育児をする。

[h1][b]泣いていいのは、おトイレかパパの胸の中だって[/b][/h1]
https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1145014405
その後早苗の計画により、朋也は汐と二人で直幸の故郷へ旅行し、祖母の岡崎史乃と面会。祖母は直幸の過去を語り、これにより朋也と直幸は和解した。その後、朋也が汐を引き取り育児を始めるも、汐は病気がちとなり、旅行に出かけた冬の日雪の中で倒れる。
その一方で、朋也に関係した人達の問題を解決していき、各ルートを攻略することで得られる「光の玉‐ライトオーブ」を拾っていく事により、終盤の世界が入れ替わるきっかけとなっていく。

[h1][b]小さな手のひら[/b][/h1]
https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1144217129
家族愛、友情と愛情はこの物語に最大限に表現します。「泣いていいのは、おトイレかパパの胸の中だって．．．」渚、見つけたよ。やっと見つけたんだ。俺にしか守れないもの、俺にしか守れないかけがえのないもの、それは、ここにあった。椋が言ってた、ちょっとしたキッカケで未来はどう分かれるかわからない。私、これから自分たちが進む道には、たくさんの可能性があると思いたいんです。人生には究極の意義はないだけど、この世で誕生されることを強制されたのはひどいですけど、この「たくさんの可能性がある」光の玉を探しましょう。だから、たとえできないことがあります、ても全力であたる。それは完璧な人生と呼ばれることができます。[/b]

34560641.review:
This is one of the best romance Visual Novels of all time--and $20 is a steal.  If you're unfamiliar with the genre, think of this as like a "choose your own adventure" that starts at the same basic point but can branch off widely depending on your choices.  VNs like this are often erroneously called dating sims, but that's a different genre entirely.  VNs like this are more like a bundle of separate romance stories, the choices you can make in-game locking you in to one of the stories, or "routes."  Once you finish a route, you can start the game from the beginning, making different choices, and see how that changes the story.  

VNs like Nekopara or the Sakura- games have probably given VNs a bit of a negative reputation around here, but this game doesn't stoop to those lows.  The story is sweet, cute, mixes in drama, comedy, and supernatural elements, and doesn't rely on fanservicey CGs to keep you playing.  This is the way the game was [i]meant[/i] to be played, too, so you won't be playing a hacked-up Steam version.

34388663.review:
The visual novel from which my all time favorite anime is based upon, so I am hopelessly biased here.  I bought the original (unvoiced!) Japanese version of this visual novel years ago, re-bought the voiced edition when Key released it in Japan, and now I'm glad this story is finally translated to English.  If you love visual novels and love emotional rides then CLANNAD is for you.  If you loved the anime, this visual novel is for you.

The only potential issue from this superb work is that CLANNAD is quite lengthy.  Some people will find that to be a positive, others will find that it is a negative.  The story unfolds at a remarkably sedate pace (even compared to the anime) so the reader truly settles into the routine of school life.  But along the way you will be fully immersed with Itaru Hinoue's gorgeous art and Maeda's music.  From Ushio's theme that plays in the main menu to the opening and ending themes, the music of the visual novel is amazing and will be instantly familiar to those used to the anime.

34173470.review:
Jogos estilo "visual novel" não é o forte no Ocidente, mas deixo uma breve análise do game "Clannad", que foi um sucesso relativo mesmo no Ocidente. No jogo, Clannad conta a estória cotidiana de certos estudantes colegiais japoneses, assim como nos mangás, animês e light novels japoneses.

A estória passa centralizada em Tomoya Okazaki e em Nagisa Furukawa, este primeiro é quem o jogador controla durante o visual novel.  Tomoya (ou qualquer outro nome que jogador queira renomear) entra no colégio sempre atrasado ou falta em algumas aulas, é típico daquelas pessoas que os outros chamam de "delinquente", mas no fundo, Tomoya teve uma infância meio difícil, além de que o convívio com seus pais não era grande coisa. Tomoya acabou se machucando seriamente na adolescência e isso o impediu de participar de campeonatos esportivos como basquete, que ele sempre gostava. Tomoya acaba conhecendo Nagisa, uma menina de saúde frágil, mas muito dócil e meiga (certeza que non ecziste uma pessoa assim na vida real). Mesmo suas personalidades não serem parecidas, o envolvimento entre os dois vai ficando mais "íntimo" com o desenrolar da estória. Mas claro, Tomoya acaba interagindo com várias outras garotas do colégio e isso é que torna o jogo, um leque de caminhos até chegar a cada final diferente.

Graficamente falando, não há muito o que se comentar, pois como o jogo inteiro é com conversas e escolhas múltiplas do protagonista em mudar o rumo da estória, só dá para se destacar no cenário e nos personagens interagindo no centro da tela em traços de animê/mangá. Aliás, já falando na diversão e jogabilidade, este último não existe, pois você apenas aperta ENTER no teclado para prosseguir as falas e usa o mouse ou direcional para selecionar escolhas do protagonista e menus. Com a diversão, talvez para alguns jogadores, Clannad pode ser bastante monótono, pois simplesmente não há ação ou novas variedades de jogos ou puzzles dentro de Clannad; apenas a estória rolando. Senti falta de opções de jogabilidade nesse sentido e isso tornou-se repetitivo e meio enjoativo. O som é ok, com uma boa trilha sonora e vozes dos outros personagens com que você interage, menos a sua. Talvez o grande ponto forte do jogo mesmo são os personagens carismáticos, como a Nagisa, a  Ryou e a Fuko. Já não posso dizer o mesmo do Youhei Sunohara, o amigo baká do protagonista...

Para quem curte jogos visual novel, como os japoneses e orientais em geral, Clannad é um bom game com uma boa estória, pois o estúdio responsável é também criador de Air e Kanon, outros visual novels que, assim como em Clannad, ganharam versões em mangás e animês. Mas acho que faltou mais opções de jogatina, pois com o tempo, o jogo começa a ficar repetitivo e cansativo, apesar da estória desenrolando. Eu acabei fazendo um final fraco, pois não selecionei as opções corretas durante o game. Estou tentando agora (até a data desta publicação) jogar com um tutorial para verificar outros possíveis finais. Recomendo para quem gosta do gênero e curte estórias de colegiais japoneses, como nos mangás e animês. Porém, para os "gamers" em geral, fica difícil recomendá-lo.

ochogeek.blogspot.com.br

34147791.review:
The game is relatively old, but is surely classic. It goes wider and deeper than the CLANNAD animation. Many of the stories that were not clearly illustrated in the animation can be found in the game. Thanks to these playthroughs I can now fully understand the entire construct of the TV anime. Owning to the multiple 'route' mechanism which is commonly seen in visual novels, the producers must have found it difficult to convert it to an anime. But I must say they did a splendid job. Some people found the anime endings confusing. If that's the case and they still love CLANNAD, I surely recommend this game as it clearifies lots of the mysteries. Judged individually apart from the consequent anime, the game is absolutely the best of its kind and we love it as much as the anime.

The game has minor shortcomings indeed. First there are very few animations. The game is old so that's fairly acceptable. Second, Tomoya has no voice cast. I know for sure that they want the 'player' to be at the center of the stage but after watching the anime it's a little bit weird. Finally, we need fully Japanese support for subtitles and UI. There are many translations that just not fit and sounds pretty bizzare. For the game is initially Japanese, I do not see much difficulty in adding language support.

If you are new to visual novel and CLANNAD, I'd recommend the anime at first hand since it can be more appealing and vivid that the game. But if you seek a deeper dive and ask more about the detials, there you go!

P.S. Another thing great about the game is that it contains no ’エロ’ things considering its genre. Family and love in this story surely take us way beyond that :)

34146101.review:
It's so good, I cannot recommend it enough. The story pacing is excellent, and the story length is surprsingly extensive. I've experienced two story arks (Nagisa and Kyou) so far. Both arks were joyful and had incredibly powerful and genuine moments. CLANNAD brings a lot of joy and happiness, but that also comes with heartaches that can leave you weeping for hours.

Note: I played this before watching the anime. After I completed Nagisa's story ark I decided to watch CLANNAD After Story (24 episodes) for more closure. I highly recommend doing that if you are new to CLANNAD like I was.

34075145.review:
能说什么？神作补票入正。
    没有中文是个遗憾，但英语用词和语法都不复杂，不影响游玩。
    在那个对人生很迷茫的时候遇到了CL，很大程度上改变了我人生观的作品 。

    出生在一个虽然不太富裕不过也算是相当美满的家庭，但那时候对家庭的概念却相当稀薄。一方面是不太明白家庭的意义，另一方面自己努力的方向也处于一片混乱的状态（恰逢高考惨败，虽然一直表现得不是很在意，但实际上是不可能的）。
    很庆幸那个时候被好友（@F-Fox）推荐了CLANNAD的动漫，即便是虚构的故事也拥有深入人心的力量，它适时也完美的对我心中的困惑给出了解释，十几年的教育让我离学术靠近了许多，而CL让我开始关注自己身边的幸福和家人。对于心中的家庭这个概念而言，那个看着屏幕落泪的下午，是一切改变的开始。
    随后花了很多时间玩了游戏（盗版），相比于动漫，内容更加冗长，但细节也更为丰富。直到上架Steam，所以补了票。
    虽然现在和以后都很有可能常年在异地，追逐梦想是一方面，但家庭无论无何都会是人生中最值得守护的东西。

程序员文笔拙劣，附带于文字间的主观色彩可能会影响您对此作品的评价，不过请相信，这是一部非常优秀的作品

33765583.review:
[h1]Всех приветствую, с вами Снайкер! Сегодня я бы хотел поговорить с вами о такой новелле, как Clannad. Сразу сообщаю: тем, кому "лень читать" или "многа букаффф", советую проследовать вниз, в колонку "Итог". Всем же остальным советую почитать данный обзор, чтобы понять, что из себя представляет данное произведение. Надеюсь, я вам, хочь чем-то, да помогу. Итак, начнем...[/h1]


[h1]Сюжет:[/h1]

Сюжет данной новеллы повествует нам об Оказаки Томоя-куне - ГГ сего произведения. Он является подростком, учащимся в старшей школе. Из-за определенных моментов, произошедших в его жизни ([spoiler]его мать умерла, а отец отдалился от него[/spoiler]), он стал отчужденным человеком, ненавидящим город, в котором живет. Томоя, не желая встречаться со своим отцом, все время проводит в компании своего несмышленного друга - Сунохары Ехея, которые вместе - два сапога пара, ведь они оба являются "проблемными" учениками, которые любят частенько пропускать школу. И вот однажды, в один весенний день, Оказаки Томоя, как всегда опаздывая, шел в школу. И, взабравшись на холм, что вел в школу, Томоя заметил одну странную личность, спрашивающую: "Ты любишь этот город?.." Ответив на этот вопрос, который был задан не ему, и начинается история, которая заставит вас и плакать, и смеяться, и сопереживать, и негодовать, и, конечно же, задуматься о многих, весьма простых, но от этого не менее интересных вещах.
Персонажей в новелле - великое множество. Все они обладают очень качественным бэкграундом и весьма трогательной и увлекательной историей. Каждый из них, как живой, поэтому, я вас уверяю, вы не заскучаете.

[h1]Геймплей:[/h1]

Не удивляйтесь. В этой новелле есть некоторый геймплей. Чтобы получить, так называемую "правильную концовку", вам нужно собирать колобки света. Это, так называемые, частички счастья, которые переходят к вам в конце каждого рута. Всего их 13, но первоначально доступны будут лишь 7-8. Поэтому, сделав правильные выборы и осчастливив множество людей, вы будете в праве получить свою "хорошую концовку".

[h1]Иллюстрации:[/h1]

CG в новелле выполнены прекрасно. Конечно, каждый сам решает, нравится ли ему такой стиль рисовки или нет, но видно невооруженным глазом, что художники, рисовавшие данные иллюстрации, делали это от всей души, не скупясь на детали. Спрайты так же вышли очень красивыми и красочными. 

[h1]Музыка:[/h1]

Вот, что в новелле действительно прекрасно, так это музыка.  Композиторы, писавшие данные произведения, делали это с такой отдачей, с таким рвением и душой, что музыка мигом западает тебе в душу и ты больше не можешь жить без нее (такие вот у меня ощущения). Чего только стоит всеми известная песня Dango~... 

[h1]Итог:[/h1]

Вот мы и обсудили все положительные моменты данной новеллы. Если говорить о моем впечатлении в целом, то я не жалею потраченного на новеллу времени. Она дала мне ответы на некоторые мои вопросы, подарила множество различных эмоций и открыла новых персонажей, которые запали мне в душу. Музыка же настолько вошла в мою душу, что я теперь, как наркоман, не могу и дня без нее прожить :D В любом случае, к покупке обязательно рекомендую! 

[h1]Всем до скорых встреч и удачи! Bye~~[/h1]


P.S. Извиняюсь за свой не сосвсем емкий обзор. Я обязательно его доделаю и сделаю из него настоящий шедевр.

        [td]Result[/td]
[td][b]8.25/10[/b][/td]

[/table]

[h1]STORY/SETTING[/h1]	10	of 10
The main protagonist Okazaki Tomoya is in his last year at a private high school and living a life full of resentment. His mother died when he was young and his father is seeking refuge in drinking and gambling. One day after a fight Tomoya hurt his shoulder and is not able to play basketball ever again. After loosing this last resort Tomoya avoids his father and doesn't care about his education and gets easily aggressive, so he now is considered a delinquent. But after meeting a strange girl on his way to school his life is about to change....		
Basically you have 12 different paths to follow (9 with girls, 1 yaoi, 1 helping your teacher, 1 helping a guy searching for a job). Most of those paths are extremely sad. It is said it's impossible not to cry (something I can confirm). After playing through the game you eventually unlock After Story. It contains another 3 paths (1 Family path, 1 Sad Ending, 1 True Ending) and - Warning - the sad ending is going to destroy you. It is one of the most saddest story I ever read/played.		
I watched the Anime and played this game back in 2008 (poorly machine translated), so I knew what I was in for. It still crushed me and I could only play 3 - 4 paths each weekend. For me it's a masterpiece and there can only be one rating: [i]10 of 10[/i]		
		
[h1]GRAPHICS[/h1]	8	of 10
The Steam Version has upgraded graphics, so you could even enjoy it now, 13 years after it's original release. There is a good amount of CGs (even with slight alterations for mood, etc.), every character has his distinct features and the backgrounds are beautifully detailed.		
Sadly the animations are outdated, so they seem kind of strange within the higher res graphics. They are not really fluid and you are almost immediately reminded of the old age. The game also has a nice opening movie, which is perfectly fine as an introduction. Sadly they decided to hide the movie in the main menu, but you'll also see it at the beginning of After Story, making the introduction of the characters totally weird and wrong placed. Still for a VN it's [i]8 out of 10[/i]		
		
[h1]SOUND[/h1]	6	of 10
The BGM is pretty straight forward. There are a few themes for characters and situations und a few alterations. The funny parts try to be lively, the sad parts are slow and moody. It is so cliché it's almost boring. And after playing the full 50+ hours you are ether hooked or annoyed. There are iconic pieces you will probably remember and recognize your whole life (but only 2 or 3)... to be honest: the anime is way better in this regard and I wished they would have included things like the dango-song in this game. They ether wanted to stay as close as possible to the original or they simply didn't think about it and just focused on the translation.		
The Seiyuu did a great job back then. Now maybe a little outdated and a little in need of getting used to, but still: Here in Germany there a way worse voice actors making a lot more money.		
For the voiced songs: There is an opening, an insert, a general ending song and the true ending song. Of course all of them are in Japanese, but luckily you get a synchronized English subtitle. If you love J-Music you will love these songs and probably remember at least one of them every time you read the name Clannad. Everyone else.... well you can skip Opening and Ending if you really have to. Altogether sadly I can only give a [i]6 out of 10[/i]		
		
[h1]GAMEPLAY (BALANCE)[/h1]	9	of 10
The gameplay probably hasn't changed in the last 30 years or so. You have skip, auto and can scroll back, if you want to read something again. Additionally you can go back to a previously made choice if you don't like the direct results. You get a CG Mode, a Music Mode and you can even change your Name (also I have to advise against it!). A Scene Mode is missing, understandable but sad.		
Then there is one of the best ideas: Dangopedia. It has many Japanese specific term and every one of these terms is highlighted, so you can read the meaning behind it. For those who are not familiar with Japanese Media or Japanese culture it makes the game fully understandable and enjoyable. Sadly for an otaku like me it is sometimes very distracting to look up some English expressions to find the Japanese ones so I could understand the meaning behind it. For a English native speaker it's probably easier (you won't have to think in 3 languages after all xD ). Well, there are always improvements to be made, but it's a solid [i]9 of 10[/i]		
		
[h1]GAME CONTENTS AND PRICING[/h1]	9	of 10
There are 15 paths and a playtime of 50+ hours (I actually played 62h and skipped all previously read text). If you permit it, you can laugh, cry and simply enjoy the all day scenes and the love story. So stop whining! It’s a full price of 46 EUR for this masterpiece. Most I***ts pay more for 4h games like the 100th CoD. If you don't want to pay this kind of money simply wait for a sale or buy the key elsewhere. It's simply unfair to whine about a fair, reasonable price and try to scam developers and translators out of their earned money by raising a witch hunt.		
For those who can enjoy a Visual Novel the pricing is admittedly a little high, but more than worth it. The DLCs on the other hand are ridicules. I can't imagine why a digital manga and artbook would be worth 33 EUR and I probably never find out unless they are on sale for at least 50%. Overall pricing and contents of the game alone are [i]9 out of 10[/i]		
		
[h1]MISCELLANEOUS[/h1]	7.5	of 10
Like most games these days Clannad has trading cards and achievements. There are 7 Trading cards containing 7 of the 9 female love interests. The pictures to the cards are a simple full body of the character and a short description. If you want, you can try to get a set, but I can't neither recommend nor advise against it. The badge itself has the right Lvl 5 story wise and a nice foil one.		
There are 4 achievements you probably miss without a guide. Of course those are not grindy or anything (It's a VN after all), but they are really hilarious to get. The other 18 are straight forward story achievement (14 paths (the sad ending is not credited), prolog and 2 lights(needed for true ending)). For a Visual Novel the achievements are pretty much perfectly reasonable. Let's go with [i]7.5 out of 10[/i]		
		
[h1]CONCLUSION[/h1]	8.25	of 10
Also I personally want to give this game a 10, I tried to stay as objectively as possible. But in the end it's still  8.25 Points. I can fully recommend this game. If you have the money and enjoy this kind of games don't hesitate: Buy and Play it ASAP. Everyone else is free to wait for a sale or a price drop, but this game is definitely a must-have for this genre!

33313843.review:
English here, French review below.

After all this time I heard good things about it, it was about time I read it myself.
Well, people who are saying that it's among the best VN ever written must not have read a lot of them. It's not bad, but it's far from being among the best.
Little Busters, from the same studio, is better in every aspects.
Can we say that it's an overrated game? Yes, despite its qualities.

This Visual Novel can deliver good stories (Tomoyo, Fujibayashi) as well as mediocre ones (Yukine, Kappei) and the rest (Kotomi, Fuuko, Mei...) is just average in regards to others Visual Novels.
Note that if you play without following a guide, you might end on a badly written route and be left with a bad impression.

As for Nagisa, she's supposed to be the central female character. The most developped, the best written one, but she's not. She's obnoxious, her personality is boring and her way of talking too. You have to really fall in love with her to put up with her for five minutes.
It's a shame to fail such an important character in this story, since you don't care nor feel anything when she meets problems.

After that, the After Story part is not much better. It's long and often boring, to the point that anything can happen and you won't care because you have no emotional bond with the characters, especially Nagisa.
Although the psychological evolution of Tomoya follows a logical progression until [spoiler]the birth of his daughter  [/spoiler], what happens next is unbelievable, in the wrong way. It destroys the relationship between the player and the protagonist, making him do stupid actions, incoherent and 
out of character. It's hard to keep relating to him when he suddenly acts like a pr!ck. I understand why the writer did it [spoiler] the link with his father [/spoiler] but it's very badly written.

And above all, there's a lot of junk. What I'm calling junk is all those hours reading nothing. For hours and hours, neither the story nor the characters gain anything. There's no progression. That's exactly the kind of junk that must be cut in a real novel. There's no reason to keep it in a Visual Novel. It feels like the game has been written to boast "we've made a X hour long game with X characters!" only that it's an example of what should be cut (some characters add nothing at all) and the game would have been better without those millstones.

The other game, Side Stories, makes a better job at telling its stories because it goes straight to the point. No fillers, no useless characters. If only the original Clannad had been written like Side Stories...

I'm putting a red thumb on it, not because the game is bad, it isn't, but because for the same price and mostly for all the hours you'll spend on it, it's better to read another VN.

-----------------


Depuis le temps que j'en entendais parler en bien, il était temps de le lire moi-même.
Et ceux qui disent que c'est un des meilleurs VN n'ont sûrement pas dû en lire beaucoup. Ce n'est pas mauvais, mais c'est loin d'être parmi les meilleurs.
Little Busters, du même studio, lui est supérieur sur tous les plans.
Peut-on parler de titre surcôté, overrated ? Oui, malgré ses qualités.

Ce Visual Novel est capable de proposer de bonnes histoires (Tomoyo, Fujibayashi) comme de médiocres (Yukine, Kappei) et le reste est juste dans la moyenne de ce qu'on peut attendre d'un Visual Novel (Kotomi, Fuuko, Mei...).
Du coup, si vous jouez sans guide, vous risquez de tomber sur une histoire ratée et avoir une mauvaise impression.

Quant à Nagisa, elle est censée être le personnage féminin central. La plus travaillée, la plus réussie, mais en fait, non. Elle est pénible, sa personnalité est fatigante et sa façon de parler aussi. Il faut vraiment être amoureux d'elle pour la supporter plus de cinq minutes.
C'est vraiment dommage de rater un personnage aussi important dans l'histoire, car du coup on ne ressent rien quand il lui arrive des problèmes.

Finalement, l'After Story ne relève pas vraiment le niveau. C'est long et souvent fatigant. Du coup, il peut arriver n'importe quoi, on s'en fiche parce qu'on n'a pas de lien émotionnel avec les personnages, surtout Nagisa.
Et si l'évolution psychologique de Tomoya suivait une progression logique jusqu'à [spoiler] la naissance de sa fille [/spoiler], ce qui suit juste après est illogique et détruit toute la relation entre le joueur et le protagoniste, en forçant des décisions incohérentes et stupides. Difficile de continuer à s'attacher à lui quand il agit subitement comme un abruti fini. Je comprends les raisons de l'auteur [spoiler] le lien avec son père [/spoiler] mais c'est très mal amené.

Mais surtout, surtout, il y a énormément de déchet. Par là, j'entends toutes ces heures de lecture qui n'apportent rien, ni à l'histoire ni aux personnages. C'est exactement le genre de truc qui doit être coupé dans un vrai roman, aucune raison de le garder dans un Visual Novel.
On a l'impression que le jeu a été écrit pour dire "on a un jeu qui dure X heures et avec Y personnages !" sauf que c'est un exemple de ce qui aurait dû être supprimé (certains personnages ne servent absolument à rien) et le jeu en aurait été meilleur sans ces boulets.

L'autre jeu, Side Stories, s'en sort beaucoup mieux pour raconter ses histoires car il va droit au but. Pas de remplissage ni de personnages inutiles. Si seulement le jeu Clannad de base avait été écrit pareillement...

Je mets un pouce rouge, non pas parce que le jeu est mauvais, ce n'est pas vrai, mais parce que pour le même prix et surtout toutes les heures qu'on peut y passer il vaut mieux miser sur un autre VN.

32979575.review:
十多年前的游戏，十多年前的画质。可以买辐射4的价格，又或是几杯咖啡，几杯奶茶，都会比这个没有中文的老游戏值得，趁着打折我还是入了，这次夏季折扣我没有入任何别的游戏，就连只要3块的半条命都没去试。虽然我下定决心今后不再在steam上用钱，不再在游戏上花时间了，我还是义无反顾买了这款游戏

原因很简单，高三那一年，在遇到渚和朋也之前，我还在抱怨父母为什么让我读理科，我对未来充满恐惧，我害怕失败，害怕被人看不起却又不努力。总想着把自己的愤怒与恐惧发泄到自己身边的人身上。我那时候还有幼稚的想法，对父母的关心报以冷漠，拿着学习累的借口，伤害他们。
在那一阵要自暴自弃，放弃高考乃至放弃人生的时候，我在无聊的那3天里补了这部老作品。很简单的日常生活，很简单的生活细节，却直击我的心。
因为朋也，我明白未来的命运虽然波折，但我们还有爱在，还有爱我的人在。就像古河的父亲所说，孩子正是父母的希望。等到朋也对女儿说，你的妈妈是怎么样的一个人，作为一个没心没肺，整天浑浑噩噩的男生，我哭得稀里哗啦。
从那时候开始，我明白了很多，明白了自己的责任，也明白了亲人的爱。虽然我的父母不如早苗和大叔，但我想，他们真是世界上最好的父母，我欠他们一个像渚一样懂事孝顺的儿子。

这时候，写着写着哭了，耳中忽然响起团子大家族的旋律~~dango~dango~~


如果你有幸在人生中遇到这部作品，就好好珍惜它吧！                                                              ----2017.6.29
过去的两周变化很大，我彻底从抑郁症走出来了。从前遇到挫折会逃避，遇到别人的否定会伤心很久的我，从此变得坚强，变得对生活充满期待。在两周前的我，经历着最艰难的时光。即将选择放弃的我，耳机中刚好播到团子大家族这首歌，我忽然想起了很多以前做的决定。我想着留级3年的渚，到处找工作，最后选择艰难工作的朋也。我觉得我似乎还可以做些什么。至少还没有走到最苦难的时候。
请大家：永远对未来充满希望

32685136.review:
To start of with the obvious this is an amazing VN, that much is clear. But there are a few things to consider if you're thinking of buying this:

1. Even by Visual Novel standards this is extremely a long read, like between 100-150+ hours to complete so be so be warned if you prefer your VN's around the normal length of 30-50 hours.

2. This VN is one of the first that made VN's popular in the West, but saying that this hasn't aged well as it did come out in 2004 and today's standards of what VN's are different.

3. Even the most diehard fan of this VN would tell you the pacing in this is snail's pace so if you want to jump in, beware its a very slow burner.

4. The Characters are all amazing.... Well expect Nagisa she is very irritating so it does affect the enjoyment of the "true route" and the After Story as she is the Canon love interest which is a shame as others like Yukine, Kotomi and Tomoyo suit so much better but oh well. 

5. Despite it's age this VN is still full of heart, charm and humour that still matches up well with today's standards.

So in closing if this was 2004 I'd give this VN a solid 8/10 but now in 2017 I'd give it a more realistic 6/10 due to it being just not as good as today standards like I mentioned above. But still is one of those VN's you have to read at least once as if you don't you're just a damn casual... Haha

32053556.review:
When I first looked at this game, I thought "Typical anime high school girl nonsense". How wrong I was. What I found was far and away the most engaging and heartfelt story I have ever experienced. I absolutely love Clannad and cannot recommend it highly enough.

Clannad is a visual novel originally released in Japan in 2004. Voices were added in a 2008 rerelease. In 2015 it was given an official English release. It is regarded by the visual novel community as a paragon of the genre and one of the greatest ever.

Clannad has several different plotlines which can be read in almost any order. These plotlines are mostly love stories. The content and quality of these are what make Clannad a legend. Rather than pander to sexual fantasies, Clannad's stories aim straight at the reader's heart. Some of these hit really close to home for me. At multiple points, I had to stop reading for a few minutes to collect myself before I could continue. Some were so good that I had to go back and reread them again just a couple of days later.

If you complete Clannad, you will cry at least once. Accept this going in. If someone tells you they completed it without crying, they're a liar.

If you're still on the fence, then consider that I was once in your position. I was unsure of if I should even give this game a shot. I took the chance based on word of mouth. Now here I am gushing over it. One of the best works of fiction I have ever experienced.

31868802.review:
[h1]Clannad[/h1]

Il faut à mon avis être complètement étranger au monde des histoires visuelles et de l’animation pour ne jamais avoir entendu parlé de Clannad. Cette histoire est devenue en quelques années un monument, une référence du genre particulièrement réputée pour le tourbillon émotionnel qu’elle provoque. 
En effet, même préparé psychologiquement vous passerez inévitablement du rire aux larmes et il vous faudra à mon avis un peu de temps pour digérer l’ensemble et attaquer une nouvelle lecture. 
Vous incarnez Tomoya Okazaki, un jeune délinquant que vous suivrez dans son quotidien qui se passe la plus grande partie en milieu scolaire. Un scenario en apparence classique mais qui cache une histoire bien plus riche et complexe.
La recette de Clannad, selon moi, c’est d’abord des personnages extraordinaires, complètement atypiques pour certains d’entres eux, parfois touchants et émouvants, parfois drôles en tout cas tous attachants. C’est aussi, une histoire bien écrite pour chacun d’entre eux avec un voile de mystères qui se lève peu à peu en toile de fond. Le tout saupoudré de belles images et de sublimes musiques.
Enfin niveau gameplay, le jeu est tellement riche en choix qui ont une incidence (même minime) que çà le rend assez difficile surtout que certaines routes ne se débloquent pas de suite mais d’un autre côté on découvre facilement de nouvelles choses à chaque fois qu’on recommence.  
Çà peut ne pas convenir aux personnes qui n’aiment pas les romances, les drames et histoires poignantes qui jouent avec vos émotions. 
Par contre si vous êtes amateur de ce genre d’histoire visuelle, Clannad est parmi ce qui se fait de mieux, comptez pas loin de 100h de lecture que vous n’oublierez à mon avis pas de sitôt.

[h1]En conclusion : [/h1]
Clannad reste aujourd’hui parmi ce qui se fait de mieux dans son genre. Une œuvre unique qui joue avec vos émotions comme nulle autre. Que ce soit les personnages, l’histoire et philosophie qu’elle véhicule, l’art et la musique, tout frise avec la perfection. Si vous faite partit des chanceux qui ne connaissent pas encore cette histoire je vous la recommande vivement !

[b]Bilan : 10/10[/b]

[h1]English summary[/h1]
« Clannad » Still remains one of the best visual novel.  A masterpiece that plays with your emotions like no other. Whether it be the characters, the story and philosophy it conveys, the art and the music, all is close to perfection. If you are lucky enought not to know the story, i highly recommend it !

31867197.review:
Make no mistake: This Visual Novel is worth every penny, even if you've already watched the anime.

The number of life lessons, key memorable moments and general emotional connections I have gained and treasured from this VN are incredible. As a grown man, I'm not afraid to say how much I've teared up and cried at a lot of the character paths in Clannad, and it only gets better as you continue playing, learning to understand the concept of how choices you make in your lives could lead to much bigger and better things in the future. Although the anime did an impeccable job of keeping as much content in the series as possible, the Clannad Visual Novel cannot be topped for having such a lengthy emotional rollercoaster of alternative endings.

I'm still not fully finished with all of the potential outcomes of this VN, and having currently racked up over 60 hours (currently) to this game, I can't stress enough how well worth this purchase was, even at the seemingly steep £30 price tag.

In particular I was surprised with Kotomi's Arc in this Visual Novel, which was much more detailed than shown in the anime. It is probably my favourite Arc of all, and helped me be thankful for and treasure the closest people in my life, as well as changing my perspective on how I should live. If you are even slightly interested in the concept of this franchise, I wholeheartedly and undisputably recommend this masterpiece of a story.

A key aspect of the game that set me off many a time were the soundtracks featured. These consist of some of the most beautifully crafted musical scores I've ever had the pleasure of listening to, and every time I hear them brings back events, Arcs and character quotes which made for the Visual Novel to be as memorable as it was. I applaud whoever created the "Shining In The Sky" and "To The Same Heights" Soundtracks; they are my personal favourites.

If I had to give any advice for playing the Clannad VN, I would strongly suggest that you take your time playing through it. Don't think of it as something you can speedrun through and still enjoy; treasure every moment of the Visual Novel, funny, awkward or emotional, and the events that unfold will really have a lasting impact on you, hopefully for the better.

Truly the best story I've ever read.

~

EDIT: After truly having completed all there is to this game, I feel the need to add a finishing note to my review.

Finishing the After Story, after so much pain and sadness, was such a rewarding and complete feeling. It made me finally understand what it means to love and treasure those close to you, and make the most of the short time you have on this world.

For anyone doubting continuing with the After Story as a result of it being too heartaching (I've been there) be rest assured that it's all in perfect timing to come back around and complete the missing pieces of the puzzle, allowing you to rest easy and feel blessed that you had the chance to experience something as unique as this.

Nothing comes close to what CLANNAD has done for me.

剧情：key社上架steam的游戏和DLC都买了，除去智代After里面的RPG成就还没开始弄，毕竟要7天全99级和全成就有点麻烦，找资料研究下先，可以说其余都全成就了。而《CLANNAD》是最后来弄全成就的，因为没中文，外加结局多，阅读量有点伤，趁着放假弄了。全部可以算15个结局吧（把汽艇算上了），原本想着也就补补动漫系列没有的角色剧情就好，不过全路线下来，无论是有的还是没有的都相对比动漫来说要精致得多，也就不存在情怀一说了。除去动漫，本身就是一部很出众的作品。15个结局中，始终是绪-汐线给我的感动最大，当初看动漫泪崩，如今玩游戏相对好点，打转。

CG:相对完美，但是汐的太少了，集体照好评。

BGM:最不缺的就是这个吧，几十首BGM都是经典，电脑打开，打开游戏，听首BGM也是不错的选择

游戏背景：所有结局玩完，除去每条线的相关不同，基本上前面的通项都是一样的背景，没什么变化，好评在于每个线路结局时那段剧情的背景设计，本身结局剧情就是集CG的，然而CG只选了其中一两个画面，建议没有线路的结局选项之前都存个档，翻结局剧情看背景也不错

可玩性：key社已上架steam的游戏当中论整体性最可以舍去情怀一词的作品。无论是动漫党还是纯入手的，都值得。而其100+的定价严格来说真的值，整体内容的确值这个价，说情怀也好，说炒冷饭也好，都不可否认游戏本身的优略性。

总评：10/10      神作     虽说没有官中，但严格来说还是得满分好评。key社作品官中计划也不知什么时候能到这，如果汉化，一定重玩一遍。

ps.昨天玩完，想着评测该怎么写想了许久，但真写完了自己再看，却发现没多少实际的东西，不过也不打算改了，与其去说哪条哪条线给了我什么什么样的感受什么的，还不如选择“就这样吧'。

这游戏不是卖情怀
这游戏不是卖情怀
这游戏不是卖情怀

加入愿望单已久的游戏，我终于补了这一票，你问我133元值不值那肯定是值得的。尽管他没有中文，但CL就是CL，是永恒不变的感动和人生哲学。
CLANNAD是什么样的作品相信不用我再重复多说了，在这里每一个买了这款游戏的朋友都应该自己的答案了，大家都是充满着爱才会买票的，其中的内容应该不会再陌生了。
cl的故事性是非常值得一次又一次回味的，平淡的日常充满着感动，亲情、友情和爱情在这里是引人深思的深刻话题，剧情和人物刻画在这里体现的淋漓尽致。
BGM非常的好，我永远也不会忘记渚、琴美的主题曲和小小的手心，每次听到这些BGM我都快哭了。
千言万语的评测都表达不了cl的真谛。我爱clannad。
只要你玩过一次或者是看过动漫就不会忘记他。
致永远的青春，致那条蜿蜒曲折的坡道，致那个光守护的小镇。

31273986.review:
I am going to assume that if you have found this game's page, then it is incredibly likely that you have come here having watched the rather brilliant anime done by Kyoto Animation. You are probably wondering if the source material lives up to that high benchmark. The answer is an unequivical yes. The anime focussed mostly on Nagisa's route, and interspersed the other ones as mini arcs whilst still focussing mostly on her. In the visual novel, you get the chance to see each girl's individual route properly (some of which weren't even alluded to in the anime), with all romantic elements intact, and with none of the brevity which the anime had to use in its adaptation. On top of this, unlike the anime, you are seeing all of the events from Tomoya's point of view, with his own thoughts constantly on display. This serves to make him the best developed character in the entire game, and adds new dimensions to him that are simply not there in the anime. This in turn makes every heartbreaking moment that much more poignant. Make no mistakes, although Clannad is deeply rooted in "bishoujo game" territory, Tomoya is by no means a bland self insert character. When going through the various routes, you make the decisions for him, but his personality will still dictate what happens. This is refreshing since a lot of VN protagonists can be a little one dimensional.

In terms of value for money, having played Clannad for over 30 hours (at the time of writing), I have currently completed less than half of the game, so if you are wondering whether the price of this visual novel is worth it, the answer is an indisputable yes. In terms of value, there are very few things that will give you the same bang for your buck as this gargantuan visual novel. For those unfamiliar with visual novels, they are much less interactive than a game, but more interactive than a book. The game is 99% reading text with 1% decision making, so be prepared for a good long read when you download this, since according to statistics fetched online, it has about as many words as nearly two readings of 'War and Peace' (approx 1.25m words). Just sit back, relax, and let the story wash over you. Take your time, complete the game's 12+ routes. It will make you laugh, it will make you cry like a baby, and if you're like me it will find a special place in your heart.  If you loved the anime and you are a keen reader, then this is an experience you will never forget.

补票充值信仰

最初从air接触到cl，不知道key，不知道催泪弹，不知道大魔王也没有接触过gal。印象里只有压倒一切的悲伤和悲伤里难言的温情。沉浸在这种情感中足足几月，夜不能寐，闭眼就是一道长长的坡道，樱花散落。
突然就很庆幸自己是以如此无心的态度接触到这样一部作品并为之感动，没有掺杂任何他人的看法，不存在理想与现实的落差。怀着这样一种无色的初心，因而对它的评价全部发自内我，以至于很久之后才真正了解到这部作品的地位。
也很庆幸最初就遇到cl，让我从最开始就明白到了：有些动画真的不仅仅是动画

因为每次重温都有不同的感触，无论是从主观上——慢慢理解起到各线蕴藏的曾经被忽视的各种情感，以及客观上——无可挑剔的音乐，铺垫以及细节，所以这部作品从未从我的神坛上下来。它以如此宽大的气量孕润了如此庞杂的情感，难能可贵的是每份情感都无暇到只能奢望。所以我说，其实cl是一个无数美好的谎言编织起来的梦。ALL LIES，But I believe in that lie.
引用琴美线里印象颇深的一句话
[i]“Day before yesterday I saw a rabbit, and yesterday a deer, and today, you”[/i]
大概所有我能想象到的美好都是怀着这样一颗赤子之心去表达的。

31119549.review:
[h1]Review powered by [url=http://steamcommunity.com/groups/mamilosclub]Mamilos Club Group.[/url][/h1]

CLANNAD é um jogo de estilo [i]Visual Novel / Anime[/i] que irá surpreender seus jogadores com sua rica história. A princípio  você pode pensar que o jogo não vale o preço, que é apenas mais uma novela visual qualquer. Pois digo que este jogo irá lhe render várias horas para completar parte da história, e muito mais para platiná-lo.

A história do jogo (e do anime) gira em torno da convivência e dos problemas tanto do protagonista, como os de todos os personagens envolvidos. Você é um estudante do terceiro ano chamado Tomoya Okazaki, e grande parte dos envolvimentos ocorrem dentro de sua escola e ao caminho dela. Não se preocupe, não vou aprofundar muito para não gerar spoilers.

Os gráficos foram muito bem trabalhados, nota-se na ausência de serrilhados e nos detalhes presentes em cada aspecto do jogo. A soundtrack é incrível e há uma grande variedade de músicas ao fundo, contudo eles focaram demais na soundtrack e acabaram esquecendo a ambientação sonora e demais efeitos. O carisma e representação dos personagens estão estampados em suas falas e nas expressões faciais.

Assim como grande parte das novelas visuais, você fará escolhas em determinados momentos que influenciarão no desfecho do jogo. Grande parte das conquistas também são determinadas pelas suas ações, sendo liberadas ao final de cada rota.

Achei um tanto irônico o jogo apresentar dublagem em japonês, mas não apresentar legendas em japonês. Também não há legendas para demais línguas, apenas o inglês está presente. Isso pode fazer o consumidor não adquirir o jogo. Levando em conta o seu preço, receio que os desenvolvedores deveriam trabalhar esta parte e focar um pouco no público que não tem domínio da língua inglesa.

[list]

 [*] Steam Trading Cards
[/list]
[h1]Sugestões[/h1]
[list]
 [*] Adicionar legendas de demais línguas para abranger o público-alvo
