31111348.review:
clannad全线通关，于是来写个评测。
clannad一直以来都是饱受赞誉的作品，在数年前看过动画后clannad在我心中的动画排名就始终占有一席之地。作为一个VN玩家，如今终于读毕VN本体，似乎也是缘分的指引。clannad常被粉丝称为人生，虽然可能有失偏颇，但clannad的最大特色确实是展示了一群普通人的生活的状态和人生轨迹。clannad被主要分成了两个部分，校园篇和AFTER STORY篇，其中AFTER STORY被认为是clannad的主体，也是clannad动画的第二季内容。
先讲校园篇。男主角是一个因隐情而消沉的高中问题生，在校不时扰乱风纪，在家与家人关系僵硬。相较其他VN中常见的普通男主亦或者龙傲天系男主，这个设定是很有趣的。以这样一位有问题的学生作为视角，开始的校园篇自然是与普通学生的生活不同的。虽然说这种生活与普通学生不同，但我回忆自身作为一名普通学生的高中生活时，却可以确信clannad中的校园篇是真实可信的，其中发生的事情，除去戏剧化的部分，完全可能发生在现实生活中。大概正是这真实吸引了跟我一样的不少玩家，对clannad给出极佳的评价。
如果说校园篇的真实是高中生的生活，那AFTER STORY则可称作是人生了。在AFTER STORY中男主和女主相互扶持，工作上得到了可靠的前辈的帮助，生活中感受了来着女主父母的关爱，同时还与自身的父亲经历了吵闹、不解、憎恨最终理解的坎坷日子。在女主因为生产而死后，男主意志再度消沉，直到数年后才再度为自己的女儿奋起。在AFTER STORY中描写了不同人物的生活，表现了他们的人生态度，为读者展现了普通人生活的可能性，也交代了男主自身发生变化的原因。整个故事温馨感人，故事的主旨由女主道出“家族爱”，人如果能不视他人为异端，广泛地授予自身的爱，让彼此都快乐，这就是家族爱。能拥有家族爱的人，想必是积极向上的人。
正是如此，我认为clannad是所有VN中的翘楚。另外，让我点评clannad校园篇中的线路，琴美的线是最好的！

31110258.review:
There isn't much to say about this game that's new so I'll keep it relatively short.

Clannad is more of an experience rather than a game. 
It is so emotionally moving that it can cause people to make certain decisions that they otherwise wouldn't have, whether it be spending more time with your family, or just enjoying school while you still can.

With 11 main routes and several side endings, this visual novel easily racks up 60-80 hours worth of reading. Accompanied with fully voiced characters and a phenomenal soundtrack, this game is a definite must-buy.

Clannad is one of a kind, and I truly hope everyone gets to experience this piece of work in their lifetime before they lose the chance.

30845005.review:
I first read this VN nine years ago when the anime was coming out, it was my first Visual Novel ever and I was not prepared for the sheer volume of content. I was overwhelmed by how much attention to detail there was in the storylines, how every day of Tomoya's life is explained to you, there are many conversations that do not even necessarily add to the plot but are just there to give you a sense of who the characters are and what it's really like to be in Tomoya's shoes. Never before have I experienced that level of intimacy with fictional characters before, I truly felt like I had lived Tomoya's life, and that made the emotional moments of Clannad feel more personally impactful than any other story I've ever read. 

This was my second re-read and it was just as amazing the third time. Truly one of a kind.

This masterpiece is an absolute must-read for fans of visual novels and the story has become one of my favorites of any medium. I will absolutely re-read this in the future.

Put simply, the game is just about life. Life will have ups and downs and in it you will meet many different people and experience many different things, but it is a journey that everyone takes and along the way the choices you make will determine your destination.

While the game is a bit old and the character sprites are different and may be jarring at first, the characters themselves, the music, the story, everything makes this epic journey one that is worth the time to complete.

I really enjoyed this VN and highly recommend the anime adaptation as well as it is very well done.

30641885.review:
[h1]Pros[/h1]
[list]
	[*][b]Length & replayability[/b] --- Over ten unique character routes adding up to about 60 hours of content. Rereading certain portions is encouraged and is also mandatory to unlock the epilogue. Previously read text can be fast-forwarded to quickly see all the deviations a choice will bring.
	[*][b]Epilogue[/b] --- "After Story", a full-length epilogue route for one of the main characters, moves past the safe and comfortable school setting. All of the previous problems faced by the protagonist are made trivial as he confronts the harsh realities of life and gradually becomes more sympathetic as a character. The large time skips throughout the route can be disorienting, but they do not serve as a detriment to any of the most impactful moments. After Story is worth the effort to unlock and the full experience is enough to steal the show.
	[*][b]Characterization[/b] --- Characters can start off with seemingly unnatural personalities that will clash with the reader's enjoyment of the story when they act out in ways that make situations needlessly complicated. After going through the proper routes, the sequence of events and reasoning that led them to have such demeanors is established. By the end, disliking a character will not be due to poor writing, but the fleshing out of their backstories and beliefs.
	[*][b]Tone[/b] --- Tone is appropriate as the story develops, especially during After Story.
[/list]

[h1]Neutral[/h1]
[list]
	[*][b]Several character routes[/b] --- The majority of routes range from okay to great, but there are several that are uninteresting or come across as afterthoughts during the writing of the visual novel.
[/list]

[h1]Conclusion[/h1]
Memorable characters and a story that's usually charming, unexpectedly comedic, and at times tragic. Possibly Key's best work up to the time of its original release, Clannad borrows aspects from Kanon and Air and introduces them into a much larger setting. Familiarity with these previous works will spoil some routes' surprises, but the improved writing and presentation will more than make up for this loss among fans.

For those new to the genre or Key, the usual price for Clannad will be off-putting as an entry level visual novel, but the quality and length do end up justifying the cost for those that commit to reading it to completion. At a length of at least [b]65 hours[/b] with the After Story included and based on reading speed, it's [b]highly recommended to buy Clannad[/b].

30338261.review:
Ceux qui connaissent Clannad, arrêtez de lire les évaluations et allez l'acheter !

Ceux qui ne connaissent pas, comment dire.. Si vous cherchez un VN qui vous prend aux tripes, avec des personnages attachants, des histoires parfaitement construites, des doublages de qualité, des artworks sublimes, et surtout que ça ne vous dérange pas de passer des soirées entières à pleurer seul devant votre écran, alors allez-y lancez-vous !

Histoire: 10/10
"Vous incarnez Okazaki Tomoya, un cancre notoire qui ne vient en cours que pour y dormir, jusqu'au jour où vous rencontrez une jeune fille qui changera à jamais votre vie."
Une introduction extrêmement classique, sauf que c'est bien plus qu'un jeu de drague, d'ailleurs ce n'est absolument pas ça le coeur du scénario. C'est selon la sensibilité de chacun, donc difficile d'être objectif, surtout quand on parle d'un VN, mais je dirais qu'à une ou deux exceptions près où je n'ai pas vraiment accroché toute les routes sont magnifiques. En plus, peu importe celle qu'on suit, les personnages secondaires auront toujours un développement poussé et surtout différent d'une route à l'autre, rendant l'univers vivant et évolutif selon vos choix et actions. L'immersion est donc totale et il est nécessaire de faire toute les routes pour vraiment comprendre les personnages.

Son: 10/10
BO magnifique, toujours la bonne musique au bon moment, elle accompagne parfaitement l'action et amplifie l'émotion qui se dégage de la scène. À écouter sans modération !

Image: 10/10
C'est beau. Très beau. Magnifique même ! La galerie d'illustrations est une mine d'or, on retrouve les temps forts du jeu accompagnés d'artworks sublimes, il y e a pour tout les goûts et chaque protagoniste a droit à sa section d'images.

Durée de vie: 10/10
Comptez une bonne 60aine d'heures pour le terminer à 100% si vous lisez vite et que vous avez un guide pour les derniers succès. Si vous êtes du genre à prendre votre temps, comptez plutôt 70-80h de lecture. L'immense majorité du texte est propre aux routes, c'est à dire qu'il n'est pas répété et que vous avez "vraiment" 60h à 80h de lecture où vous (re)découvrez les personnages de Clannad sous différents angles. La rejouabilité n'est selon moi pas en reste, refaire une route après en avoir fait d'autres peut aider à comprendre la réaction d'un personnage ou expliquer un événement précis, toute les histoires sont interconnectées et on débloque même parfois un dialogue bonus qui ajoute du détail à l'ensemble ! D'ailleurs petite parenthèse pour dire qu'en plus de la galerie vous aurez une "Dangopedia" qui contiens de nombreux termes entendu durant certains dialogues, accompagnés d'une description qui en plus d'ajouter du contenu au jeu vous offre un peu de culture générale sur le Japon.

Les + : c'est beau, c'est très bien écrit, la durée de vie est exceptionnelle, l'OST est magnifique, bref c'est Clannad

Les - : intégralement en anglais (c'est compréhensible pour un novice mais mieux vaut être à l'aise avec l'anglais), le surcoût en mouchoirs, le prix même s'il est largement justifié au vue du contenu proposé

Recommandé à 100%, c'est une expérience que vous n'êtes pas près d'oublier !

30320974.review:
It's easy to say that Clannad is one of the best VNs I ever read, considering its immense popularity. But it's true that few engrossed me as much as Clannad, that I just couldn't put them down (even when I tried). It's not flawless, of course, and I can even understand why some downright dislike it, but it's truly a remarkable experience.

As often with these kinds of things, it's largely due to the characters. Every single one, with the exception of a few purely villainous minor characters, is very likeable. Not always right away, there were some that I found difficult to like at first, but at the end I was fond of all of them. Whether they are tragic, fun or just plain sympathetic, at the end I cared about at least every major character and found myself deeply invested in their stories.

These stories are pretty diverse, with the characters having their own personal struggle. Pretty much all of them (with a few exceptions) are family-related (as that's the overall theme of the VN), like a girl trying to achieve a big goal for her brother, even when that means putting her own desires aside, a little sister seeing her brother fallen from grace, doubting that he even cares about her anymore, another one hooking up her sister with the boy she loves, deeply hurting herself in the process, and of course the daughter that is wracked with guilt, when she discovers how much her parents sacrificed for her sake.

As typical for VNs, these stories are spread out over several different routes, with the main character often (but not always) entering a relationship with the central character. While they're largely independent, it's not rare for them to intermingle with each other and finishing some routes can cause changes in others. One route even only gets fully concluded when another is played after it.

In its structure, Clannad typically follows a certain formula, in which things are pretty light-hearted and rather comedic at first, introducing and developing the characters, only for things to go wrong soon after. It's very effective, as it takes time to make you really like and care about the characters, which makes the tragedy that befalls them all the more painful. Once hooked, it's hard to stop, as you really want to see how things develop and hope that everything ends (relatively) well.

Once all the main routes are finished (and certain choices have been made), a continuation of one route gets unlocked (appropriately titled "After Story"). This isn't just a mere epilogue or extra, but an important (possibly even the most important) part, of the entire VN. It's practically composed of several "mini-routes", that follow the same pattern as before. It's here that the story hits the hardest, with the most heartrending scenes of the entire VN. Some might find it even too much, but keeping at it leads to a rewarding conclusion.

Visually, Clannad is... not impressive. The characters tend to look rather off and many might be put off by the overall style. But it's not that bad and one gets used to it after a relatively short time.

When it comes to sound, Clannad shines much more. Even without knowing language, the speech really enhances the experience with VAs all voicing their characters nearly perfectly, to the point they hard to imagine without them. The only negative is that the main character himself isn't voiced. Which isn't unusual in VNs, but very glaring here, as he has a very defined personality and even the most minor characters got voiced.

The music is just great. It's actually one of the best points of Clannad and greatly supports every scene, whether it's funny, mysterious, dramatic or (and especially) sad.

However, it's not hard to point out flaws. One of the most glaring aspects is that the plots are rather blatantly built for the sake of drama. Several things don't quite make sense, characters tend to act in rather odd ways and quite some issues could have been avoided rather easily. Depending on how much you can tolerate these things (it's hard to outright overlook them), they can hamper your enjoyment of the stories.

As typical, "gameplay" consists of several choices, some important, others not so much. It's not always obvious what's what and some routes are heavily influenced by choices that don't seem to have much to do with anything. For unlocks, several specific choices have to be made and, as mentioned before, two routes have to be played in a certain order. That makes it rather tricky to get the full story. Using guides may therefore be preferable.

And of course, Clannad is pretty expensive. As much as I like this VN and as much content as it has, it's rather tricky to defend the full price, especially considering that it's nearly 15 years old by now. Of course, with Steam having sales rather often, it shouldn't be hard to get it at a better price. It's certainly more than worth the €20 I paid for it.

Overall, while some might find it too melodramatic, Clannad is a really great VN with likeable characters and interesting storylines. I can only recommend to at least try it out.

30303354.review:
This is my first review here on Steam. And I am writing this because this games has surprised me like no other game has done before.
First of all I cannot really explain why I bought this game in the first place. I am no fan of mangas, I have never played a visual novel before and I am not sure I have spent as much money on a game before here on Steam. I think it was the many positive reviews that made me buy Clannad and a curiosity of how I would like a visual novel game.
Well, that money was well invested! Clannad managed to conquer the number one spot of my most favourite games which had forever belonged to Mass Effect 2.
The stories are so well written, the characters so funny and/or cute, all with their pros and cons. The game keeps getting better with each story because the more of the scenarios you play the better you get to know the different characters and the funnier some scenes are since you understand certain things better.
A lot of people in other reviews stated that they started crying at various points in the game when they reached particularly sad parts of stories. When I read that I thought this could never happen to me because I had never cried when reading before. But I have to admit there were indeed a few scenes in the game where I fought really hard to keep my tears back, the stories were just so heart touching and emotional. I find it even more important though to mention that the moments when I laughed out loud far outweighed those sad moments. There are so many hilarious moments I find it hard to believe. I can definitely say that I have never laughed more in any other computer game before.
I am simply glad I bought this game. It gave me many, many hours of enjoyment. And in 2 or 3 years when I start forgetting the details of the stories I can well imagine going back to this game and reading some of the favourite stories again.

30275182.review:
Clannad is definitely one of the best visual novels out there. More than three years after watching the anime series, I finally found the courage to face this heart-rending story again. Compared to the anime, the novel proceeds at slower pace, making you really fall in love with all the characters and enjoy their individual routes.

My three favourite routes were Nagisa's (+After Story), Kotomi's and Tomoyo's.

Overall, I have next to nothing to complain about. Due to the tons of content (easily 100+ hours), I can confidently recommend buying the game to anyone who is interested, even for the full price.

Final rating: 9/10 (my second favorite visual novel)

(Next section contains SPOILERS, so proceed with caution)
The only thing that leaves kind of a bitter aftertaste is the way the true ending in After Story is handled. First, you have to go through all the traumatic experiences of witnessing deaths of both Nagisa and Ushio. Then, you have to return to the point when Nagisa was still alive, to collect the last light orb from Akio's sidestory. That, by itself, horribly disrupts the gradation of the story. With all the light orbs, you gain access to the true ending, which is supposed to be some kind of a final closure to the novel. My problem is that the true ending basically denies all that makes After Story exceptional: devastated Tomoya getting up from the pits of despair while being saved by the gentle smile of his daughter. I feel that just brushing off all the events following Nagisa's death with some hardly explainable deus ex machina kind of spoilt my feelings about the ending. The best closure to the novel would be for the mentioned miracle to save dying Ushio and let her grow up by Tomoya's side. This is the only reason I cannot give Clannad 10/10, which I think it objectively deserves. But no matter how hard I think about it, the ending was a bit disappointing to me.

30189816.review: It's a huge game. It took me 69 hours to finish everything the first time through, and that was even using the Skip Previously Read Text button. It's got tons of routes, all of them vastly different and unique. The character cast is also incredibly colorful, and while most of them are typical character archetypes, that's the case for just about any game or anime ever. The stories AND the characters take exception because they're some of the most well written things I have ever experienced. They're beautifully emotional in multiple different ways, and at least one route will "hit home" for you, and I can almost guarantee one or two will make you cry. The soundtrack is absolutely wonderful, and you do get used to the art style, so getting attached to the characters and empathizing with everything they go through is a guarantee, even if they're a character you don't particularly care for, the writing is just that strong. All this time later, I no longer refer to it as playing Clannad. I call it experiencing Clannad.

30014907.review:
I got a $20 card as a gift for Valentines Day and I pretty much have every game that I could want. I heard stuff about this and on that fateful day this was on sale so I got it. I guess it was fate that brought me here. So in that sense I kinda got this game for free.

Update:

People might be looking at the price tag and get scared of it and ask themselves why in the world you would want to grab this game when it is just a visual novel with a very scary price tag. The game is actually worth the full price. 40 hours in and I still have a lot of things to do to see the True ending. The game contains a fair amount of story arcs and depending on your reading speed and settings can last from 5 to 10 hours each story arc. Not to mention trying out different decisions and seeing how it turns out would further the game time required to finish everything the game has to offer.

So what exactly do you get for that price tag? You get a visual novel experience with multiple story arcs and I would say a fair estimation of getting all the content it has to offer can go from 80 to 100 hours. The game is not a dating sim and focuses more on the story aspect of certain people that you will meet. Playing them until the end of their storyline will give you a clearer point of view on who is who and what is going on in the world. As much as possible I would like to avoid discussing the story  since you would be doing  yourself a disservice if you wouldn't go and experience the story yourself. The game can be a hit or miss in terms of what you actually do in-game but suffice to say that the stories in the game are some of the best stories that I have ever seen in a visual novel to warrant that price tag.

As ambiguous as this review is, all I can really tell you is to take that blind leap of faith when you can and see what Clannad has to offer. I am no fan of visual novels but this game really changed all that. On one hand it made me want to try a lot of visual novels that might have stories as great as this one. On the other hand it doesn't want me to try anything else for the fear of every visual novel after this not going to surpass what clannad did.

29996066.review:
[h1]Some of the saddest shit I've ever seen in a video game[/h1]

You play any route in this VN and it's really sad. You expect the next one to be happier, but it never is. It never is. 

It just keeps getting more and more depressing as you go. Unless you're some sort of robot or autismo with no emotions, this game will break you. 

Also since it's a two decade old japanese VN the game is loaded with tons of choices that come back to bite you in the ass if you guess the wrong one. Sometimes the answer is obvious,  other times it's a coin flip. There's a convenient steam guide filled with the right choices.

Since it's such a time-consuming endeavor to finish this game you'll be tempted to talk about the plot twists and arc conclusions with other people. Don't actually bring it up in conversation. Don't discuss it with any of your friends until after you finish the entire game. 

Clannad is one of the most critically acclaimed VNs ever created. It's on sale right now for 20 bucks. When is the last time a sixty dollar game lasted you sixty hours? Pick it up and put it in your backlog with all the other hundreds of games you bought but will never get around to playing.

If there's any reason this game should get a thumbs down it's for being too sad.

29965318.review:
CLANNAD是我接触的第一款galgame，是我的入宅作，也是我至今最喜欢的作品。

剧情主要是关于男主冈崎朋也的爱情、友情和亲情的故事，非常感人。而且不同于现在很多快餐型作品，CLANNAD无论是游戏还是动画，都能让人多刷也不觉得乏味，每次都能被故事的情节所触动。

我喜欢这部作品最重要的原因就是，它不单单是一款恋爱冒险类游戏，它更讲述了一种亲情。
朋也的父亲冈崎直幸在妻子交通事故去世后，一个人辛苦地将儿子抚养大，自己却因失去人生目标而颓废堕落，忽视了朋也的感受，朋也对于这样的父亲非常的愤恨。但是命运弄人，朋也好不容易与自己心爱的人古河渚走到了一起，从小身体虚弱的渚却因为难产去世了，朋也受不了打击变得颓废，放弃了抚养自己的孩子汐。汐由渚的父母秋生和早苗代为收养，多亏两人的教导，她成长为了一个率直开朗的女孩。但是在她的心里，一直在为父亲不在身边而感到伤心寂寞。原本愤恨着这样的父亲的朋也却走上了相同的道路，让我的心跌到了冰谷。而之后的父女重逢、父子合好，让我压抑的情绪终于得到了释放。亲情是一种复杂的关系，它不仅仅是一种关怀，一种依靠，更是一种责任，一种担当。

好的剧本必须要有好的背景音乐来彰显力度，而这一点CLANNAD成功地做到了。或许你没玩过CLANNAD，但是像空に光る这些BGM大概你也在一些剪辑视频里听过了。而其中我最喜欢的一首就是小さなてのひら，中文译名是小小的手心，这首歌在动画里发挥得淋漓尽致，希望有兴趣的朋友也可以去听听看。

总体来说，CLANNAD剧本、人设和背景音乐优秀，唯一的缺点可能就是CG现在看来稍微显老的画风了，但是这毕竟是2004年的作品，在当年看来这样的画风已经非常不错了。这么多年有无数优秀的作品出现，但是没有一部作品能撼动CLANNAD在我心中的地位。
或许会有人说评价不够客观，但我给这部作品的评分就是——10分！
[h1] CLANNAD的游戏以及其两季动画都是非常值得品味的作品，这波我必须要安利(｡･∀･)ﾉﾞ	[/h1]

开头先强调一点：CL是个好游戏。
买这个HD版主要是为了补票，如果你不是情怀玩家，这个作品可能不太适合现在购买。原因很简单，STEAM上的CL系列全都是English Edition语言限定版本，英文非常简单，阅读没有任何压力，但是极其生硬，完全失去了日文原版的语言魅力。KEY社似乎准备出日文版，不知道是以DLC的形式还是另外上架，如果是后者，大家大可等日文版上市再考虑入手不迟。
单单就本作来说，这个英语世界向的作品不但增加了团子百科，还专门HD化了，其他内容全部完整无删减（基于全年龄版本修改，没有18X），能看得出对于西方市场的重视，这种老作品想再出中文版不太可能了，希望以后日本大厂能更加重视中文市场。
完毕~

29006324.review:
[h1]Clannad[/h1]
被称为Key社三大催泪弹之一的Clannad(后文简称CL)，讲述了一系列的，发生在一个普通小镇里的一群普通居民身上的故事。CL承载着一个个普通而不平凡的居民他们的相遇、相逢、相知，他们的友情、亲情与爱情，歌声、眼泪与欢笑。
无论是冬雪飘落时迎面而来的相拥、大雨淅沥时坚实宽广的臂弯，还是樱花坡道下温暖有力的鼓励、遍野花田里放声肆意的哭泣；每当小镇上的大家感受到幸福时，便会从幻想世界投射出一颗被称之为“光玉”的光，当你看到它时，说明眼前的人正处在幸福之中。而获得光玉的人，便能实现他的愿望。

几年前，看过第一遍CL之后，每当《潮鸣り》响起，眼中就开始莫名的酸涩，心开始慌了起来，感觉即将有不好的事情发生。我想，这大概就是CL后遗症吧。作为CL游戏的衍生动画，它分为两季，第一季讲述的是朋也与渚相遇，与包括智代、藤林姐妹等人物发生在校园时代的故事，整个校园时代因为春原的存在充满着欢声笑语。转眼，朋也毕业离校，故事便来到了第二季，整个故事的基调也开始变得催泪，责任、亲情、爱情等重担压在朋也的肩头，在与芳野佑介相识之后的一个又一个的感人故事中，朋也终于明白了人生的意义。
[quote=芳野佑介]“丑陋的东西也唱着 
正是因为是丑陋的东西，才要更使劲地唱着 
这样，就能看到美好的一面 
让活下去这件事变得更加美丽 
因为，活着原本就是件丑陋的事情…… ”[/quote]
几个月前，再刷了一遍CL，眼泪还是不争气的伴随着《潮鸣り》、《小さな手のひら》还有《Ana》等曲子滑落。基于想要了解更多CL的故事，我选择了推一边CL的游戏，在13颗光玉的收集过程中，更了解了椋与胜平的故事，了解了老爷子一心照顾朋也与春原的苦心。当我开启After Story，用13颗光玉扭转了朋也的人生之后，不禁再次想起大叔的话：
[quote=古河秋生]“如果小镇也像人一样有自己的意识和心 
然后也有希望让住在这里的人都获得幸福的想法的话…… 
那么这个奇迹说不定就是这个小镇所引发的”[/quote]
那么，
[quote]“如果你愿意的话，就让我带你去吧，这座小镇，愿望实现的地方……” [/quote]
[strike]还有马桶盖子[/strike]

28977756.review:
Anime like Clannad After Story give a sacred radiance to a kind of warmth. They paint a warm picture of humanity. Portray people as warm people who offer themselves in support of their peers. Conferring warmth. They conceive of conflicts and problems and death and sorrow as inevitable waves upon the tides of life, that are faced, battled, and overcome with unselfish love, genuine care. The warmth of human interactions. A warm world where amidst the inexorable hardships people are good, loving, kind.
    A warmth that people, perhaps rightfully, deride as unrealistic. That real people do not subscribe to, do not believe in, thus deepening the rift between the vision of warmth and the coldness of reality. And this in its turn, accentuating, justifying, the derision of that warmth. All lies.
    But I believe in that lie. 
    So I watch anime.

28965868.review:
Just entered the otaku lifestyle recently, but i can still tell for sure that if i ever manage to find a more elaborated, tearful and so perfect in general love story than this one, it will definitely take me some good amount of years.
As an owner of the game that won the most tearful steam award, The Walking dead, and its 2 sequels, i can guarantee you that they won only because they are better known across America and Europe than Clannad. Otherwise, they would have suffered an overwhelming defeat.

Every single route is packed with funny moments, slow-paced dialogues that show us in detail the development of the relationship, and the main reason this game became so famous: it's heartbreaking scenes. 
To be honest, some parts are not even SO sad, but you still go into an abnormal crying because of the music. 
That's also one of the best things of this game. When mixing some parts of this soundtrack with a not-so-sad escene, you cry. But when you do it with a truly sad scene, i swear the fucking tears become uncontrollable. If you appreciate good, long and tearful stories, there's no reason to hesitate to buy this game. 

There is some people that get bored with slow paced stories, and i guess this game is not for them. Clannad is a very slow game, its script is huge and while it has a lot of funny, interesting, happy and sad escenes, there is also a lot of almost irrelevant dialogue, that would painfuly kill the kind of people who prefers to get into the relevant parts of the story faster.


And please, DONT JUST WATCH THE ANIME AND IGNORE THE GAME. COLABORATE WITH THE ANIME/MANGA INDUSTRY FOR ONCE IN YOUR DAMN LIFE!
Besides, it has a lot of altered scenes, and it is going to feel awkward to find out that every scene happens far before or after the anime told you. Also, it mixes all routes on one timeline... and you will see them for separated here. It is going to be confusing as hell.

28948070.review:
大学狗忙了一天，晚上随便在网上瞎逛，偶然地想起了还没给我最喜爱的游戏做一个评测。就趁睡前随便码几个字，分享一下我对CL的一些感受吧。


先说说游戏本身：
语言问题：Steam上的CL只有英语，搜了很多地方，得出了“压根没有汉化”的结论。不是说啃不动英文，而是感觉GAL的英文在某些时候不能恰当地表达出当时的气氛、情感。不过就算只有英文，我还是会在好几条线里眼睛进沙。尤其是风子线，暑假推线的时候眼泪流的稀里哗啦还不敢哭出声怕被我妈看笑话(つд⊂)

价格问题：刚上架时候我还没有接触过CL，还认为一个galgame卖50刀怎么不去抢。当然有些玩家给差评的原因就在此。不过现在应该好多了，国区+打折史底只要46软，总比买一些A测四五年越来越烂的独立游戏强。我接触CL只有半年，没有玩过老版本的游戏，我的游戏时间基本就是每条线过一次的时间，我没有跳过重复的对话，AS暂时还没推，动漫AS四个周目哭了四次流泪流怕了。总之，游戏时间是绝对对得起价格的。(P.S.现在AS已推完，一共用时135小时，多出来的时间应该就是停在"Music Mode"里面循环《渚》和《小小的手心》)

画面问题：可能很多人都无法接受这种稍有奇怪的画风，不过一旦代入了这种设定也就觉得没什么了。毕竟是十几年的游戏了，也不能过多要求什么。（kotomi酱还是那么漂亮(o´ω`o)）

声音问题：不多解释了，配音完美，音乐完美，实体OST已入手收藏。最爱《小小的手心》。


半年前被一死宅朋友强烈安利了CL动漫，基本没有接触过二刺螈的我抱着试一试的态度看了一下，结果暑假就中毒了，动漫疯狂刷了三遍，游戏每条线都推了一遍，中了毒之后根本停不下来。老司机们发的文采飞扬的诗句看的眼里出茧也百看不腻，在这里就不刷了。我只想说三次元不一定就比二次元冰冷，我们可以用自己的双手像光玉那样创造奇迹，珍惜身边的亲情，重视身边的友谊，像TE里的朋也那样，努力地、精彩的活下去。（中二值爆表了(つд⊂)）

本来想随便写几句算了，码字码着码着就忘了时间。总之，这款游戏绝对是值得给好评的。如果各位觉得太长懒得看，那就直接看最后一句吧：
琴美酱赛高！ლ(╹◡╹ლ)


[u]2017年STEAM大奖——”世界已冷酷至极，让我们携手前行“提名评测更新：[/u]
光阴荏苒 曾经肆虐的寒风
早已风光不再 消散在了春天的歌声里
我们携手走过的人生 那段布满荆棘的道路
稚嫩的小手即使不再紧紧相握 我们也将继续前行

我们一起迈开了脚步 在这长长的 长长的坡道上
无论今后遇到什么事情 都请不要后悔和我的相遇

28748395.review:
I've always had a huge grudge against Sakura games or any other kind of ecchi/hentai highseller games when there are games like this in existence. Those games absolutely butcher the reputation and image of visual novels all around the world. I honestly cannot tell anyone (even in real life) that I play visual novels and I have to play them in steam offline mode because of bad visual novel reputation in general.

This game is NOT, i have to emphasize, IS NOT like those games. It has absolutely NOTHING in common with those pathetic excuses of video games.

THIS is what visual novels are all about.

Masterfully written story and background music is very well done. Protagonist is really easy to relate to and he is a really interesting guy to interact with. The dialogue between him and the other characters is very well thought of. The stories themselves are also very well written, combining romantic comedy with some highstrung drama.

This game is so fun to read, it has the BEST side character of any visual novels that I know of (Sunohara) who is absolutely hilarious. It has has many scenes that get you thinking about a lot of things in life like how people who have given up on other people or the world think and personally for me... i can relate to lot of things in this game (I think the morals for the protagonist echo with mine) I wonder if its same for you reader but either way, this game is really well done.

And you know whats the best thing about this game? It has absolutely ZERO erotic content and the game is still one of the best selling visual novels in japan by writing, music and voice acting alone.

All erotic games have going for them is the erotic scenes and everything else is crap. This game does NOT ride on the erotic scenes or anything of the like. None of the effort was wasted on making erotic scenes and it all went into the making of the game.

I would really rather not spoil anything about this game but if you like visual novels, this is a MUST READ. It is absolutely one of the best "innocent" visual novels in existence right now.

If you like this review and buy this game, play it through and if after that, you like it, I highly recommend other KEY visual novels like Kanon, Air and Little Busters. There are fan translations for them in the internet that are very well done.

More people have to know about these games and know that the visual novels are not all about ecchi/hentai Sakura-like games.

28658925.review:
+ Great storytelling.
+ Its themes evolve as the story progresses in Afterstory.
+ Incredibly emotional.
+ Unique characters that all provide purpose to the story in some way or another.
+ Nagisa, Kotomi, Tomoyo, Ibuki, Kyou, and Sunohara are top tier best girls.
+ Akio and Sanae are the best parents I have ever had the pleasure of experiencing.
+ Exceptional humor.
+ Extremely replayable.
+ One of the most genuine MC's in Visual Novels (Tomoya Okazaki)
+ Unique story where you actually SEE the married life of a couple and the relationship they had prior.
+ Easily the best OST I have ever heard in a game, each one contributing so much to the message each scene is trying to portray. Snowfield is honestly one of my favorite song in videogames, making me cry because of the beauty of the scene it was involved in.
+ Afterstory is my favorite 2nd half in a visual novel alongside Steins;Gate, evolving its themes to a much more family orientated setting as well as providing emotional heartbreak that no other game could ever provide except this one.
+ The ending is amazing and the use of the "orb lights" is one of my favorite plot elements ever, being detailed enough for hardcore analysis on the role it played in the final moments of Clannad.
+ The Illusionary World is absolutely genius.
+ Another aspect I enjoy about the themes of Clannad is that they are family orientated and could honestly help anyone in need of advice on what to do with their life, offering many unique perspectives on certain ideals that are evident in the world we live in.
- Art is charming however it is definitely not for everyone.
- The game is on average 80+ hours, being one of the longest videogame scripts EVER!!!

Overall Clannad was a 10/10 for me. I don't think I have experienced a story as great as this one since the original Steins;Gate and Steins;Gate 0. The way Clannad tells its story in such a simple but unique way, constantly evolving with time progressions is truly a thought provoking and "valuable" experience. I'd recommend this to anyone that wants to involve themselves in the "Visual Novel" medium as it is the best one I have ever played besides Steins;Gate. The game is worth every cent, 50 dollars is honestly not a bad price for one of the best games of the genre, BUY THIS and enjoy it, as it a truly profound and life altering experience!

Clannad, the Visual Novel!

The first visual novel, and best I've ever had the experience to try out! I've watched the anime, and I loved the VN! If anyone wants to support Key Visual Arts (TM), or is a HUGE, HUGE fan of the anime, this is your game!

[!SPOILERS BELOW!]

Pros:
- All your favorites characters
- You can follow your own paths, or follow the anime's path!
- More than what the anime offered
- Music like in the anime, but so much more!
- Dialogue is very close to perfection
- You'll love the characters in a matter of minutes after meeting them!
- You can make your own choices
- Multiple endings
- Supports your computer greatly; little to no lag at all!
- You get to name the main protaganist!
- Hitting 'esc' will not close the game!
- Has a encyclopedia to explain things you encounter in the game
- Get to experience the events that took place in the anime, and other events that weren't in the anime!
- Music is in High Quality, and is very memorable
- Slow build up, but keeps you intact, and interested through-out the entire play!
- Doesn't throw you into the main story right away, but lets it slowly build into it
- Nagisa! \(^-^)/

Cons:
- Sunohara (HEY!!!)
- Some dialogue can be confusing, but not greatly
- Sometimes the dialogue feels like its been drug out, but not too much to cause issues
- Have to adjust the volume settings of the music, character VAs, etc, but editing is pretty self-explanatory
- You have to play through to be able to build up your encyclopedia, b/c you aren't giving them all right away; again, this isn't a grave issue, as it's common stuff if you've been watching anime for a while
- Again, Sunohara (YOU'RE DOING THIS ON PURPOSE!!!)
- Sometimes you can't choose a dialogue choice where you feel it's necessary, which gets a little fustrating
- Japanese VAs only atm; this isn't an issue for me, but for others, eh...
- Some events are exactly the same like in the anime, but there're some things different, so don't worry!


I'm really enjoying this game, and I hope you all who're considering it enjoy it as much as I am, if not more! :D

Steam版没有中文补丁，没有中文补丁，没有中文补丁！

因为大家都知道《CLANNAD》是神作，好多人毫不犹豫地就买了，买了才发现，没有中文补丁，又没有日语。所以先说一下。因为steam版是高清重制，和原版的不一样，所以目前没有能用的中文补丁。

对于信仰粉，就算没中文，肯定也会毫不犹豫地入手。而对于非信仰粉，如果你对自己的英语没信心的话也不要怕，这部作品的翻译规规矩矩，难度适中，都是尽量用简单和日常的词汇来表达的。有点英语基础的话应该就能玩了。而且现在游戏还有卡牌，背景和徽章。

以下对于没玩过的朋友可以看下，老玩家就不用看了：

游戏里，除了主角「朋也」没有配音外，都有配音，而且都配的相当棒，情绪表达很细腻，不得不佩服日本的cv。个人最喜欢「智代」和「杏」还有「有纪宁」，有一半原因可能就是因为配音。

另外，推荐《Tomoyo After ~It's a Wonderful Life~ English Edition》，虽然不是高清重置，没有达到《CLANNAD》的高度，但质量还是很高。（现在，steam上把三部CLANNAD相关的作品都打包了，非常划算，有兴趣的可以看一下）

28080094.review:
I strongly recommend Clannad. Whether you have played visual novels before or not, this is a great choice.

Not much action here, but the whole point is following the story, and making your choices. And the story is really great. There are several different paths, and all of them are going to hit your feels, lightly or hard. I played most of the base game scenarios, and thought I had seen everything, that there won't be much anymore.

And then, [spoiler]introduce Kappei Hiiragi.[/spoiler]

The music is top tier, and often fits whatever scene you are in. Many of this game's tracks are about as iconic as the game itself, and most likely will keep ringing in your head for a little while. The intro song (from the trailer) will play if you wait at main menu for a moment.

If you are going for all the scenarios/achievements, you will be spending a great while playing this, at least if you follow the story each time without skipping. Although if you do that (like I have), the first parts especially will get a bit repetitive.

Also, the price is a bit high, though that probably depends on you. If you can get this on sale or for free, you should buy it. I recall getting this on sale, and thinking back, full price might have still been worth it. The Dangopedia, CG collection and music list please my inner collector.

This game will make you laugh and cry. Whatever you are looking for in this, it's definetly worth the feels.

28074284.review:
爱人之心,世界之羁绊——CLANNAD,人与小镇的物语
　　让我带你前去吧。这个小镇，实现人们愿望的场所……

人参第一次认真玩的GALGAME。[spoiler]令我更悟到了：毕业后要在坂道上等少女“扑街”的真理。[/spoiler]

CLANNAD是什么？

这个问题就像问爱是什么一样，无人能给出准确的答案。
对一些人来说，Clannad是一个老师，它讲述了无数个感人至深的故事，让人们看到人生的方向。
对一些人来说，Clannad是一个救星，它以人世间最普遍的感情拯救了许多濒死的心灵。
对一些人来说，Clannad是一个世界，在那里，形形色色的人用自己的爱创造着一个个伟大的奇迹。
对一些人来说，Clannad便是生活，用平淡的方式包含了人们生活中不可缺少的点点滴滴。

Clannad到底是什么并不重要，只要它能让人们见过它的容貌后：
能在茶余饭后能为父母长辈揉揉肩膀；能花更多时间能与恋人妻子一起敞开心房；
能与朋友兄弟在人生之路上携手徜徉；能向他人，甚至是素昧平生的人送出祝福的光。

琴美教会了我，組成這個世界的,是許許多多眼睛看不到的小竪琴。世界上到處都是這些小小的琴,他們每一個每一個都縯奏着獨特的音符。所有的音符合起來,就汇成一首長長的曲子……

其实Clannad就好比一条长长的坡道。
已经走过这条坡道的人们啊，请你们铭记这次经历的旅程的美好。
在你不得不走过的另一条坡道上，找到Clannad为你指引的目标！

PS: 当之无愧的 “我没哭，只是眼睛里进了点沙子” 奖
　　话说这能装个日文或者中文进去吗，G胖这么辛劳的高清化了，而且完整的游戏没有其他文字可惜了。

27626378.review:
Okay, first things first: I know it says I have less than two hours on this game, but that's because I usually play this game without internet. With that said, I'll get on with the actual review.

The short version:
If you like visual novels and crying, and you're fine with the giant eyes, play this.
If you've watched the anime and liked it, PLAY THIS. IT HAS SO MUCH MORE CONTENT.

The long version:
I bought CLANNAD during a sale earlier this year. I'd watched the first season of the anime, but I wanted to finish the original version in its entirety before finishing the anime.

And it was worth it.

Almost every route follows the same pattern: a bit of a rough start, then everything slowly but surely improves. But just like with a rollercoaster, right when you reach the top, a huge downward plummet. Right when it seems like there's no hope, though, a light shines through. Usually, the endings aren't perfectly happy, but that isn't how life works anyway. It might seem a bit repetitive, but somehow it never gets old. Afterstory also follows this pattern, although the plummet is even worse. Won't explain why, to avoid spoilers. Just see for yourself. I'll say this, though... they really know how to make the visual novel genre work for the story itself.

But anyway. The writing of this game is superb. The fellas at Key really know how to get you attached to a character, so that they can cause you extreme pain when they thoroughly break them. When the game isn't actively torturing you, it can also be very entertaining. There are a lot of hilarious, perverted, and usually both, scenes. I'm actually surprised at how many lewd jokes and scenes they threw into this. A lot of then weren't in the anime, so if you're here checking out the game because you liked the anime, lemme tell you, you'll find a lot of great content here. No hentai, though, (un)fortunately. There are also a lot of references to other media. Fuko's Doraemon carving, the stuffed Snoopy the gang were trying to get for Kotomi, Akio's Gundam collection... the list goes on. The art style might not be agreeable to some, but if you find it bearable, I urge you to stick with this for the sake of the story.

If there's one thing that I don't like about the visual novel, though, it's how some routes seem forever unlinked. I mean... although some characters seem to be all right even if you ignore their route, it seems some you're just abandoning. For example, the cat. It seems Misae will find out in both her and Tomoyo's route, but what about Nagisa's? Will the canon path have the cat forever unrevealed? And Kotomi.... will she NEVER meet her only childhood friend again? I just feel bad for them. I guess that's one thing the anime has over the visual novel.

All in all, though, it's a solid visual novel that knows how to get to you. Definitely recommended for anyone who likes VNs.

27343485.review:
Ich verfasse dieses kurze Review zum Anlass der Nominierungen für die "Steam-Awards 2016". Manche, die dieses Review lesen werden, habe möglicherweise den Anime gesehen, andere interessieren sich für Visual Novels und wieder andere sind vielleicht zufällig über dieses Juwel gestolpert. Wofür habe ich dieses Spiel nun also nominiert? Zweifelslos für die "Ich weine nicht, ich hab' nur was im Auge" - Kategorie. 
Für diejenigen, die Visual Novels nicht kennen: CLANNAD ist kein Spiel im klassischen Sinne. Vielmehr ist es ein Roman, der durch einen Soundtrack, Hintergrundbilder und Charaktersprites unterlegt ist. Das einzige wirklich spielerische Element sind die Entscheidungen, die zu treffen sind und über den Ausgang der Geschichte, ähnlich eines Abenteuerromanes, entscheiden.
Das Spiel selbst ist ein zeitloser, allerdings auch bereits über zehn Jahre alte, Klassiker des VN-Genres. Mit Gewiss über 100 Stunden Lesezeit für alle Routen ist CLANNAD eine der größten mir bekannten Produktionen und erst seit kurzem auf Steam und offiziell ins Englische übersetzt. Der Preis mag für ein so altes Spiel erschreckend hoch wirken und ist es natürlich auch. Doch ist es nicht die Güte des Produktes, die ihm seinen Wert verleiht?
Inhaltlich erwartet euch in CLANNAD die Geschichte Tomoyas, ein demotivierter Oberschüler mit Familienproblemen, der keinen Sinn in seinem Leben zu finden vermag, bis er eines Tages am Fuß des Hügels, auf dem seine Schule erbaut ist, ein Mädchen trifft. Im Laufe des Spiels lernt Tomoya noch viele weitere Personen kennen und je nach den getroffenen Entscheidungen beeinflussen diese Personen sein Leben. Mit viel Humor, interessanten Einfällen für jede Route und nicht zu überbietender Emotionalität ist CLANNAD für jeden etwas, der einer entschleunigten aber tief bewegenden Geschichte nicht versagen kann.
Wer Tomoyas Geschichte(n) vollständig genießen will, sollte sich bewusst sein, dass dafür (fast) alle Routen abgeschlossen werden müssen, da die sogenannte "After Story" freigespielt werden muss. Hierfür empfehle ich auf Steam oder im Internet einen Guide zu konsultieren.
Die Übersetzung ist professionell gemacht und vermisst eine Überzahl an Rechtschreibfehlern und die Sprache wird dem Werk gerecht. Zusätzlich hat sekaiproject ein Register eingeführt, welches japanische Eigenheiten und Hintergrundinformationen zu Anspielungen bieten soll. Es lohnt sich auf jeden Fall beim Lesen dort einmal hinein zu schauen.
Zusammenfassend ist dieses wahrliche Juwel des VN-Genres sein Geld bis heute wert: die Geschichte ist zeitlos und kann sich mit der Hochliteratur unserer Zeit mehr als messen, ist dabei aber auch Unterhaltungsliteratur zugleich. Es ist vollständig synchronisiert (Japanisch natürlich) und in dieser Ausgabe wunderbar übersetzt. Für jeden VN-Liebhaber ist CLANNAD auf jeden Fall ein must-have. Ob auf Steam oder als Import. 

Wer VNs jedoch noch nicht kennt, sollte sich am besten zuerst anders mit dem Genre vertraut machen. "Narcissu" und "Sunrider: Mask of Arcadius" bieten hier kostenlose Alternativen, wobei "Sunrider" von einem Indepent-Entwckler ist und keine besonders hohe Qualität aufweist - nichtsdestotrotz ein ordentliches Spiel ist. "Narcissu" hingegen ist ein Meisterwerk und auch noch kostenlos auf Steam erhältlich. Ihr interessiert euch für CLANNAD? Schaut doch auch einmal bei "Narcissu" vorbei.

I suppose I can't do too much of a review of this game, as I have no played much of it at all. However, the anime was far past phenomenal. It far went past the limits and exceeded the point what I thought was possible to make me feel. What feeling you ask? All of them.

It is also the only thing I've ever heard of to manage to have a happy, sad, tragic, and relieving ednging at the same time. I would be in no way surprised if the creator of Clannad majored in psychology and was a genius in the art of it.
If I had to give it an honest rating, I would say 10/10. 
It is masterful in the art of a "phychological living" if that makes sense, as well as being in-depth and really making you honestly laugh and cry.
I'm not sure how to format a review, or even if I'm qualified to review this, but those are my feelings.

27053556.review:
First of all, if you're new to visual novels, then this is not going to be a quick-paced game. It's nice and laidback, but it will take you a long time to get through, and you probably will get bored at times. The pace can be pretty slow, especially if you're not using a guide, as there are so many wrong choices that don't seem like wrong choices. So I would recommend using a guide just to avoid frustration.

 Aside from that, once the pace picks up, this is a really great read. The characters are great, the drama is great, and the soundtrack is amazing and definitely worth a purchase if you can find it. The drama may be a little over-the-top at times for some, but if you take the time to get invested in the story and the characters, you will never forget it. I still think of some of the endings from time to time, months after I've finished the game, and I still get goosebumps when listening to the soundtrack. 

 Definitely worth a play, but if you're not sure/not used to visual novels, I would try something cheaper first just to explore the format, or grab this on sale price..

27003513.review:
This is one of those games that you think won't possibly be all that great but at the same time you HAVE to have heard people raving about it so there has to be something about it that's great right?

The first thing most people would say is "it's a visual novel.  If I wanted to read I'd pick up a book (LOL)" but really, there's more of a choose your own adventure aspect to it rather than merely reading a book from start to fiinish.  The second thing people would say is "I saw the anime so there's no real need to play this".  Maybe (sniff) Maybe.... but seeing the anime and knowing the story doesn't diminish the story in any way...in fact it may make it even better since you'll already have a fondness for a certain character and will want to do everything in your power to run through that character's path first.

If you HAVEN'T seen the anime, this is what you youngsters would call "a feels trip".  You tough types will want to play this with the doors closed so nobody sees you well up with tears in your eyes near the end.  Just tell them you're fapping and that's why you locked the door (sob).

It's a story that's got a little of everything in it.  Love, Friendship, Comedy, Tragedy, Struggle, Pain, Success? Only you can tell in the end...Even now I hear the theme song playing in the video on the store page and get a lump in my throat for various reasons. 

What? No... shut up... I stubbed my toe on the table walking in here... I'm fine.  Leave me alone, I'm trying to review a game in here.

Sheesh...people.

Anyway, so the high points:
[list]
   [*] It has a really great story
   [*] There are multiple paths so unlike the anime, you have to focus on one and play it through to the end
   [*] But you'll WANT to play it again...there's a benefit to doing so beside merely seeing the other paths.
   [*] The music is pretty emotional...even that stupid だんご大家族 big dango family song. It adds a lot
   [*] All the original voices are in this game so if you've seen the anime you'll feel right at home and if not it'll feel just like the game when you do go see it.
[/list]

low points:
[list]
   [*] Playing the game consists of reading and occasionally choosing something for the main character to do.  If you're looking for a real adrenaline rush then this isn't it
   [*] Maybe in places it's a bit TOO emotional but it's still worth it.
[/list]

That's it.. there's way more good than bad, and the bad isn't so much bad as it is just not socially acceptable for a guy to feel emotional about stuff like this.  But you know what? Fuck it... I voted this for the "I'm not crying, there's something in my eye" award and that's how it is.   If anything other than this wins that award, it's because they've never played this game.

借着奖项提名，随便写几句吧。
在提名其他奖项时还有犹豫，唯有“我没哭，只是眼睛里进了沙子”这一项想也没想就写了CLANNAD的名字。
作为一部2004年最早发布的作品，CLANNAD作为GALGAME在各方面体现出来的精良水准（也许除了绘画？）和历史地位都是不需要赘述的，无数评论里那个永远高频率出现的关键词“哭”就是最好的证明。
然而颇有意思的是，在CL的众多线路里，作为主线的古河渚线反而是相对来说不那么波澜起伏的。琴美线有跨越时空的亲情，风子线有超越身体束缚的思念，而渚线虽然有幻想世界的背景，但主人公们度过的，仍然是平凡地在校园里偶然地相遇、相识、相恋、相互扶持着生活下去的过程。如果抛去明显属于戏剧化修饰的部分，CL的故事内核平凡得近乎真实，真实到近乎可以在现实世界找到原型。但如此平凡的故事内核却浸透了情感，或者说正因为平凡，反而使得这份情感更贴近人心，不需渲染地直接产生共鸣，无论是语言、文化都不重要，CL所体现的感情完完全全地超越了这些界限，完美地诠释了“感情是人类共同的语言”这一点。不得不说，Key社的几位编剧们在把握真情实感这一点上可以说是炉火纯青（尽管对故事内在逻辑的构建并不是非常严密）。
一直觉得很多人对GALGAME存在一种偏见，认为这就是做出来刺激宅男生殖腺的一类不上台面的玩意，倒不可否认相当一部分GALGAME都是这样的。但是真的很幸运，我们还有以Key社作品为代表的相当一大部分R18场景可有可无甚至有不如无的优秀作品，这样的作品体现出来的不是肉欲，而是人性所能够拥有的充满光辉的部分。现实世界自然永远不可能像CL所描绘的那样充满爱，但CL给所有玩过它的人播撒了一颗种子，纵使身处黑暗，也能感觉到心田上盛放的光芒。
嘛，所以说LB，REWRITE，甚至KANON和AIR什么时候上STEAM呢，[strike]钱可是早就备好了233[/strike]

26354179.review:
“Even if I don't cry when I'm sad, I might do it when I'm happy. That's just the kind of person I am.” - Nagisa Furukawa

CLANNAD is arguably one of the most famous and influential visual novels out there. It's earned a cult following for sporting some of the saddest, most bittersweet stories guaranteed to pull your heartstrings and wring your tear ducts. Yet, it's not all melancholic gloom. The story is beautifully harmonised with cute moments of moe and romcom. The Kickstarter for CLANNAD's English translation fetched a whopping $500,000 USD, the highest on record for a visual novel as far as I know. That should stand as a testament to how many people loved the game, despite it being more than a decade since its Japan release.

The game follows a wide cast of heroines with numerous possible routes, including the soft-spoken introvert Nagisa, tomboyish prankster Kyou, studious beauty Kotomi and innocent loli Fuuko. Every character is memorable and unique in their own way. 

One of the most contentious aspects of the game is its art. For most, it's something that they'll either love or hate. I'll admit that I didn't enjoy the art too much at first, having been spoiled by the anime studios of 2010 and beyond, but it eventually grew on me. If I had to describe the art I'd say that it's unpolished, but endearing, much like the art of Higurashi When They Cry.

(Random fun fact: In The World God Only Knows, Katsuragi Keima's 2D waifu "Yokkyun" was based off Nagisa's artwork from CLANNAD.)

Another controversy was raised over the price of the game upon its Steam release. Commanding a $50 price tag for a game over 10 years old?! 

While the pricing is undeniably steep, what most critics fail to notice is that CLANNAD is the longest visual novel on Steam by far, with no titles coming close except perhaps Muv-Luv. The game easily takes 50 hours to complete, and I must applaud Sekai Project for coming up with a quality, error-free English translation of so much text. Also, the game was released in its entirety, and not in episodic/chapter format unlike numerous other VN titles on Steam, a practice which I'm very keen to support!

Overall, if you enjoyed the anime (or even if you didn't), consider getting this VN for a much more fleshed-out story and some unbelievably immense Niagara Feels.

Thanks for reading till now. Have a [url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=UTGzW94JlGA]uguu~[/url]

26160709.review:
Overall review, 9.7/10.  Can't recommend enough, which is why I chose it for probably the only review I'll ever do.

Completely in love with this VN. I was skeptical because it was released in 2004, and is still a $50 game. but after much more hours played than shown here(I usually play in offline mode), I have come to the conclusion that I feel awful for not paying full price. The creators made so much content, and did such a wonderful job that I would consider getting it for other people. But definitely not during a sale.

My only complaint would be that there is a "True Ending", which while adorable and well written in itself, takes away from the other girls' endings based purely on the fact that there is only one you should end with. Even with this though, they do a very good job in making everyone's ending amazing, and stopping before the true ending opens will only hurt because you want more. 


Art 8/10- The art is definitely dated, and artists can do much better by hand. BUT considering that it was made in '04, and it fits the feel of the game with how silly it can be, and how well it defines the emomtions of characters, I will give it a solid rating.

Gameplay 9/10 - Little kinks here and there, but most of the quirks in talk are explained in the "dangopedia"(which even the name of the in-game dictionary connects to one of the characters)

Story 12/10(or 5/7 if you're a memelord) - multiple times where I didn't get enough sleep for work because I didn't realize how much time had passed while bawling my eyes out or laughing so much. You definitely feel the full spectrum of emotions in this VN, you get a personal connection to many of the characters, and each story is long enough to be a seperate VN.



If you enjoy VNs, and are even remotely considering this game, buy it now. Don't wait for a sale, or you'll probably end up regretting buying it on sale like I did. My general standard is 1-2 hours of enjoyable gameplay per $1 spent, and even at full price, it well exceeded that.


EDIT: Capitalizations, and a slight rewording for clarification

26035176.review:
Alright, here's a review from a jaded and critical visual novel enthusiast. If you eat up visual novels like candy, there's no reason not to think that you'll love Clannad, as most of these reviews are pointing out. But maybe you're like me and are a bit tired of outdated anime tropes taking up hours of your time for a simple misunderstanding, or because the girl is 'too embarassed'... well, honestly, Clannad has some of that too. Refreshingly though, it's really not that jarring nor frequent.

Let's get the cons out of the way first, for a big purchase like this you should know what you're getting into if you have high standards. Obviously I'm in the 'you should buy it' camp, but there is still room for some eye-rolling. If you want to get every route in the game, there's a route with a creepy over-sexualization of a minor (nothing sexual happens, but she is sexualized), not to mention that route suffers from one of those obnxious over-the-top suffering scenes, where really a teacher should have been called. It's about the worst it gets though. Besides that, there are a few repetitive jokes, and semi-overt anti-gay sentiment (mostly, they say people are gay to make fun of them), and a lot of casual Japanese-themed sexism. It's not as bad as other games, but seeing as this came out early 00's, you probably shouldn't expect it to feel very progressive. The girls are pretty diverse and interesting, but every once in a while it throws in a line like, 'you shouldn't help me because you're a boy' which is like... meh, I 100% would have helped with her sewing, I'm not scared that thread is going to suck my testosterone dry... whatever. 

But on the positives, this is a really fun game. The main character is fleshed out very well over time, and is refreshingly honest and straight-forward for the most part. He is lazing about going day-to-day without any real goals or meaningful relationships. There are tons of different paths you can go on, not just with different girls, but interacting with different groups of friends depending on how to act. It's very in-depth with its ability to bring several elements together based on your previous actions. It's interface is also probably the best I've seen, very easy to use and helps with whatever you need. 

It's hard to describe 80+ hours worth of story and characters, while at the same time covering mostly just a month or so of time. This game feels professional, yet it can sometimes feel like you're just hanging out with your friends. There's lots of lessons in this game that resonated with me, and a lot of jokes that make me laugh out loud. I'm usually pretty stoic when I'm reading, so it was a pleasant surprise when it was able to make me laugh and cry. If you're like me, this isn't a crazy tearjerking festival, but it cetainly went far enough to make me tear up on the route I was most invested in. This is good though, because it means this isn't melodramatic. There are difficult things that happen, but they all feel very realistic and earned. 

To me, some routes felt a bit forced at parts, or maybe they appealed more to a Japanese audience, but overall the stuff that worked REALLY worked. Even characters I hated at first became dear to me in their own way. Unlike most VN protagonists, I never feel frustrated by Okazaki. He was light-hearted, easy-going, and pulled a lot of pranks. He has tons of issues to work through, but probably ended up being my favorite character of the game. It's nice to have a protagonist who's a underdog, but still feels like he deserves being admired by all these girls. I'd want to be his friend too, and it's nice to see him get off his ass and find a reason to keep going. 

So tons of varied content, realistic slice-of-slife with down-to-earth problems, doesn't take itself too seriously or poke fun too much, and professional interface and voice acting. It's probably not going to blow your mind like something with sci-fi or supernatural/horror, but you'll probably remember it for a really long time, like it was a school year of your own.

No, but seriously Clannad is a great visual novel. If you're in the neighborhood for a good visual novel that'll bring you both joy and sadness look no further. Key did a fantastic job with this visual novel. For those who have watched the anime, like myself, I can say you will experience deja vu since the visual novel is what the anime is based on. That being said, if you enjoyed the stories in the anime you will enjoy the visual novel even more. Full disclaimer: Clannad's entire game isn't in the anime. A good chunk is, but many of the really great routes never come to life in the anime for continuity and time issues. You can fall in love with so many characters. I recommend following a spoiler free walkthrough. I just looked up "Clannad Walkthrough" on google and used the first result. It just shows you which decisions to make if you want to play a specific route. You will need to play some of the routes to unlock the after story, but honestly to get your money's worth play them all. It took me ~50 hours to do everything. Once you've played Tomoyo's route I recommend picking up Tomoyo After: Its a Wonderful Life when you got $20 to spare. I just finished it and it's AMAZING, I'll be reviewing it as well. 

There are about 14 routes I believe. There will be some similarities to routes until you really reach the bulk on the content. Each route is good in it's own regard. I will say also that one character in particular isnt in the anime at all and that person's arc is especially good. 

I bought this game on an anime weekend sale on steam for $25. I know $50 is alot of money and although clannad is great it's alot of money. If you're a diehard VN fan you'll prob have no problem spending the money. I recommend wishlisting this game and waiting for a sale. 

If you enjoyed the anime I recommend picking this up. If you hated the anime you probably will hate the VN. I was brought to tears by most of the routes and each route felt so great when I finished it. Clannad is an exceptional VN, probably one of the best, it's my first VN and for sure isnt my last.

25217946.review:
First and foremost, for potential buyers who have watched the anime, don't assume that just because you enjoyed the anime, you'll also enjoy the game. Visual novels, such as Clannad, require a bit of a different taste, you need a fair bit of patience and also need to put up with the fact that at first glance, Nagisa looks like a skeleton, in my humble opinion, which ticked me the hell of as she is my second favorite character (Miyazawa's my favorite, obviously). For sure, playing the game is a great way to continue to immerse yourself into the Clannad universe, and it allows you to follow your own path and make friends with who you want, however, the mechanics and style of the game itself don't necessarily appeal to certain groups. I have friends who cried watching the anime, like me, however, did not enjoy playing the game. The plot of the game is fantastic, no complaints there, just prepare yourself for a bit of a different experience in how you interact with it in comparison to the anime and other video games. Just keep this in mind.

I've always personally been impressed with Key and their ability to make games that have the ability to toy with your emotions. Clannad is no different, as a player, you follow your own semi-personalised route (see below), each with their own struggles and successes that tug at your heartstrings. The plotlines are deep and engaging and allow you to feel as if you have truly connected with the characters, each of whom have a well thought out personality and background that is reflected in the way in which they interact with the player character. For me, this resulted in my getting angry a lot at Sunohara (the player character's best friend) and yelling at my screen. The point is, you'll feel the emotions that the game is meant to convey, you'll wince, you'll cry, you'll laugh, the whole story is one wild emotional roller coaster. Clannad is a fantastic example of what a visual novel should do for you.

For a visual novel, the mechanics are solid and the Dangopedia answered virtually all the questions I had about any mentions of Japanese culture within the game. At times, playing the game can feel like a chore, as is typical of many visual novels (especially if you've watched the anime, as you know roughly what will happen), but I personally didn't mind to much as I was so engaged by the characters. 

The sprites, for the most part, are relatively well done for a visual novel, except for Nagisa, in my opinion, which is an incredible boon. From my experience, games with characters that look nothing like they should (for example, a human should look like a human) are a bit disenchanting and a complete turnoff. The soundtrack is incredibly well done, I cannot stress this enough, I found it to be the aspect of the game that was most beneficial to the overall quality besides the actually plotline, which is to be expected in any game. With both of these things in mind, its easy to immerse yourself into the game.

That's it for me, if you made it this far, I congratulate you and I now reward you with a joke. What do you call a funny mountain? Hill Arious. Ba dum tsh. Anyway, I hope this helped you make a decision, no doubt I missed a few things, however, so I'd recommend you read some more just to get a better feel. I encourage you to buy the game, it's fantastic and a good example of what a visual novel should do. Even if you don't like sappy stories, you should still enjoy this game. And remember that you can always return the game if you're not satisfied, so there's no harming in trying it out and see if you enjoy it.

-Resileus

24447618.review:
Let me start by saying that I never would have tried this VN (or any VN for that matter) were it not for Clannad's anime adaptation. It was my first VN and I highly recommend it. If you are like how I use to be and typically play FPS, RPG, and RTS games but never gave VN a chance, Clannad is the VN to take the risk on. I promise that you won't regret it.

If you like anime at all I'm sure someone has recommended that you watch Clannad. IMO, the anime is really good but assumes you have some additional understanding from the VN. While both the anime and VN are Clannad, the anime and VN tell the stories slightly differently. In the anime, which I think is better understood if you play the VN, most of the routes are somewhat combined so all the characters make an appearance. Fuko's, Kotomi's, Mei's, and Tomoyo's routes are blended fairly well into Nagisa's story (however the anime doesn't do everyone justice, for example Kappei doesn't even make an appearance). In the VN by contrast, most of the routes are fairly separate from the various characters. The anime's and VN's stories are similar in that their primary route is Nagisa's but each approach the story differently. 

The strength of this VN is that there is more dialogue, alternate routes, and information not provided in the anime. I also had some of my questions about the anime answered by the VN's explanations. That said, the VN is long and if you aren't into reading then you may prefer to just watch the anime as you will cry just as much watching the anime as you will playing this game. If you are like me however, this VN will have won you over to try other VNs (Edit: If you like Clannad you may like Fruit of Grisaia, another long multi route VN with a good story that can be found on Steam). I plan on picking up Tomoyo After in the near future (Edit: I later did and it is also good but short).

TLDR: If you've never played a VN before give this one a chance. If you still can't be bothered to do that, at least watch the anime. I think it is one of the best anime's I have ever watched.

24255510.review:
[h1][b]Warning:[/b] Terrible formatting ahead[/h1]

TLDR version: This is top quality stuff.

Long version:
Clannad is my second favorite visual novel by KEY, and pretty much my second favorite visual novel overall. It's a very heart touching story about family and self improvement. KEY has done a very good job here, especially Maeda Jun for contributing to approximately 75% of the scenario writing, as well as composing some of the music for the soundtrack. I currently consider this KEY's best novel, despite it being my second favorite.

[b]Story:[/b]
As Maeda Jun was responsible for a majority of the scenario writing for this novel, the quality in many routes remains consistent. I'm not certain which parts he did not write, but the other writers did a good job of not tracking off from the overall atmosphere of the novel as a whole, which tends to be seen when different writers work on different routes. 
My only complaint is that there are certain elements in some of the routes that I find very hard to empathize with and blown slightly out of proportion in terms of dramatic effect when considering the situation, however this might not be true for everyone.
The true masterpiece, however, is in the After Story that is unlocked upon completing all the routes. This is where the novel shines, and this is where it will very likely leave a permanent mark on your heart, as it did with me.

[b]Artwork:[/b]
The background art is very nice, and I can't find anything to complain about. The character art, however, is slightly off. The character artist for this novel is Hinoue Itaru, and I'm not a very big fan of her style. Characters' faces just look off. This is my opinion.

[b]Soundtrack:[/b]
Oh boy, where do I even begin. Orito Shinji and Maeda Jun are a match made in heaven. I don't even know how to explain the soundtrack. It's hands down one of the best soundtracks I have ever heard. Even without the novel, the tracks themselves are certain to provoke emotions, unless you hate music. A truly emotional and powerful soundtrack indeed.

24244078.review:
This is the third Visual Novel I read. The first was exquisite. The second was mostly bad. For this one here I have ambivalent feelings but it's mostly... positive. Well, that doesn't say much if I added "as in 51% positive".

What I like is the overall cuteness, the quirkiness of the characters and their chemistry. The protagonist is such a prankster and almost everyone is so naive, making them perfect victims for him. It's pretty heavy on the cheese sometimes. I don't mind it too much but there are some parts that get a little annoying, because it's drawn out and in your face.

You will get a ton of content with many, many voice samples. Don't be fooled into thinking you're done when you see the credits. This is a game that needs to be started over and over. A single character arc could take you 20 hours to complete and there are like a dozen of them. The sheer vastness could be daunting. It could take a lifetime to see everything. It needs to have a lot of content, though. The production density is very shallow so it has to compensate in the quantity department.

This may apply to a lot of Visual Novels, but in this case I find the imagery very lacking. It's not so much the art or character design but the massive use of recycled pictures. There is very little variety. It's missing images to support the actions that take place. Instead a lot is described through text.

The thing about CLANNAD that doesn't match my taste is the aimless, repetitive and incoherent structure. I understand that it's slice-of-life and that it's not plot driven by design. You have to invest a huge amount of time to get something out of it. By that I mean feels. The emotionally challenging parts are very sparse. There are a couple of chuckles along the way. It should be possible to achieve the same depth with less words. It feels tiring in a lot of places, because there is so much dullness.

I had a hard time accepting the supernatural stuff. There is nothing to comprehend because of missing information and that seems contrived. Some of the romance also feels forced and uncalled for. It's not very cohesive or elegant to throw something in for good measure. What I genuinely dislike are the intermissions called The Illusionary World. I find them pseudo-poetic and pretentious. But you will only have to read them once, because they're identical every time.

The way you take character routes is also not very consistent. Assuming you are not using a guide then you will have no idea what went wrong when you reach a dead end that forces you to reload or start over. Some of the flags don't seem very logical, so you can't possibly know which of your earlier choices matter. It is literally impossible to see all the major narrative parts in one go and you will probably make some poor choices. Fortunately the save system is well cut out for this. And all the conveniences like skipping something previously read are a huge help.

To be completely frank, I think it gets worse the longer it takes. This may only be true for a few scenarios. You need to be very starry-eyed and easy to manipulate to not become cynical midway. All this kitsch and sweetness is hard too swallow, you might get diabetes if you're not careful. If you have the option, you're better off with the anime. It's not so much of a chore and the production value is considerably higher.

If you want an authentic Japanese Visual Novel with a reputation, this is the real deal. I wouldn't buy at at full price, though.

24241216.review:
I was not expecting to like CLANNAD as much as I do now. I'd seen a little of the anime when it came out so long ago I didn't remember any of it, but all I had to go off of was that it was good. In action, CLANNAD turned out to be so much more than just "good."

Your choices will matter in large and small ways, and there are even hidden secrets throughout the game you might stumble on depending on your choices. The characters and stories are all rich and will pull you in, and by the end, you'll probably wish they hadn't when it's finally all over - because the moment you go back to the title screen with the realization that there is no more left is probably one of the biggest tearjerkers in CLANNAD, and make no mistake, there are many of them.

This is the kind of visual novel I wish people were playing more of, the kind of visual novel I wish the genre was represented by. If stuff like Nekopara and the Sakura series of games are akin to junk food and snacks, then this is a rich, full course meal, with something for more than a few tastes on its spread. 

Whatever price you see it at, if you are a fan of visual novels, or just sitting down for some reading, when it comes to whether or not you should pick up this game, the answer is probably going to be "yes," "yes," and "yes" for you.

I have some minor issues here and there, but they either pale or become completely forgettable in comparison to what a satisfying and thought provoking experience CLANNAD was overall.

10/10

24175408.review:
Making this review as I just hit the 50 hour mark at the completion of my 5th route. I bought this game while it was on a half-off sale because I had just finished watching the two anime seasons and immediately came to regard Clannad as the best anime I've ever watched. The anime made someone like me, who didn't even feel sad while watching various other emotional anime, cry for a whole day. Two days even. Maybe even three. Of course, when I finished it I just had to go get the visual novel.

Purchasing the visual novel was a great idea. I know full well what I'm getting into when I go into most of these routes. Of course I do, I watched the anime, which covered a lot of these. However, it didn't feel any less emotional when they hit me. In fact, I've cried about things while playing that I didn't cry about while watching. I've done 5 routes in 50 hours, so that's about 10 hours per route for me. That's a lot of time I'm spending getting as much dialogue as I can from certain characters, and I end up getting more attached to the characters in the game than I did in the anime. I can't help but feel sad when it's time for the emotional punches.

Clannad is known for its sadness, and its sadness is something I couldn't resist myself, to the point of tears. However, at the end of the day, Clannad has always made me feel more happiness. Both the anime and the game have given me lots of happiness. The characters are all charming, the romance is adorable, and I find myself laughing like an idiot at some points. Sometimes I'll find out my mouth hurts because I've had the biggest grin for a while. I absolutely love the game's soundtrack, both the upbeat and the sad music.

I don't dislike a single thing about this game, and I can only have more great experiences as I continue to play this past the 50 hour mark. I just had to give it a positive review. Clannad is a masterpiece.
