19740434.review:
Id like to preface this review by saying I maybe a tad bit bias in this as I absolutely love Clannad, I have the Manga, the Blurays, the 10th anniversary art book and even a boxed copy of this VN, so yeah just keep that in mind while reading this ;)

Now, I have been waiting for a long time to get an official English release of this VN and my patience has finally been rewarded, though Clannad has a high price tag I hope in the following words I can convince you that it is worth every cent, for Clannad is much more than a simple story you grow attached to every character, and with the huge amount of choices there is so much replayability; anyway lets get started shall we.......

In my humble opinion Clannad is the best representation of life, friendships, love and loss. It shows purpose, fulfillment and satisfaction can be attained and at the same time it teaches people that the most unexpected things can sometimes come from the most unexpected person. It will show just how far an ordinary man will go just to help his friends and family. 

Clannad has many different arcs that are just as good as the last, the choices you make throughout Clannad can alter your entire experience, it has a beautiful story and many touching moments, those who are looking for drama, romance and slice of life genre look no further for Clannad is exactly what you are looking for.

What truly sets Clannad apart from other visual novels is its clear representation of emotions. I would highly recommend this VN to anyone, it is well worth the money and has a very enjoyable story, it has excellently designed characters which are so incredibly believable; specifically with their personalities, as you keep reading the VN you will notice changes with each character, and you will come to love each and every one of them. 

Overall to be honest this VN is a must own, I believe that most people will be able to relate greatly with Clannad. 

I hope that this review has helped you in your decision in getting this VN and I hope you will enjoy the whole experience as much as I have; there is also a second VN that you should check out if you enjoy this one that being [url=http://steamcommunity.com/id/ALlEN_KlNG/recommended/420100/] Clannad Side Stories[/url] I have also done a review on it if you wish to read my thoughts on it.

I will finish by saying; Clannd is not only my favorite thing on steam but the anime adaptation is my favorite anime of all time, if you are so inclined I'd recommend you go check that out too; happy reading :3

p.s. Im very passionate about Clannad and thats the reason I have so many hours.

(Like all my reviews I do not put a score as it is my belief that games like all forms of art are subjective and therefore it is impossible to afix a number to them)

19690691.review:
First off: THE PRICE. It is worth it, my friends. Visual Arts/Key is hard to come by on steam. we know this! I understand it is hard to swallow, but the updated graphics and everything else is more than worth it. with relatively 300 hours of gameplay, this is not your run of the mill VN.

EDIT: I have 100%ed the game and it took me roughly 70 hours, but that was with speed reading and autotext. This was a very heartwarming and tear-inducing tale - but it elicited many laughs from  me as well! With 22 achievements, most being different routes, this game has something for everyone. Just when I think it's getting a little too sappy it gets funny, and vice versa.

I would definitely recommend this VN to any VN fan, it has something for everyone's taste!

19683243.review:
Nach dem unglaublichen Erfolg des Animes, ist nun endlich auch das originale Spiel CLANNAD in Europa verfügbar!

Das Spiel an sich zeigt die typischen Merkmale des Visual Novel Genres und muss sich somit primär in Story und Charakteren beweisen, da man hier aufwendige Grafiken oder sonstiges natürlich nicht erwarten kann. Und gerade das macht es umso eindrucksvoller, wenn das Spiel ohne viel drumrum trotzdem auf ganzer Linie überzeugt. Die Geschichte ist unglaublich tiefgreifend und hängt stark von den Entscheidungen des Spielers ab. Die Dialoge (die letzendlich Hauptbestandteil des Spiels sind) sind stets abwechlungsreich gestaltet, und unterhalten einen entweder auf humorvolle Art und Weise oder nehmen einen emotional total mit. Unfassbar interessante Charaktere, die man im Laufe des Spiels immer besser kennenlernt sorgen dafür, dass man die ganze Zeit auf neue Wendungen trifft und ein großes Interesse an den Entwicklungen der Personen hat und gespannt ist neues von ihnen zu erfahren.

Die vielen möglichen Entwicklungen und Enden der Geschichte sorgen für sehr lange Spielzeiten und motivieren zum weiter spielen mit anderen Entscheidungen in der Geschichte. Ebenso ist es möglich eine After Story (bekannt aus dem Anime) freizuschalten, indem man alle relevanten Enden spielt, und die sog. "Light Orbs" sammelt. Somit bietet das Spiel einen enormen Umfang, der einem langanhaltenden Spielspaß garantiert.

Die musikalische Untermalung ist absolut grandios und zu jeder Situation passend und stimmungsvoll. Auch sind alle wichtigen Charaktere in japanisch vertont (abgesehen vom Protagonisten selbst). Optisch sind die Charaktere sehr schön gestaltet und wirken dadurch sehr lebendig.

Als Fazit kann ich dieses Spiel jedem weiter empfehlen, der Fan des Animes ist, keine Abneigung gegen Visual Novels hat und über halbwegs gute Englischkenntnisse verfügt. Sicher kann man sagen, dass es schön gewesen wäre, wenn es die ein oder andere Animierte Szene im Spiel geben würde oder ähnliches, aber gerade dadurch, dass das Spiel so einfach gehalten ist und trotzdem überzeugt, lässt es zu einem Meisterwerk werden.

19646156.review:
CLANNAD [url=https://vndb.org/v/all?q=;fil=tagspoil-0;o=d;s=rating]is one of the best visual novel ever made[/url], and finally is available in Steam. While the translation from Sekai Project is far from perfect, it is more polished than the fan translation that is available on Internet*. And Sekai Project really made an effort to make this the best CLANNAD release ever, including extras not available in the original PC release like voices, HD asserts, Dangopedia and Archivements.

*: Sekai Project seems to have fixed most translation problems in the original release. I didn't personally replayed this game yet (again), so I can't say for sure, however it seems that Sekai Project really wants to make the best release of Clannad ever.

Is it worth the $50? Yeah, it is a step price for a visual novel. However, visual novel are more like books than games, and the word count number for CLANNAD script [url=http://gaming.wikia.com/wiki/List_of_longest_video_game_scripts]is bigger than the whole Harry Potter series, or almost thrice as big as The Lord of The Ring trilogy[/url]. So I think it is a good price, considering the effort to translate everything. Just FYI, this is my second playthrough of this VN (the first one was using the fan translation). I finished all routes and did all archivements, using a walkthrough so I wouldn't waste too much time going nowhere in the story, and my reading speed is pretty average. So around 100 hours is a good average of time that you will spend reading through everything.

And like lots of reviews already said, yeah, you're going to cry. However, not only about the sad things, but from small piece of happiness that occurs in the progress of the story. This is a VN for everyone, it does not matter if you're a man or women, child or adult. This is my second time playing it (the first one was the fan translation 3 years ago) and I still cried for different reasons.

If you never heard of CLANNAD before, just play it. Don't bother watching the anime or reading the manga adaptations first. It is not that they're not good, the anime at least is very good (I never read the manga), however it does miss some of the small details that makes this work awesome. I do recommend you to watch the anime from Kyoto Animation (forget about the movie, it is bad, really bad) after playing the VN though, since there is some scenes that simple are better animated.

19578244.review:
Don't let the expensive price haunt you. Though $50 is a lot of money for game, much less a visual novel, it is definitely worth it. Clannad is one of the greatest visual novels of all time. If it helps you, go see the anime if will help make up your mind wether this is worth the buy (anime only covers one route). 

Plot - 5/5 The plot can be slow as sometimes one single day in the visual novel can take half an hour or more to finish. But it is worth it, as it has an amazing plot. Especially After Story. Anyways, the visual novel has many routes, and if you've watched the anime, basically every girl has a route of her own. There are also some other routes other than the waifu routes. There is also unlocking After Story, which takes a lot of time. So this visual novel isn't a quick 3-10 hours - it will probably take over 100 if you want to finish all routes and clear the game. You will also get many choices throughout, not leaving you to just watch without actually doing anything. Many choices are important, and can sometimes lock you into certain routes.

Art - 4/5 Some may not like Clannad's unique artstyle. At first I was unsure but quickly got used to the interesting artsyle. Sekai Project also did a great job of improving the quality of the overall game. Backgrounds are great, as they actually include people in them and there is some variety to some backgrounds. (e.g classroom has a few backgrounds depending on the time of day)

Sound - 5/5 The soundtrack for Clannad is amazing. Each song can easily fit the mood and current scenario. It is also a pleasure to listen to. It was also a nice bonus for Sekai Project to get the original voice actors from the anime (excluding Tomoya).

Characters - 4/5 Each character gets their own moment to shine. Almost all characters have a route, and each character has a unique personality. Most are very likeable as well. 

Overall - 5/5
Get this game if you are a fan of Clannad, or if you want a nice visual novel to play. Highly recommend. If you are not able to get it at the price it is at, it is definitley worth getting the game on sale.

19578162.review:
As a fan on anime, manga, light novels, and visual novels, I'm well versed in many forms of these Japanese mediums.  But playing through Clannad will always be one of my most precious memories.  With an incredibly well-balanced plethora of genres, this VN has something for everyone.  Comedy, tragedy, mystery, romance, action, drama, etc..  On top of that, the visuals are stunningly beautiful, and the voice actors and actresses did a fantastic job.  The storylines are amazingly deep and interesting, and you can't help but fall in love with all of the characters.  And you can never go wrong with Jun Maeda being in charge of the musical direction.  The only bad thing I can say about it is that there are a few minor spelling and grammar mistakes.  Other than that, it is a flawless work of art.

Key Studios is famous for their visual novels, and by playing through Clannad, you will understand why.  Whether you've played hundreds of VNs or you haven't played a single one, I highly recommend Clannad to anyone and everyone.

Sound:10/10
Visuals: 9/10
Story: 10/10
Translation: 9/10

19577481.review:
I'm really enjoying this game. The characters are great, and their stories are emotionally heavy and beautifully told.

I don't have a lot of prior experience with visual novels, but this feels like more than just a Choose Your Own Adventure book. It feels like there's stuff going on in the background no matter which areas of the story I choose to explore for any given playthrough. For example, I'll play through one game, and catch a glimpse of something another character I'm not spending my time with is up to. Then I'll play through a second time, focus on that character, and get their backstory. Then I'll play through a third time, do stuff with another character, and see, yet again, another facet of that first character's story. It's really interesting.

A lot of people complain about the $50 price for a visual novel. I do expect that price will go down after a while and agree that it should, But for me, it was worth it to pay $50 to ensure this beautiful localization even exists (I got it through the kickstarter). If you're impatient to try it out and can afford it, just drop the full price. You won't regret it.

19566031.review:
[b] 深知拙文并不属于游戏评测这个范畴。但是这全都是我内心深处的独白，与其让它永远的雪藏在内心深处，此刻我愿意拿出来，做下终结的标记。也许这样做，到头来可能也只会埋葬在时间的长河里，抑或在快要忘记的那一刻忽然回忆起所经历的感动与共鸣。如果对您产生了困扰还请见谅。[/b]

       讲个故事。是关于一个死宅的。
       或者说，他曾经是。至少在接触CLANNAD之前。
-------------------


       多年以后，每当他坐在电脑前面对着Cl，准会想起初一下学期的一个周日的下午。当时他还是个乳臭未干的小学生，并不知道什么是二次元。无意间看到一部叫做《loli的时间》的动画，单觉得主人公凛很是可爱。于此开始追漫画，正式入宅。

       那个年代，每个班上的男生的兴趣无非篮球与风靡一时网游：比如科比和詹姆斯，毒奶粉和CsOl；女生追求的莫不是廉价青春小说中的肤浅的恋爱。虽然与所谓的主流审美潮流背道而驰，但他还是试图追随大众步伐。他玩毒奶粉，但是每次组队刷图总会被落单；他学打篮球，但是因为菜每次只能站在场外。他生性害怕寂寞，却开始自我封闭：慢慢得他觉得二次元是那么美好：朋友真挚的友情，可爱单纯的女生，槽点满满的日常…这对于一个少有朋友没有生活的阿宅来说是多么具有吸引力。矛盾在这里集结，乖离在这里激化。很快他沦陷，开始抗拒与外界交流。他变的容易沉默，他与别人说话时会焦虑，他处不好与同学的关系，他身边的朋友越来越少。他变的敏感，自卑，甚至自暴自弃，他觉得自己愚笨呆板，他把怨气发泄在父母上，平均两天和他们吵一次架甚至激化到每次都会动手。现实与二次元理想乡的生活碰撞所带来的失望焦躁无趣逐渐凝结，化成了尖锐的冰刃，伤害了自己，也伤害了周围的人。但是他自己没有感觉，他变的乖戾无比。
       没有实感的时间、无趣味的日常。六年时间转眼过去他即将面临高考。成绩普通，很少朋友，埋头在二次元不可自拔，当时迷上了东方。“此生无悔入东方，来生愿入幻想乡”，他想。一两个同死宅的朋友，每周周六固定会进ACG杂志的书店。他觉得生活过的很幸福。但是直至一日晚自习，他从朋友手里抢过来了一个纸模起，

       [b] 她就是古河渚[/b]
       春季校服的古河渚，双手提包放在身前的古河渚，眯着眼微笑的古河渚，脚下画着大大小小的团子的古河渚。
蟑螂头女孩单纯的笑容里似乎有种魔力，好奇心下他决定去接触这部足以改变了他一生的作品。本以为自己已是麻木不仁，
但是当他看到风子化作风消失在空中，他哭了；看到琴美打开手提箱阅读双亲遗文，他哭了；看到古河渚的父母怒吼的独白，他哭了；最后的最后，看到话剧部黑板右下角古河与朋也的涂鸦，眼泪依然不自觉的流着。
       瞬间他意识到，自己所追求的的，所遗失的，所害怕的，这部作品不都已包含的透彻？朋也在遇到渚之前的生活是不就是他生活的写照？如同行僵，厌恶一切，家庭冷漠，情感流失。但是朋也遇见了他的救赎者——那就是渚：两颗孤单胆怯的心灵互相碰撞，互相搀依着走下去，即使前路遥遥，只要能感受到对方的温暖又有何惧？而他呢？把自己全部的热情希望都寄托在二次元里，的确收获了一阵快乐，但梦醒之时，便是现实与二次元剧烈反差所带来的的不安与失落吞噬之刻，何来温暖？何来回应？何来解脱？
       这便是一大悲哀，孤独者，与生孤独。对他而言，一切无非逃避罢了；

-------------------


       看完第一部动画后，他又连着每天熬夜看完了第二部。在看完第二部的第早上醒来时，发现枕头湿了大半。
       该及时退出了。他想。我只是一个旁观者，一个路人。这一切是那么美好那么温馨。我这丑陋的失败者又怎能去触碰这完美无瑕的故事呢？

       但是呐，他还是放不下，放不下他所深爱的这一切：
       无论长长的樱花坡道，灰尘满布的话剧部教室，时间静止的旧图书馆，温馨小巧的面包店，无边无际的花田。他都用近乎乞求的姿势凑上前去呼吸鲜活的的气息。他在这里找到了慰籍与疼痛，找到了幻想与现实，在时隔多年后又找到了活着的感觉。他见证了渚的双手终于和朋也紧握，见证了朋也的改变，见证了他们的幸福。但是造化弄人，渚的逝世他为她心碎，汐的离去他为他流泪。朋也用最恶毒的言语诅咒这个小镇，却又在小镇的帮助下找到最终的宿命。当世界尽头和冷酷仙境最终融为一体，当幸福结局给一切画上了圆满的句号，他忽然发现自己并不是被朋也和渚的故事所感动，而是被这个小镇，这个包含着完全理想化亲情，友情，爱情的羁绊的集合体，小镇给了他们希望，也伴随有失望。但这是都必然的，谁没有消极的经历？与其停滞在过去的阴影，为何不奋力忘记过去的伤，用自己的双手去构建属于自己的小镇？
       
       不知不觉的，他突然开始向往现实生活、 
       “也许，现实也未必有那么差呢”他想。“是啊，所以说第一步，一定要要好好地、好好地给父母道个歉、才行呢。”
       “那么再见了，渚，朋也，还有汐，谢谢你们，谢谢你们所教会我的一切，还请你们一定要幸福，永远永远的幸福下去哦。”

-------------------                                                                                                                  2015/12/8(sun)    am:0.25
                                                                            
最后，感谢您与我分享这一切。

19559851.review:
Poxa, um Update de 200mb só para adicionar a Ushio nas opções de configurações chega a ser triste... pelo tamanho, esperava algo a mais como uma modificação da SEEN.TXT contendo alguma alteração tecnica, etc.. (como programador dessa engine, analizei a fundo o update)

Deixando isso de lado, vamos a minha analise do jogo (não tenho tantas horas jogadas, mas é o suficiente para dar meu argumento).

O jogo é bom (como eu ja estou acostumado com o Clannad Full Voice, tanto como tradutor Pt-Br dele quanto jogador) tem suas sutis mudanças (a mais perceptiva foi a trilha sonora do "hip hop" do quarto do sunohara, que foi re-feita), o Dangopédia foi algo interessante de se observar (um dicionario de termologias e referencias), semelhante ao comando Gloss presente na programação do Full Voice.

Seus archievements são um poucos extensos (cada rota 1 meta, todas as rotas outra meta, cada rota errada mais uma meta, e etc...). O "HD" dele é bom tambem (reaproveitado a resolução presente nos consoles [xbox / ps3] por ser Hd do mesmo jeito), mas deveriam trabalhar na engine para a nova geração de visuais novels (resolução 1080p, widescreen, essas coisas).

Eu recomendaria esse jogo, mesmo o preço sendo salgado, ja que planos para o Pt-Br as desenvolvedoras (Sekai Project e Key/Visual Art's) não possuem interesse (e suporte) nisso.

Então é isso, aguardem algum saldão que de +50% de desconto em cima dos R$91,00 e fica de cabeça tranquila que será um bom investimento.

Marquinhos Samurai

19532673.review:
The mechanics of the game are simple and plain, however the entire package  is a cluster of emotions raging from unfathomable sadness and loss to genuine happiness. I would HIGHLY recommend following the Clannad walkthrough guide on the Kazamatsuri web site. Without it, you may be hard pressed in figuring out what it is you're supposed to do. This game is basically like reading a book with added audio and soundtrack. Also, you must complete the game numerous times (while altering your choices) in order to experience all the routes. The first route for me (baseball route) was nothing special imo but it works as a good introduction for all the characters in the game. The proceeding routes from there are impactful personal stories of each of the characters. It is also important to note that while the game is not exactly a fantasy genre, it does employ fantasy elements such as the orbs of light that you collect as well as the Illusionary World (all of which become relevant in After Story). After Story is considered to be the "main" story and is unlocked after collecting 8 light orbs obtained throughout different routes. (The skip diolouge function makes this much faster to get through). 

I personally loved the story telling of the game and the emotional ride was unforgettable. If you don't mind reading, I would highly recommend this game.

19472974.review:
说实话这是我第一部流泪的动漫，以前在看fate是只不过是泪光闪烁，但《clannad》绝对是泪流满面。它涉及到太多太多温情，父子，父女，夫妻，兄妹，兄弟，朋友等等。这真的是一部神作，曾经的我只知道热血系，后宫系，大概处于我这个年龄段的动漫迷们都跟我差不多同样喜欢这些类型的。我刚开始对于这类动漫说白了就是无爱，只有像那些动不动就拿起剑去专治各种不服的动漫才能吸引我。人总是会长大的，别说看动漫的是幼稚，或许在某些人眼中动漫跟h，萝莉什么的挂钩，对于这些人我只能说，请去看看关于人生哲理向的动漫在下结论，否则你们没有发言权。动漫里的每一个人物都有其独特的特点，为什么saber会被万千宅系同胞奉为吾王，那是因为其独特的人格魅力。《clannad》被誉为神作也是因为其独特的魅力。
    clannad写作clannad，读作人生。以一个普通人，在国人看来可能是一个穷鬼作为主角讲述了从他高中到其结婚的故事，前后两季一共48集，第二季全程高能，让你泪流不止。写的是平平常常的小事，但却能让人的内心得到净化，并引发对自我的批评与对人生的思考。假如你遇到与主角一样的情况你会怎么办？虽说带了一点玄幻，却不会让人反感。
    其实光是我说还是没用的，自己去看才是王道。在看这部动漫的时候一定不要认为这是一部动画片，这是一部教育片，教育人们如何成为一个真正关心家人关心朋友的“人”。

19379259.review:
EDIT: Okay, I wasn't really satisfied with the quality of my prior review, and although this review probably won't be read, I still want to express my thoughts on the game. 

CLANNAD is a heartwarming story about finding love despite a tragic past and depressing life, and the game puts you in the protagonist's shoes. Prepare for the feels--snickers at the witty and sarcastic humor, "aww"s at the cute moments scattered throughout, and the waterfalls of tears during some of the sad moments (but being the manly man I am, I managed to make it through without crying. Yep. Nearly 40 hours without shedding a single tear...am I even human?) It's probably going to be one of the longest games you play, with about ~1.29 million English words. Granted, this number might not mean much but here are some other works for comparison:

Grisaia no Kajitsu: ~1 million
The entire Harry Potter Series: ~1 million
4 book Twilight series: 591,434
4 book LotR series: 550,147
Witcher 3's script: ~450,000

So basically what I'm trying to say is this: CLANNAD takes you for a ride on a rollercoaster of emotions for a long, long time. Out of anyone else I know, I have the shortest playtime with around 33 hours of actual playing. It's also praised as being one of the best visual novels of al time. I think I've made my point pretty clear, but the only obstacle stopping most people from buying is the steep $50 pricepoint. However, this game will probably take you 50+ hours to complete (I mean every route, every achievement) and paying less than a dollar for each hour you enjoy doesn't seem like too bad a deal. 

Hopefully I convinced you to buy this game, or at least consider it! If you're still on the fence about this game, feel free to add me as a friend or message me any questions about CLANNAD/suggestions for my review! Cheers!

19321284.review:
The long wait has comes to an end and CLANNAD is finally here on Steam! [h1] But was it worth your money? [/h1]
After spending a lot of time reading it, my answer is: [b]Yes[/b], it is. Or maybe [b]No[/b]. It depend.

Having played the game long time ago, both in its native alchemical moonrunes language (because PSVita is dying on western market) and in fan-translated by based Doki, I still find myself coming back reading this novel again and again and enjoyed it everytime. [i][u]Especially[/u][/i] Tomoyo's route.

Talking about the Sekai's translation, I gotta say that I'm a bit disappointed at some point and wish they just stick with the Doki's original translation. I'm not saying they're bad, maybe it was just me being nostalgia with the old Doki's translation but Sekai need to stop doing re-translation of an already fan-translated visual novel. Overall though their (re)translation is good, not great. Most people will be okay with the translation though, but I know some people will complain.

About the content of the game itself? You'll be in for a deep, long and full of suffering treat that you'd better say that the amount of tissue in your room is from masturbation and not from (manly) tears. The arts is undoubtly outdated and overstayed its welcome but then again this is a [b]RETRANSLATION[/b] not a remaster. I wish that Sekai Project get their hand on Siglus and port the whole CLANNAD there but I guess VisualArts hasn't released the SDK for public yet and Sekai Project is being treated like an outsourcing developer (thus why, if you haven't heard yet, VisualArts is going to release Harmonia, Tomoyo After and Little Busters! under their own flag, not Sekai Project's). The art might gets on the nerve for some people, I myself to be honest cannot stand Nagisa and Ryou because their design is just too weird for me (ROACHHHH) but bear with it for the journey you have will be worth it in the end.

Soundtrack is top-notch as expected of Jun Maeda and Shinji Orito, from the low of melancholic to the high of happy, it has everything on store for you that ready to kicks in at the right time. I have the soundtrack on my iTunes and from the playcount apparently I have played most of the soundtrack of CLANNAD and Tomoyo After around the average of 600 times. My favorite gotta be Roaring Tides and Light Colors, and the vocaloid version of Over.

For the story it doesn't have to be explained in this review as CLANNAD is pretty mainstream, but for those who never got around to read the VN nor watch the anime, the story for each heroines varies and I'm sure each one of them has their own entertaining moments just right for any type of people. Ofc [spoiler]Nagisa dies at the end of CLANNAD[/spoiler] is obligatory for everytime CLANNAD is mentioned.

For those who already watched the anime or confused of where to start for CLANNAD, [u]READ THE VISUAL NOVEL FIRST[/u]. I cannot emphasize this enough to everyone whenever they asked about this question. [b] Always [/b] read source material. Granted, this is a translated source material, but one who cannot read alchemical moonrunes cannot complain, can they?

So to answer the question that many have asked, [b]Does this game worth its full price of $50?[/b]
[b] NO [/b]
Only grab this visual novel if it's on sale below $40 or [b] ONLY [/b] buy it if you are a fan of CLANNAD/Keyfags. Or, you know, you have lots of money to waste. If I can be honest myself, for digital download of CLANNAD it should be around $35~$40. That's the reason why I was the early bird backer for CLANNAD so I can get it for only $30.

Now give me Tomoyo After and Rewrite on Steam already VisualArts/Key, I have waited for this day to come for a long, long time ago.

[h1] I'm a Tomoyofag btw. Do not steal. [/h1]

19304720.review:
读作CL,写作人生。

当那触动心灵的BGM响起时，当那泪目的背景图片渐浮时。
曾经的那份对CL的感动，曾经对动漫三周目，游戏一周目的那份记忆，又再次浮现出来。

友情，爱情，亲情全部都在这一所小镇，一群好朋友之间完美的表达展现出来。CLANNAD不仅仅单纯的感动，而是真真切切的能够触动心灵的一部人生读物。看着他们发生的故事，自己又同时感到欣慰。偶尔在生活中，不论是在工作学习时遇到了困难，还是和朋友，上司之间发生了不愉快的事情，总是能够想到这个小镇，这群人。有时恨不得能够成为他们的一员，平平淡淡的生活，没有现实生活中的虚伪与纷争。这就是这部clannad能够给人心灵带来的平静而感动。

clannad，并没有华丽丽的场景画面，也没有跌宕起伏的故事情节，他就是平时这群好朋友之间发生的普普通通地故事。

而贯穿整个游戏的13颗光玉，也是通关游戏的必要条件。就可以概述游戏的主旨。

第13颗光玉：无可取代的率真        Master：藤林杏 
第12颗光玉：包含着悲伤的温柔     Master：藤林椋 
第11颗光玉：合二为一的祈愿        Master：相乐美佐枝 
第10颗光玉：无悔当年笑天真        Master：芳野佑介 芳野公子 
第9颗光玉：治愈的微笑                Master：宫泽有纪宁 
第8颗光玉：无处不在的幸福         Master：一之濑琴美 
第7颗光玉：It's a wonderful life  Master：坂上智代 
第6颗光玉：海星的祝福               Master：伊吹风子 
第5颗光玉：兄妹的羁绊               Master：春原阳平 春原芽衣 
第4颗光玉：家族的温暖               Master：古河秋生 古河早苗 
第3颗光玉：小小的手心               Master：冈崎汐 
第2颗光玉：实现愿望之所            Master：古河渚 
第1颗光玉：男儿的决意、传承的勇气 Master：冈崎朋也

愿CLANNAD小镇的众生们 
在光之玉的守护下 
永远永远地幸福生活下去

19303081.review:
KEY are reknowned for visual novels such as Kanon, AIR, Little Busters and perhaps their most famous one, Clannad. Clannad is a beautiful romance story with the power to make you cry, like most KEY products, and you WILL cry no matter what should you play it through entirely. The novel is hilarious and cute through the rest of it, with enough slice of life intrigue in it to hold your attention. Though it lacks the instant engaging action that their later product Little Busters has, it makes up for it by being utterly adorable! Just prepare to cry, and cry a lot.
Completely worth buying, as this story may very well change the way you view life and the rest of the world.

19298314.review:
首先声明我不是信仰粉，也不是冲动一时的入游戏，更不是跟风党。入的原因是为了能想了解游戏是怎样一个性质，动画也看过，也知道动画的感人之处，也知道KEY社的所有作品都是以抓观众泪点所成名的（排除新作夏洛特），CL游戏没玩过，我只玩过AIR，现在有机会入这游戏也是想回顾一下游戏和动画上的差别在哪，差评理由基本就是价格高了些，同时为了更多国人们认真思考下这游戏的价值地位，相比国外国内对CL的期待度高点，下面就慢慢分析。
1.价格
价格是一个游戏本身游戏内容和游戏性质素质所决定的，成本越高的游戏售价方面就会更高，这些我们都能理解，CL现在是以重制版的方式登录平台的，属于上古世纪的产物，价格方面应该很亲民才对，正是这个价格让玩家们犹豫了，50刀的价格可以让欧美玩家吐血，这价格相信很多人都知道是什么个概念，国区价格便宜一半但价格还是一般人不愿意接受的，原因有很多种下面都会讲解到，在我映像中重制版游戏大多数价格不会太高，比如著名的卡普空的鬼泣4和洛克人合集，游戏方面上会有所不一，价格也很贴心，对比CL就差远了，CL是个不折不扣的AVG类型游戏，其他作品好歹玩法上和游戏娱乐程度上远超CL，是什么原因会有如此高的价格？靠的就是玩家的信仰，只要再贵也会有所谓的“情怀党”和“信仰粉”们买单，也是考虑信仰的时候，你买单了吗？买了之后有认真在玩吗？
2.游戏类型
这是个不折不扣的AVG类型游戏，俗称文字冒险类游戏，一般这游戏玩法单一，内容枯燥，AVG看的都是剧情听的就是BGM，CL都做到了。配音方面感觉有些杂音？感情配得很到位，男主没有语音这点有点不适应，在剧情上，它比一般的AVG剧情感人得多，BGM也是在AVG中数一数二的优美，音乐中带有淡淡的忧伤感，结合人物和场景会有意想不到的融洽。
3.人物和画风
人物造型上，我们要理解，这是一个年代悠远的游戏，画风停留在该年代的审美方面上，我们不能以现在的目光去看待这游戏，对比更早的KEY社游戏AIR可以明显看出画风的进步，AIR的画风要比CL惊悚多了，吐槽画风的是受到当代日漫的萌化美型风格的熏陶所造成的审美疲劳。人物特点上面每个人都有独立的故事剧情，游戏中都一一的体现了出来，在人物剧情方面不是所谓的浪费时间，故事和游戏主线并没有什么关系，但KEY社就是要这样制造这样的氛围。
4.影响度
CL作为KEY社的招牌催泪弹之一作品，在游戏方面，并不是做得特别出名，但在动画上，CL成为了代表ACG的代表之一，但是，越来越多的人把CL捧得太高，我承认动画是不错，催泪程度一定的表现了出来，但游戏不是你所期待的那么高，越是期待的事物失望度就会越高，所谓流传的CL代表着人生只是一些粉丝们所捧出来罢了，在国内外CL厨也不是一般的多。
总评：排除信仰程度来认真看待这游戏，CL是很普通的AVG类型游戏，出色的BGM和人物故事造就了这部作品，至于有没有18X画面嘛…自己玩去！对于这游戏的价格来说，这游戏的销量会让KEY社尝到甜头，也许以后还会有其他作品移植上来，价格八九不离十的样子。至于CL的“信仰粉”们，请你们先把游戏入了再说，好好通关后感受下这游戏至不至于值50刀，想像一下国区没支持人民币的情况下时，你，又会愿意付起这份情怀吗？。

19281658.review:
买这个只是为了补交我"人生"大学的课时费。
从价格上来说你也许会望而却步，但我有权表达我想说的，如果一部动漫能改变你的人生，并修正你的三观，那肯定是Clannad莫属了。
(这两天又温习了一边CL，依然哭成狗，在B站看的，B站正好打广告评测2015最萌，一看里面的这些人物当时就醉了，居然没我Nagisa)
(注意:本篇评测没有任何对游戏的指点，只是还愿而已。我从CL上得到了太多太多。)


09年，我还是一个初中生，那时候天天爬墙逃课，我自己也是因为父母离异等关系各种不争气。
(说到父母离异想起来我小学有个同班同学叫许昌栋，他爸爸是副校长,我上2年级的时候离婚了，到3年级的时候他爸爸跟我们班主任结婚了……现在想来他估计承受的压力比我还大)
每天就是晃晃悠悠的去学校睡觉，晚上跑到网吧打5块钱的通宵。
这么浑浑噩噩的度过了初2，然后到初三下学期根本不想去学校了，就天天在家。
这段时间，生活简直就是糜烂的。去网吧下载起点爽文，彻夜通宵看，撸管，那时候疯狂到3小时一次，下面痛的要死，但也在追求着那转瞬即逝的快感。

就在2010年。
8月。
那个夏天。
那天晚上去网吧，回家的时候发现旁边有个钱包。里面装着800多块钱。可乐死我了。
（因为不上学家里早已经停网好久了……）
很开心的去开通了网络。
然后偶然去网吧玩真三的时候，遇见了一个同样年轻的小伙子。
他似乎看出来我生活的不如意。
他跟我说你看看EVA吧。(说实话看了之后更加郁闷了但确实EVA让我心里很震撼)
然后就算是喜欢上动漫了。
偶然一搜好看的动漫。
Clannad出现了。
那个团子的夏天，那个眼睛哭得都睁不开的夏天。
一直非常憧憬着能有古河一样的家庭，但这只是梦。
AF看到18，19集时，我已经崩溃了，一直在忍但情绪的爆发反倒加剧了眼泪不争气的夺眶而出。
（本人的父亲，炒股炒败了，然后父母一直吵架，到07年打算拼一波，毅然把房子卖掉，出国了。我父亲在US待了8年。期间没回过一次国。今年6月份突然回来了。接他的时候，见了我，说，都长这么高了。[我,1米92]）
现在想来，Clannad被称作人生，不是没有根据的。
哪有那么多人一辈子都顺风顺水的？
然后我就变得积极向上了。是的。
我开始一点一滴从我做起。
我戒掉了手淫。
我开始好好穿衣服。
我开始洗澡。
我开始刷牙。
我开始去我妈那儿看摊子。
我开始萌生出上学的念头。
我上了中专。
是的。从我看了Clannad之后。我在变得越来越好。
Clannad改变了我。
无论怎样！
区区100多块钱。值。

孩子不听话的家长们！还要带着你的孩子去看杨教授吗?还打算带着你的孩子去受鞭笞的戒网中心吗?

无棒球不麻枝！

智代After没看过……据说朋也毁三观……
EVA带给我成熟,CL教会我有爱 :D

19266945.review:
それは人生。もとい大切な人と町の絆の物語『CLANNAD』。
皆さん堪能されておりますでしょうか。
もはや万国で謳われる「CLANNADは人生」とはたしかに言い得て妙であると思いますが、多くの人が「CLANNADはただ人生を描いているにすぎない」と表現に囚われ、思考停止に陥ってしまわないか危惧してしまいます。

人生とは何か。家族とは何か。そして愛とは何か…
読み解くことで広がるそれ以上の世界の可能性――それは幻想世界であり、まただんごの物語なのかもしれません――をいつの間にか見限っていないだろうかと。
そしてそれは、わざわざ冷たい便座に座るようなものではないかと思っている昨今であります。

水洗のように美しい個室の空間にあって、腰を下ろす場所が不快であるならば、その居心地も悪くなってしまうというものです。
そこには何が足りないか、それは光溢れる輝かしい世界を見通す我々の愛に尽きるはずです……それと便座カバー。

[list]

    [*]闲着没事有逛了逛贴吧，竟然有人问包不包含AfterStory？当然有了！AS本来就是游戏的一部分啊。下午速通了全部线，包括AS3周目，完整无删减，放心吧！
[/list]

19262350.review:
Seeing this game on Steam just gave me instant nostalgia. Having played this game in its original language back in 2004, I strongly recommend this to anyone that may be interested in a story-rich visual novel. 

Being a big fan of Key (キー) developed games, I've played, watched, and read AIR, Kanon, Clannad, リトルバスターズ!, and, most recently, Angel Beats! Clannad definitely has the best story and superb soundtracks of all products by Key.

That being said, I have not yet played the English-translated version, the above review is based on my past experience playing on Japanese version. Do not let the high price tag defers your decision to purchase this game, with the amount of content you are buying in, it is totally worth its $40 marks. 

Lastly, if you have not yet read the novel nor watched the anime, just take it slow and enjoy the flow of the story. It is best to enjoy this visual novel spoiler-free and I doubt you would be able to finish it without a several boxes of tissue!

19259291.review:
Having  watched the Anime on Blu-Ray about 7 months ago ( and falling in love with it ), naturally I wanted to get more Clannad relavent content for my mind and eyes to feast on so the first thing I did afterwards was look for a game or VN, but unfortunately at that time they were all only translated in Japanese. 

Come November 23rd and we finally have Clannad in English on steam!! I can only imagine how much longer others have been waiting compared to me. 

Playing the VN takes some time to get used to if you are used to watching it in crisp 1080P on blu-ray before this and the anime had much better drawn characters but the VN gets it's point across to you quite well, only having been in the game for a little under 2 hours now and I have already seen a fair bit of content I have not seen/read in the anime! The VN has all the tracks you know and love from the anime as well. I look forward to seeing the paths of the character relationships as the game progresses and look into getting Okazaki with the other girls and seeing how that plays out, however I think we all know which pairing is the best xD ( dango? )

As a Clannad Fan, I would give this a 9/10 ( More of a personal preference, kind of a tough one since I know this VN is actually from 2004 but me personally just going from the blu-ray anime to this kind of annoyed me but 9 is still great, the resemblence to the anime is very good with the exception of some minor details at times but the asking price of $50 is high in my opinion for an old game which isn't quite on the same level of visual quality as Tales Of Grisaia for example ) 

For people who have yet to watch or know pretty much anything about this series I still highly recommend you get this VN, but if you want better value purchase copies of Clannad and Clannad afterstory on blu-ray then buy this later on when hopefully the price drops some so you can get yourself into more Clannad content as I am currently experiencing! :3

O melhor de tudo são as histórias do jogo.
Cada rota é ímpar e vale a pena participar dela.
Segundo o que foi contabilizado, o jogo chega a ter 300 horas continuas de história.

Estou dando altas garglhadas com as "trollagens" do "Tomoya-kun".
Com certeza eu recomendaria esse jogo aos meus amigos e afirmo que ele valeu cada centavo.

Enfim, 10/10.

Obs:
Algo que eu acho que faltou foi o menu de "extras" com as cenas e as artes dos personagens. 
Nesse sentido, preferi o menu de Grisaia no Kajitsu que contém até os capítulos da história que você já jogou.
Também senti falta de ilustrações na Dangopédia (mas gostei muito do nome kkkk ^^)
Para quem for jogar, prepare-se para chorar no After History. Quem viu o anime sabe do que estou falando ://

Importante:
O jogo é uma Visual Novel (VN) então é composto basicamente de falas que acompanham uma imagem de fundo e uma trilha sonora, e você vai basicamente lendo e fazendo escolhas (a medida que vai sendo imergido na história).
Resumindo, um filme animado interativo onde você pode escolher como a história vai se desenvolver.

19250739.review:
Clannad - это большая вымышленная вселенная, вращающаяся вокруг главного протагониста Томои Окадзаки - проблемного ученика выпускного класса, потерявшего мать и имеющего никудышного отца, не принимающего никакой роли в жизни Томои. Дружит с таким же разгельдяем как и он - Сунохарой Ёхэем. Томоя ненавидит беспросветную рутину жизни, но все меняется после необычной встречи у подножия идущей в гору дороги к школе Фурукавы Нагисы - девочки выпускного класса, оставшейся из-за болезни на 2 год. Визуальная новелла состоит из 2 частей: Школьной жизни и Жизни после школы.
Итак, перечислю достоинства данной визуальной новеллы:
[h1]Сюжет.[/h1] Сюжет делится на 2 параллельно идущих истории:
[Иллюзорный мир] здесь мы наблюдаем за девочкой, оставшейся 1 во всем мире, глазами робота, собранного ей из мусора. Раскрывается он путем развития основной истории, но играет при этом очень важную роль
[Обычный] о жизни Томои и его друзей. Эта история заставит вас как смеятся, так и плакать. Студия Key передала читателю чувства вложенный игру на 100%, действительно интерестно наблюдать за происходящим и последствиями принятых решений, ну а концовка сказать что шедевр - ничего не сказать.
[h1]Персонажи.[/h1] У каждого персонажа есть своя история и им хочется сопереживать. В основном они не типичны и полностью раскрыты, прослеживается их развитие на протяжении всей новеллы.
[h1]Локализация.[/h1] Слушать озвучку Сейю из аниме - очень прятно. Радует перевод на ангийском, а так же русский от команды "Энтузиастов".
[h1]Музыка.[/h1] Саундтреки к игре прописанный на очень высоком уровне, прекрасная работа авторов, в нужные моменты вам будет весело либо грустно, скорее всего некоторые саундтреки впадут к вам в душу.
[h1]Атмосфера.[/h1] Погружению в историю происходит постепенно, благадоря отличной музыке и красивым артам погружаешься в Японскую школьную жизнь с головой.
[h1]Юмор.[/h1] В первой половине его предостаточно и он смешной, по крайней мере с моей точки зрения

Краткие минусы:

[h1]Большая продолжительность.[/h1]Новелла рассчитана на 100 ч. чтения, поэтому как 1 игру для ознакомления с жанром посоветывать не могу, ну очень она уж большая
[h1]Прохождение.[/h1] Скорее всего во время чтения 1 рута вы велетите в меню игру с WTF на лице, ведь пройти игру без прохождения, если не невозможно, то очень сложно.
[h1]Однообразие.[/h1] Из-за плавности сюжета, местами бывает скучновато.

Большое спасибо хочу выразить команде переводчиков "Энтузиасты" за весь труд, вложенный в перевод.
[h1]Эта новелла стоит своих денег , рекомендую к покупке[/h1]

Sekai Project breathes new life into the classic visual novel, CLANNAD, with this amazing release. CLANNAD was the VN that got me hooked on VNs and I wouldn't have started with this genre if it wasn't for CLANNAD. That being said, I can't express just how happy I am being able to play the game on this platform.

19245483.review:
I've only played two arcs of the visual novel prior to this release, but I'm a huge fan of the anime, so take that into account with this review.  CLANNAD is a long-form visual novel that primarily details the life of delinquent high-schooler Tomoya Okazaki during his last years of school and his interactions with the people in the small town he lives in.   It's a comedy and drama mix, full of a hilarious and endearing cast of characters that you'll love to laugh and cry with.  It remains a poignant and enduring work today as a testament to the importance of "family," the impermanence of life, and the consequence of choice.  Great, upbeat songs that can get easily stuck in your head, accompanied by glorious somber pieces that encapsulate the feelings on screen. The art style is a bit of a turn-away for me personally, but it still has great backgrounds and is at least consistent in what it depicts.

On a more technical level, this game is a fairly traditional branching-path bishoujo game.  On a surface level you would expect this to be a very fanservice-heavy, "compliment girls to advance relationship" kind of setup, but for CLANNAD the dating sim elements are very toned down, there are no sex scenes, or really even any fanservice.  Certain routes even follow some of the male characters, who in my opinion are by-and-large much more interesting than some of the more archetypical/tropey female cast members.  Thankfully the more important characters seem to have the most screentime and longest routes.  "Gameplay" exists solely to continue the story in various directions, based on a few small options that lead the main character in a certain direction (for instance one involves simply going to talk to someone you see outside a window).  Most of the actual character interaction is done without player input, so don't expect much heavy moralizing on choices. Specific to this English version of the game is the "Dangopedia," which explains some of the more culturally-specific aspects of Japan, namely things like food, holidays, school life, etc. that us Westerners might not immediately understand.  And finally to those worried about the steep price, please note that CLANNAD is the eighth largest video game script in the world, and clocks in at 1.4 million words, almost a time and a half that of the ENTIRE Harry Potter franchise.  

If you like to laugh, cry, and overall become emotionally attached to a great cast of characters, CLANNAD is a great entry into the visual novel genre, and works well in distancing itself from the more questionable aspects that could keep people away from them.  Though if I could recommend anything to you, it would be the anime. :)

It's definitely worth getting the VN if you enjoyed the anime, as the story in the VN is much more detailed. It took me 1.5 hours just to get through the timeline covered in the first episode of the show, and I'm a fast reader. The show only covers about 20% of what is told here, and that's if you choose to follow Nagisa's storyline instead of an alterantive storyline with another character. To give you an idea on how much content was cut out, the events covered in the first episode of the show happened across three days in the VN instead of one day in the anime. Долгие часы, дни, месяцы ожидания и вот она, вот она рыба моей мечты, выходит из кикстартера в Steam да еще и с улучшенными артами под наши большие современные мониторы :)

[h1]( ' ' ) Dango Dango Dango Dango Dango, Dango Daikazoku ( ' ' )[/h1]

Впервые я проходил эту новеллу после просмотра одноименного аниме сериала, что, однако, никак не ухудшило впечатлений, а даже неплохо так усилило все эмоциональные окрасы, ибо в новелле все смотрится и описывается ярче и глубже.

[quote]Название «Clannad», по мнению одного из сценаристов, означает «клан» или «семья» на ирландском.[/quote]

Clannad - это несоизмеримо яркий представитель ВН романтического жанра с капелькой мистики и, сразу оговорюсь, здесь нет сисек, нет патчей на сиськи и тому подобного, ибо не стоит портить чистого ангелочка своими мыслишками. Для такого типа людей выпустили впоследствии ВН эротического содержания Tomoyo After: It's a Wonderful Life, которая продолжает одну из концовок обозреваемой новеллы. Не играл ибо не очень хотелось портить эмоциональную удовлетворенность после кланнада, хотя смотря на успех кикстартера кланнада возможно в будущем тоже выйдет... Хотя о чем это я, Steam же не пропускает игры с содержанием R18+.

Повествование идет от лица ученика выпускного класса - Окадзаки Томоя, который является ярым пессимистом из-за произошедшего в его жизни. Он до боли ненавидит всю эту серую жизнь и ищет ответ на вопрос - может ли все поменяться? И в один момент на пути в школу происходит встреча, после которой мировоззрение нашего героя слегка изменяется и открывается долгий путь к тем вещам, которые ранее были забыты и оставлены без внимания.

Новелла поглощает сразу и до конца, даруя полный пакет эмоций, неявно подталкивая сопереживать героям и происходящему. Сюжет очень сильный, впечатляющий для всех концовок. Здесь крайне мало повторяющихся реплик, исходя из этого и продолжая свой путь на вторую или третью концовку перематывать прочитанное придется от силы минуты на три в сумме, собственно именно потому новелла входит в число тех, которые полностью "проходятся" за 250+ часов реального времени, если вы конечно не вундеркинд, который читает текст за 1 секунду. Под прохождением понимается завершение всех концовок, финала, нахождение всех секретов и условий для специальных реплик, ведь ради некоторых стоит попотеть для получения удовольствия от неожиданного поворота знакомых моментов - бесценный опыт.

В отличие от аниме в новелле концовки не вплетены в один сюжет и каждая из них является самостоятельной. Каждое новое прохождение ощущается иначе и такое чувство, что это соверенно другое произведение. После прохождения основных ветвей открывается главная и финальная часть всего повествования, перекликающаяся с ранее закрытыми концовками и завершающая сюжет расставляя все на свои места. 

Сий шедевр наполнен прекрасным музыкальным сопровождением, которое идеально встраивается в атмосферу. Не мешает чтению, создает расслабленное состояние - в общем все очень комфортно.

Кстати - присутствует оригинальная озвучка персонажей, что не может не радовать.

Перезапуск новеллы удался!
10 из 10

19243265.review:
Finally, the wait is over! After a year of anticipation and throwing almost all my money at the Kickstarter campaign, our beloved Clannad is here! All you VN lovers should already know that Clannad is a universally-acclaimed masterpiece. But for those who don't know much (or anything) about it, know this: it's one hell of a rollercoaster ride. Clannad will have you laughing, crying, happy, angry, and a whole slew of other emotions. In fact, Clannad (both the anime series and the VN) is the only story that has truly made me empathize with the characters and relate to it in my own life. I dare say it to be a life-changing experience if you open your heart.

While Clannad is almost always described as a romance game, there is so much more than that. While there is a lot of romantic material, Clannad offers an endless ocean of life lessons around family, friends, overcoming hardship, making excruciating decisions, dealing with change, and much more. Clannad really made me take a deep look into my own life and helped me overcome many personal barriers relating to my own family and friends. It has positively influenced my outlook in many areas of my life and I will forever be grateful for it.

Even if you don't think you would enjoy it much, do yourself a favor and pick it up. And if you already previously played it, buy it on Steam! Compared to the original Full Voice version, it has so many new enhancements that warrant playing it again (as if the story alone wasn't enough!). The HD assets, Steam achievements, and Dangopedia are all big bonuses to me. The only things missing are trading cards and emoticons.

And lastly, join the Clannad steam group for all your Clannad needs! We're active and very friendly and love discussing all things Clannad (as well as other games, anime, etc.). You could say we're Steam's very own Big Dango Family! Also, if you ever want to talk about Clannad, feel free to friend/message me! ( ' ' )

19243170.review:
Not only is CLANNAD one of the most memorable visual novels I have ever had the pleasure of reading, it is also what really got me hooked on the entire medium itself. Developed by KEY back in 2004 who are well known for works such as Air, Kanon & Little Busters and the well known anime Angel Beats comes a beautiful story of family and friendship that I think we can all learn a little from. This visual novel is packed with 80+ hours of content, an interesting & funny set of characters, a story that will make you think about your own life and a soundtrack that brings a tear to my eye every time I hear it.

If you have ever seen the anime or enjoyed any of KEYS previous works I urge you to read the visual novel, not only does it add a lot more to the story than the anime but with this release you get HD assets and the Dangopedia to help understand those cultural terms that might not make sense to the western audiance making this the most complete release of the game to date.

If you are a fan of the drama/slice of life & romance genre I recommend you give CLANNAD a go, you will smile, you will laugh, you will love & you will cry.

P.S bring some tissues, you will need them.... not for that you dirty bugger no H scenes here!!!

19243024.review:
สำหรับคออนิเมะทั้งขาหลักขาจร "CLANNAD" คงจะเป็นชื่อที่หลาย ๆ คนคุ้นหูกันเป็นอย่างดี จริงอยู่ที่ว่าตัวอนิเมะนั้นมีอายุเกือบจะครบหนึ่งรอบทศวรรษแล้ว แต่ก็เป็นเรื่องที่ยากจริง ๆ ที่ผู้ชมจะทำใจให้ลืมฉากดราม่าน้ำตาตกในเรื่องได้ ซึ่งเกมที่คุณเห็นอยู่นี้ก็คือ Visual Novel ต้นฉบับที่ถูกหยิบยกไปสร้างเป็นอนิเมะนั่นล่ะครับ

สารภาพตามตรง ด้วยราคาค่าตัวที่ค่อนข้างสูงเอาเรื่อง (เมื่อเทียบตามมาตรฐานของ VN โดยทั่ว ๆ ไป) มันทำให้ผมอดที่จะหยุดคิดเสียมิได้จริง ๆ ว่าควรจะจับจอง CLANNAD มาตั้งแต่วันแรกเลยหรือไม่ ทว่าหลังจากที่ได้สัมผัสกับตัวเกมไปเป็นที่เรียบร้อย ก็ต้องกล่าวว่าตัวเกมทำออกมาได้น่าพอใจกว่าที่ผมเคยได้จินตนาการเอาไว้ ออกจะจริงที่ว่าตัวเกมยังคงติดปัญหาอยู่ตรงที่ความละเอียดสูงสุดที่มีเท่ากับจอเหลี่ยมไม่ใช่ LCD (1280x960) และ UI ออกจะโบราณไปสักหน่อย แต่ถ้าไม่นับรวมขอบดำสองข้างที่ชาว LCD ต้องเผชิญและ UI ที่แลดูออกจะโบราณไปสักหน่อยแล้ว ตัวเกมก็ถือว่ายังคงสมบูรณ์แบบและไม่ได้ก่อความรำคาญใจให้แก่คุณมากมายนักและทำให้ CLANNAD ยังคงเป็น VN ที่ผม "แนะนำเป็นอย่างยิ่ง" สำหรับผู้ที่มีใจรัก VN ครับ

เพราะอะไรคุณจึงควรอ่าน VN นี้:

+ มันคือหนึ่งใน VN ที่ยาวที่สุดเรื่องหนึ่ง (จริง ๆ ผมไม่แน่ใจด้วยซ้ำว่าจะมี VN เรื่องใดยาวกว่านี้ ถ้านับคำรวมทั้งหมด VN เรื่องนี้ยาวกว่าไบเบิลกับมหากาพย์แห่งแหวนรวมสามเล่มด้วยซ้ำ)

+ มันเป็น VN ที่มี Route ยิบย่อยหลากหลายมากและคุณอาจต้องใช้เวลาเหยียบร้อยชั่วโมงเพื่อเล่นให้ครบ (ซึ่งถ้าคุณปลดล็อกครบทุก Route หลักได้สำเร็จ คุณก็จะพบว่ามี Route ใหม่ที่เรียกว่า "After Story" รอคุณอยู่ให้ได้อ่านกันอีกยาว ๆ)

+ มันเป็นหนึ่งใน VN ดราม่าบีบน้ำตาที่ไม่แปลกถ้าคุณจะเผลอน้ำตาไหลออกมาขณะเล่น (โดยเฉพาะในกรณีของ After Story)

+ VN ที่คุณเห็นอยู่นี้ มีภาพและเสียงมาครบ (ยกเว้น Tomoya ที่ไม่มีเสียงบรรยายเพราะเป็นตัวเอก)

+ VN ฉบับนี้ถูกเพิ่มระบบที่เรียกว่า Dangopedia เข้ามา โดยสารานุกรมฉบับนี้ก็คือสารานุกรมที่ช่วยอธิบายรายละเอียดยิบย่อยเกี่ยวกับวัฒนธรรมญี่ปุ่นให้แก่คุณได้รู้ ในกรณีที่คุณนั้นไม่คุ้นเคยกับวัฒนธรรมของชนชาตินี้สักเท่าใดนัก

+ แน่นอนว่ามันมี Achievements ให้เก็บด้วย

สรุป: ถ้าคุณมองข้ามความล้าหลังในบางจุดของเกมอันเป็นผลจากอายุของมันได้ "CLANNAD" ก็คือหนึ่งใน VN ที่ดีที่สุดเท่าที่คุณจะหาได้เรื่องหนึ่ง ถ้าคุณคิดว่าแพงไปก็อาจจะรอลดราคาได้ แต่ไม่ว่าอย่างไรก็ตาม ถ้าคุณเป็นชาว VN นี่คือ VN ที่คุณ "ต้องไม่พลาด" ครับ มันจะเป็นประสบการณ์ที่คุ้มค่าและน่าจดจำอย่างแน่นอน

ปล. เลี่ยงระบุคะแนนป้องกันผู้เขียนหน้ามืดกดคะแนนเต็ม

Before i begin this review, i want to point a few things out, firstly ive never played a visual novel so i wont be comparing it with other titles, secondly I love everything about clannad (if i knew about the kickstarter I would of thrown money at it) and its easily one of my favorite animes meaning I could be seen as biased, Finally I will be updating this as I go along dont worry I will not spoil a single thing as I believe this story must be watched by all VN, anime or by other means.

Finally I love the dangopedia, a databank thats keeps hold of all the words or phases you come along your journey and explaining them in detail once you come across them.

As of right now I can recommend this to anyone who loved the show or likes a heartfelt romance, If youre unsure about it, go and watch the anime as I really believe this story should be viewed by all  (PS buy some tissues).

19242313.review:
Warning: Disliking this game (and this review) is punishable by death.

Methods of execution include being kicked out of a tall building by Tomoyo, being forced to listen to Kotomi playing the violin until your head explodes, run over by Kyou's scooter, and eating nothing but Sanae's bread for the rest of your life. However, if you do not wish to die, you can instead be allowed to live and make a happy life for yourself. But instead of execution, your punishment will be to have your happy life collapse around you, with you being forced to watch those you love and care for most die before your eyes without being able to do anything to help them.

So dislikers, what will you choose as your punishment?

Anyway, CLANNAD is one of those classic VN's that, until now, has never been officially translated. It did recieve a critically acclaimed anime adaptation, and if you have seen that you can basically look at this game as being the "unabridged version". This game is quite old now (2004), so some might find the art a little odd, but the story itself is superb and at the core of why this game, and the anime that spawned from it, are considered among the best ever made.

As for the price tag... it is pretty damn steep. Too steep some would say for a VN, and I'll respect the decisions of those who decide that the current 50$ cost is just too much for what is essentially a story game with some voices and anime drawings. But there is one thing I do have to say about the cost: This is one of the largest game stories ever created. I don't know for sure, but around 80+ hours is the generally accepted figure given for how long it takes to beat this game. That means, at a price of $50, you will be recieving ~96 minutes of game for every dollar you spend. It might be a visual novel, but that is still a hell of alot more bang for your buck than most Triple-A game releases these days.

For those who do choose to buy and play this for the first time having had no exposure to either this game or the anime before this... enjoy the ride. It's a long one, but very very much worth it. Hopefully your heart won't be crushed too hard by the time you make it to the end. :3

19242225.review:
This is without a doubt the pinnacle of romantic visual novels. Clannad tells a deep story that unlike 90% of visual novels on Steam, doesn't value fanservice more than story and character development. 

In terms of presentation it's great. The artstyle may be hit and miss to some people, however there is a charm to the aesthetic, even if it's a bit odd at first glance. The HD remaster definately improves the quality of the images, when compared to the resolution of the standard edition of Clannad. The music is really good and helps to set the mood of the scenes being shown and the voice acting is very good, even if the protagonist isn't voiced like he was in the anime.

 Clannad is an incredibly long visual novel, in fact it's one of the longest visual novels available. Each route in the first half of Clannad takes around 5-12 hours to complete, depending on the route and reading speed.

The second half of Clannad, which unlocks after completing all the routes of the first half, is easily the greatest part of the visual novel, even if mostly because most of the impactful moments happen during that half. In total Clannad probably takes around 100+ to complete fully. 

I will say that it probably wont be everyone's cup of tea. There isn't much violence or sexual innuendo in Clannad, as it's focused primarily on telling a captivating romance story. It's a very family oriented story, as that is the main theme of the visual novel.

if you are interested in Clannad, there is also an anime adaptation that faithfully follows most of the routes (although omitting some of them completely, even omitting an entire character.)
Overall if you enjoy visual novels, I can highly recommend Clannad. It's incredibly long, but none of the story routes are particularly bad, so it shouldn't be a chore to read.

19240597.review:
Clannad was and still is one of the best visual novels even after 10+ years since its original release. Clannad blends a fun slice of life school setting with emotional drama and romance. Combined with a stellar soundtrack and pretty CG this makes the formula for a great game and a lot of tears. Those looking to only complete a couple of arcs might see that the high price isn't justified and should wait for a sale as I don't see 8 hours of gameplay is worth. Those who are commited to reading everything the game has to offer will be rewarded with one of best stories ever written with about 100 hours of content.

Clannad is about Tomoya Okazaki, (or whoever you name the MC) a teenage boy who is struggling to find meaning in his life with his high school days slowy disappearing. One day on his way to school, he meets a strange girl, Nagisa. He sees her attempting to motivate herself to go to school and keep moving through life as well as talking to herself, asking herself how to move forward when everything changes. Tomoya befriends her and the visual novel revolves around Tomoya and his adventures with him and his friends in this slice of life novel. I really don't want to spoil anything and recommend you play if without any spoilers. If you didn't watch the anime I highly recommend playing this first and then watch the anime after.

Clannad has one of the best original soundtracks ever, beautiful art and CG, and one of the bests characters and stories for a game. If you're looking for a waifu game you'll like this game, but the game gets more deep than that after multiple arcs and playthroughs. Each main arc generally revolves around a girl and each arc has it's own story and not a variation of the same story. You can pour about 100+ hours into this game just to experience every arc and every arc is different with different characters focused on and the main plot and driving action being different. This is almost like 10 novels in one, so there replay value after you finish an arc is huge. I recommend this for anyone looking for a visual novel or want to start reading visual novels

-The characters are extremely lively and unique. From your best friend, to the the boys dorm manager. Most of the characters you will end up liking by the time their arc is over. Some of the character arcs are lively fun and full of laughter and some will ultimately make you sob. The overall story is beautiful and I think everyone should experience every arc including the After Story arc which is unlocked after finishing every arc. Even after finishing the main After Story, you'll need to play it a couple more times. And every time you do you'll need more tissues.

-Gameplay is you basic visual novel gameplay. There are very few interactables and even those are simple. You get to make A LOT of choices though. These choices aren't your typical go hang out with waifu B to end up with her in the end. The choices you make impact the game a lot and some arcs require specific actions to complete and you might get a "bad ending" as a result which might turn people off. I recommend a guide if you get stuck because it'll be fustrating to get "bad endings." But try to play the game without spoilers. If you watched the anime then go ahead and use a guide. The anime grazed through the arcs pretty fast so there's still a lot unexplored content for you to go through even though you know the main plot. At it's best, you're laughing at all the shananigans and hi-jinks you and you're friends get into. You'll also be crying because the writing allows you to connect with almost all of the characters and you'll generally feel for them. At it's worst which is rare, you'll be reading long passages where nothing significant is happening or you're reading over a passage you already read. (Skip previously read text feature, helps a bit with this) Overall, reading this novel is enjoyable and I found myself changing who's my favorite girl each time I finish an arc.

-The music sets the tone for the game very well. Each track sets the mood of the situation almost perfectly and it intensifies the experience. Clannad is has one of the best OST in video games and is up there with TWEWY and Persona 4

Clannad changed my life. I got into visual novels when I was about in middle school and this novel helped me find meaning in life. I recommend this novel to anyone who was like me, who went to a new school and didn't know anyone and anyone who struggles to find a reason to keep going or don't know what they're going to do with their life. I generally recommend this game to everyone. I gaurentee it will affect your life in some small way. 

Overall I give this game a 10/10. The beautiful music and CG along with a well written story make this one of the best visual novels ever.

19240387.review:
No, this is not a game featuring an Irish band. Or Enya.

CLANNAD is a popular Japanese visual novel that was originally released in 2004, developed by a company called Key. Having been translated to English by fans in the past, this is the first official English release, courtesy of a Kickstarter started by Sekai Project in 2014. This iteration includes HD visuals (which I believe are from the PS3 version), Dangopedia (to explain Japanese terms, culture etc.) and Steam achievement support.

I am not going to say very much about the story at all because it is extremely spoiler heavy, so beware of looking up almost anything to do with the series if it is new to you. It is difficult to specify an exact genre, but drama, romance, slice of life and supernatural all fit rather appropriately.

The Steam tag of “Story Rich” could not be more apt. The word count of CLANNAD surpasses a number of books (combined) in classic literature. That does not automatically make it great, but this volume of text feeds and gives flavour to the many rich and different story arcs and endings that are available within the game. This means there is well in excess of over 100 hours if you want to read and see absolutely everything. CLANNAD is not a kinetic visual novel so this means gameplay requires you to make many decisions throughout the game which will impact the story.

The story is an emotional rollercoaster like no other and never falls short in the ‘feels’ department. As a result, I would struggle to see how the game and story could not have an impact on your future outlook in life. Yes, it’s that good.

Character development is of the very highest calibre and you can simply not help but admire and love all of the different characters; feeling and sympathising for them as they suffer through various trials and tribulations. There are of course, some stereotypical characters traits, but character individuality is strong and always shines through.

The graphical style is excellent with plenty of variation in computer graphics (CG) throughout the game. Environments are colourful and vibrant which fit well to the various settings and key points in the game and some are nothing sort of stunning. Having said that, I do personally still prefer the art style from the animation by Kyoto Animation in comparison to the art in this game; even though it is the original source material.

CLANNAD is lavished by a soundtrack which, in my opinion, is the best feature of the game and one of the greatest soundtracks of all time. Jun Maeda crafted some of the most beautiful music ever written to fit both the ups and downs of the game. There are so many wonderful tracks, with outstanding piano pieces such as 同じ高みへ (To The Same Heights) and 小さなてのひら (The Palm of a Tiny Hand). There are many other great tracks composed by other staff at Key, such as 空に光る (Shining in the Sky) and 潮鳴り (Roaring Tides), but again – a big warning about spoilers when seeking these out, because the Internet and YouTube in particular, is flooded with them.

I spotted a review online once which quoted: “CLANNAD is the greatest story ever across all genres and media”. I couldn’t agree more with this and the fact that the Kickstarter smashed its stretch goals is no coincidence.

Visual novels are (finally) breaking through and gaining popularity in the west so I can understand some people might stumble across this and be highly apprehensive given the price point and type of minimalistic gameplay that a visual novel usually involves. Therefore, if you are not convinced enough to buy the game then, please; at least do yourself a favour and go and watch the animation (the one by Kyoto Animation). After 40+ episodes your transformation will be complete and you will then come back to buy and enjoy the game.

19239116.review:
Clannad Official English Release, Published on steam by Sekai Project Developed by Key, who has also developed visual novels like Kanon, Air and Little Busters and many more. Through the course of the visual novel Clannad with over 8 heroines for you to choose from to build a relationship with However, there are also 3 other characters, one of which doesn’t appear in the anime those three aren’t really relationship choices but it is more about finding out more about whats going on in the world of Clannad. In total, there are over 11 routes in Clannad. Being themed around family, friendships, bonds, and relationships.

[h1][b]The Story[/b][/h1]
Clannad starts off in a dream like world where everything appears to be covered in snow. This world is called the Illusionary World. There is no life in this world, except for one young girl and a robot made out of junk.
The story quickly shifts to the real world and get to see the world of Clannad through the eyes of Tomoya Okazaki an emotionally distant delinquent student, a student at Hikarizara Private High School. After losing his mother in an incident and subsequently falling victim to an abusive, alcoholic father. Unable to play basketball after that fight, Tomoya becomes a student that just hate the thought of school, showing up late to class and not trying in the classes he does show up to become a “normal” thing for him. He spends most of his time at Youhei Sunohara’s dormitory. Tomoya Okazaki who have a friend, provably his only friend, Sunohara, a blond and is very energetic who is also a delinquent, that is Tomoya’s best friend. Together, the two scrape by school, coming to class only during lunch break, and then sleeping through all of his other classes, and on some days just outright skips school all together.
One day, being late for school, Tomoya comes across a girl who wears the same uniform as him. She is standing at the bottom of the hill leading to the school trying to motivate herself to go to school. Together, Tomoya and the girl, who we find later is named Nagisa Furukawa who is repeating the year due to a severe illness, enlists Okazaki to help revive the school’s drama club. With nothing much else going on in his life, Okazaki agrees to help, making friends with many other students in the school along the way, and overcoming all of the different problems and challenges that they face. From there, the story branches out into many routes.

[h1][b]Routes/Comedy/Progression[/b][/h1]
All of the routes in the main part of the game are balanced very well with humor matched with strong drama, the routes/characters are well written. Kyou is brash, loud, and quick to anger often flinging a dictionary as a weapon. She mirrors Tomoya in many ways as she does show a softer side with how she treats her twin sister, Ryou, and her pet, Botan. Fuko is hilarious with her love of star fish and her suspicion that Tomoya is, “a strange person”. Kotomi, a genius, is very innocent and harbors an obsessive fear of bullies. Those are just a few of the colorful and interesting personalities you will come across while reading Clannad. And finally Nagisa
[i]Nagisa, loves Dango, but has very little self-confidence. Her interactions with Tomoya vary from sweet and cute, to serious, In that sense, she feels very real. She may act childish, but she is in fact very mature,insecure, and lacking confidence in herself.[/i]

The comedy in Clannad is hilarious, the drama is what makes it an unforgettable experience. Many characters have experienced death or suffered emotional trauma in the past, or might be struggling to carve out a new identity. Kotomi’s route, and Fuko’s route stand out in the first part of Clannad as two of the strongest stories. Both deal with heavily with the family theme, and coping mechanisms to tragic events. (I can’t say much here because spoilers..)

We also learn more about the Illusionary World and the two inhabitants of it. by playing through Clannad. The story of the Illusionary World is advanced slowly, and in the After Story, it finally plays a very important part of the story as a whole.
Without After Story, Clannad is a cute, bittersweet visual novel with some very good moments and a great story. With After Story, Clannad becomes something different. It becomes a valuable experience that you will never forget.

The character development is probably ONE of the best I’ve ever seen in a story, the pacing is not too fast or too slow, and the emotions that this story extracts out of you are just unbelievable. As you play through the Visual Novel, you will get attached to the characters very easily because of the character development that Clannad brings to the table. Most of the characters are dealing with issues and many times you will be able to relate to them.
Overall it is a very memorable experience, with all the build up that the Visual Novels offers and then after some time you will start to feel many emotions that the characters in the Visual Novels and… Tears will start flowing down your face. Unless your heart is ice.

[h1][b]Sound and Music elements and Visual elements[/b][/h1]
What makes Clannad great is, the soundtrack. The soundtrack list is very huge, having over 45 different music, 4 of them are vocal pieces. All of the soundtracks are memorable and are perfect in setting the mood of the game having the ability to alter your mood just through music and making you shed a tear. Ranging from from silly to energetic music, to slow, atmospheric songs, that will make you feel time around you has slowed down to a standstill and you’re just indulging in the beautiful music. For those who have watched the Anime, when you start the Visual Novel with the in game menu you will be hit with nostalgia in an instant because that is what happened to me, it’s like everything replayed in my head in that instant just by listening to the soundtrack.
Among all my favorite is, Roaring Tides, I really love it so much it is a really a beautiful soundtrack very outstanding.

[h1][b]Visual Elements[/b][/h1]
There are new features to clannad 1 of them being a HD Upgrade: All visuals have been upgraded to 1280×960
Dangopedia that is exclusive to the english version, the Dangopedia is a Encyclopedia that is a handy refrence tool for understanding aspects of Japanese tradition and pop culture.
Achievements, Clannad has achievements that are steam supported! There’s also an in-game menu to review your achievement progress.

[h1][b]To Sum Up[/b][/h1]
I would highly recommend anyone to read this Visual Novel because giving this a miss means you are really missing out. In fact you are missing a very valuable experience, it will change how you view your world completely. Clannad has a story with a message, a message of showing the importance of family, friends and more.

[h1][b]Atogaki[/b][/h1]
The Art, The Story, The Music, The Characters in this Visual novel is just amazing. The characters surpass any Visual Novels in terms of growth, complexity, and how I am able to connect to them. Clannad is a masterpiece(kamige) in both story telling and character development. A thing i did not mention is that Clannad also changed how I viewed people around me in fact it changed me quite a lot it, because it teaches me to be appreciative to people and appreciate the things you have because no matter how bad you think your situation is there is always someone is out there alone and lonely suffering in a situation far worse than you. It also showed me that people, no matter the ambitions or situation, can live a happy life. It showed a simple yet happy life, it showed that everyone has issues they need to learn from and overcome. Clannad showed me the strength of family, and the weaknesses of it at the same time. It’s a story that everyone can relate to.

19239103.review:
For the past 10 years, I’ve been a fan of the (popular) anime adaptations of Key’s various work including Kanon, Air, Clannad, Little Busters, and Angel Beats. Although I was aware that both Kanon and Air started out as games (Visual Novels), I actually never bothered to play them, especially since they were in Japanese. Even in the recent years, with fans releasing English patches, I never had an interest on playing their respective visual novels. However, having the opportunity to play my first visual novel ever, I figured it would be best if I give it to what gave birth to one of my favorite series of all time—Clannad.

Clannad originally released in Japan on April 28, 2004, becoming Key’s third visual novel. Since then, the game quickly turned into one of the most notable series in the company’s lineup of visual novels. Following the wave of Visual Novels officially releasing in North America, the company decided to work with publisher Sekai Project and finally bring the game to the west via Steam for many fans of the Visual Novel community to enjoy.

Read More: http://www.japanator.com/review-clannad-pc--34545.phtml
 __

TL;DR
Honestly, if you liked the anime but never tried the Visual Novel, then please, do yourself a favor and TRY the Visual Novel. 

I've never been so happy to relive this adventure in its original form. The fact that there's so much stuff that didn't get covered in the anime, not to mention that you're in control of the story is definitely refreshing. If you cry yourself out like a little bitch like myself like in the anime, then prepare to cry yourself out some more like a little bitch during the visual novel.

I really love Clannad.

19239002.review:
CLANNAD is one of the most well-regarded visual novels in the world, boasting an epic 80-120 hours of content; about twice the size of the Lord of the Rings trilogy. It starts off at a very slow pace with lots of light-hearted comedy, but once you begin getting involved with each of the characters' individual conflicts, the story ramps up into some gripping emotional storytelling, sometimes sprinkled with a tinge of supernatural intrigue. The character routes are very worthwhile in their own right, but the true value of CLANNAD is to be found in its final route: After Story. It doesn't matter how emotionally hardened you think you are; After Story will hit you like a sledgehammer with its relentless emotional impact, and you won't come out unscathed.

So, yeah, CLANNAD is kinda cool. Changed my life / 10.

You can read my full review at Kazamatsuri below:
http://kazamatsuri.org/clannad-review/

39419160.review:
Review originally posted [url=https://www.backlog-assassins.net/posts/9bjwoal]here[/url].

9/10

Finally, after one billion years I have finished CLANNAD.

Okay, not literally. And most of that ‘playtime’ is inaccurate, too, I tend to leave VNs running all the time so their playtimes get inflated, but this is a HUGE fucking VN. It is ENORMOUS. It’s probably the longest I ever played, not counting the two When They Cry series. For retailing at 50 US dollars, it had better deliver, and - oh boy - it does.

The joke is that CLANNAD is one of the touchstones of Japanese visual novels, and it will make you cry. The joke is true. I rolled my eyes, thinking, ‘yeah, okay, buddy, whatever…’ but it got me. This friggin early-2000’s dated-ass ugly-looking VN could NOT POSSIBLY be good, right? But jesus christ, it is. It’s a pure slice-of-life dating-sim, but the storylines for each main girl are very in depth, with a huge after story about the ‘main girl’ unlocking that goes through marriage, living together, and even having a child. It’s mainly lighthearted, but that’s only to prime you for the feelings to hit - and when they hit, they hit hard.

What’s nice is that these feelings are genuine and varied. Each emotion beat is distinct from each other, and with a good fourteen or fifteen arcs, at least ONE will be close enough to your heart to pierce it. Striving to overcome your own past or your body’s weakness, forgiveness, finding your family, trying to achieve a simple honest life and never giving up hope - there will be something that will push your buttons.

It’s a VN for VN-lovers, though, and it’s far from perfect. It’s VERY dated, not just in its references and technology (which is actually kind of nostalgic) but also in its weird awkward sexual humor and it’s absolutely awful ‘joke’ arc about the protag suddenly turning gay for his best friend. It’s art is…. frankly, awful, a relic of probably the nadir of the standard anime style, with huge, goopy, melting eyes flowing down right past their noses. You get used to it, but it’s definitely a breath of fresh air not to have to look at them anymore.

Long story short: The OG VN Feelingsgame, the girls are fleshed out, no tiddymonsters, be prepared for it to take forever to read and to have to get used to goofy-looking sprites. Open your heart to the simple charm of the game and keep the tissues nearby.

39336849.review:
Clannad is not just a great visual novel, it is also a great experience that has a lasting impact on anyone fortunate enough to play the visual novel. Clannad is a slice of life visual novel, that deals with romance, past hardship, family and the ever changing world around the characters, and how it either changes their lives for the better or worse. While some may say there are pacing issues i disagree, the writing for this visual novel, is inuitive and allows for the development of  the characters and attachment to characters for the reader.

This is a long visual novel if you wish to fully complete it, it took me over 50 hours (some repeated text skipping) and may take other's longer depending on your reading speed. This may put off  some casual visual novel readers but, i assure you it is well worth the effort to get the fabled true ending and enjoy the enriching experience that clannad provides. This is a highly emotive visual novel and as you will no doubt read is full of feels/emotion in other reviews. This is indeed true and there are many moments that may bring you to tears as the scenario writing paired with the musical scores seek to jerk tears from you. Do not be put off by this though, as there are also moments of joy, humour and inspiration, as the characters face sad truths and situations that are very much a part of many people's daily lives.

For those unfamiliar with aspects of Japanese culture, there is a useful dangopedia that will provide an explanation for some of the words that are used in a visual novel, which i found useful in developing my own knowledge of Japanese cultural practises, food and folklore. The characters themselves provide a wide scope of different personalities, each different to the others which have been shaped by their experiences so far. Comparrisons can of course be drawn to anime tropes this is not a massive problem as it merely represents the many differerent personalities we may all exhibit and is written so as not to be unrealistic.

So overall i would recommend Clannad due to it's enriching storylines, character development and musical scores that provide a life enriching experience, that will likely leave a lasting impact upon your perspective of life, and the many troubles that both ourselves and the characters in the novel face, in the unpredictable, tumultous, joyous and challenging journey that is life. 10/10
